column6: LionsHead understands Federal agenciesäó» complex operating needs, and we partner with the IT industryäó»s leading hardware and software providers to integrate proven technologies into high-value and cohesive solutions. We are a leading distributor of industrial supplies and goods used in operating and supporting the machining and manufacturing industry. Lions Head has developed strategic partnerships with the major systems integration firms. We have extensive experience implementing Oracle, HP, IBM, and a myriad of other vendor product solutions into secure strategic and tactical U.S. civilian and military environments. Lions Head is focused on ensuring customer satisfaction. We put our core business values ahead of anything else to ensure we meet our goals. Our four fundamental values are: Mission:ŒæPartner with each client through structured engagements, and develop and support leading-edge IT solutions that meet and exceed their requirements. Integrity:ŒæHonor our agreements with follow-through and promised deliverables, while taking responsibility for each of our actions, with reliability and respect. Quality:ŒæContinuously seek to improve our quality processesäóîso that customers, employees and our community will hold us in the highest regard. Satisfaction:ŒæComplete customer satisfaction measured regularly through standardized mechanisms. Lions Head is also a specialty staffing firm, offering both domestic and international solutions to firms seeking to find and staff the best people talent in healthcare, life Sciences, IT, and Industrial/Trade positions globally. The Companyäó»s offerings range from permanent and contract placements of (both domestic and internation) personnel, to include certifications, housing, logistics, and continued management of all certifications and other requirements. In addition, Lions Head works with alliances and partnerships to bring Program and Project Management to select Federal and State government opportunities. Founded over 15 years ago by a private equity group, and started as an IT Solutions and Services company, Lions Head eventually diversified into medical and scientific equipment product sales to Federal customers through preferred contract vehicles. The company has since expanded to serve both Federal and commercial clients across its major verticals äóñ growing organically through a strong commitment to customer delivery and through the strategic acquisition of companies with strong capabilities. Lions Head has a very experienced Management Team, with an established track-record of building, growing and managing successful enterprises. Their expertise has been a key driving-force in the companyäó»s rise within the Healthcare, Life Sciences and Information Technology verticals. The Lions Head team, with its passion to succeed and commitment to fulfill customer needs, has achieved: Growth across multiple lines of business in the Industrial, Healthcare, Life Sciences and IT Sustained revenue and personnel growth every year since inception 100äó»s of clients worldwide over the years    Show Less

column6: Dover is an oil and gas company based in Houston, Texas and Tulsa, Oklahoma founded by experienced and disciplined executives with a proven track record of business success. column6: Since 2004, Recast Energy (formerly Intrinergy's combined heat and power business) has used safe, reliable, and efficient systems and business practices to convert cost competitive biomass into green electricity and thermal energy (steam) for industrial customers. Our operations have helped our customers reduce carbon footprints by over 100,000 metric tonnes of CO2 equivalent. The conversion from global fossil fuel commodities to locally grown and sustainable sources of biomass also has helped reduce our customers' exposure to fossil fuel price volatility and secondary emissions such as sulfur dioxide, mercury, and lead. Our facilites are reference points for excellence in the biomass energy industry, demonstrating superb reliability and efficiency. Recast Energy continues to build on this base by leveraging a range of energy solutions including biomass, natural gas, landfill gas, and waste heat recovery.    Show Less

column1: Green Field Pharma Manufacturing in South India
column6: The proposal is to erect and commission a Green Field Pharmaceutical products manufacturing and sales company in South India (Bangalore).The promoter of the company is an experienced hand in Pharmaceutical Operations and brings ethical and compliant ways of manufacturing and supply of pharmaceutical products.The company is attempting to solve one of the key risks that a global pharmaceutical company might encounter in space of manufacturing compliance and competitive pricing and yet being able to market their products for the unmet patient demand.The Indian Domestic Market is around $14.50 billion USD. Out of this MNC have nearly 25% market share which will be around $3.6 billion USD. Out of this, nearly 2/3rd of the volume is made by contract manufacturing companies for MNC i.e. 2.4 Billion USD.Out of the $2.4 Billion USD MNC Contract Manufacturing toll market, the company will target around 10% i.e. 240 million USD.The company would launch quality products for local and export markets. The USP of the company will be Strict Adherence to GMP manufacturing and providing products that can match the quality with Global Standards.The company will initially look at Manufacturing Tie ups with leading MNC pharmaceutical companies in India for a variety of products in the selected category.The Promoter is looking for financing of the enterprise. Majority of the finance will be secured against the infrastructure and land. Promoter will be investing in Sweat Equity by way of management and complete operations of erection, commissioning and running of operations of the plant. Promoter is open to divest some percentage of the company equity to bring in investment.    Show Less

column6: JW Hill Capital leverages its industry and operating experience to buy and build small- to lower-middle market companies.  We are experienced operators, with an extensive network of industry experts and accomplished professionals across many disciplines.  Our focus is on long-term value creation and sustainable earnings growth, not just the transaction. We seek partners who share our core values of integrity, fairness, continuous improvement and transparency--and whose trust we can earn over time.  We partner with business owners to accomplish a successful ownership transition and provide liquidity.   We partner with management teams to create a healthy culture, attract top talent, and build great businesses.  And we work hard to manage risk and deliver attractive returns for our financial partners. Our primary focus is manufacturing, value-add distribution, and industrial services.   We seek businesses that possess strong fundamentals, differentiating and sustainable attributes, and deep customer relationships.  Our selection is based on our ability to improve the robustness of the business with a strategy that creates value through organic growth, operational improvements, and add-on acquisitions where appropriate.  We also target under-performing special situations where our operating expertise is relevant.    Show Less

column6: Starboard Capital Partners is a private equity firm that sponsors and invests in lower middle market companies, with values ranging from $10 million to $250 million. We participate with our network of high net worth, family office, and institutional fund co-investors to partner with management teams and entrepreneurs who are looking to accelerate the growth of their companies. Starboard is actively involved in leveraged buyouts, growth equity investments, and recapitalizations. Most importantly, we actively listen to business owners and look to match our knowledge and capital resources to their transactional goals and motivations. Starboard endeavors to properly align the interests of management and investor, enhance the operations and oversight of our companies, opportunistically make strategic add-on acquisitions, and help to significantly enhance value. In all cases Starboard's principals serve as directors of the firm's portfolio companies and may also serve for a time as officers, if necessary. The principals of Starboard collectively have more than a century of private equity and operating company experience. We have sponsored the acquisition or recapitalization of over 100 companies, cumulatively investing more than $1 billion. column6: Socius Capital provides financing to closely-held middle market companies seeking a partner to replace an outgoing equity holder or to fund an acquisition strategy. From offices in San Francisco, Tampa and Ketchum, Idaho, Socius works with companies throughout the western and southern United States. Over the course of extensive careers managing and investing in closely-held address the needs of selling shareholders of closely-held businesses and then becoming the new partner that remaining owner/managers desire and deserve. We work hard to help drive significant increases in equity value for our partners - both remaining owner/managers and our investors. Our investment philosophy can best be summarized as follows: Back builders of closely-held businesses Provide financing (debt and/or equity) and expertise to proven, profitable companies with business plans that have manageable execution risk Focus on event-driven transactions, such as partnership disputes, generational transitions, growth through acquisitions and recapitalizations to buyout retiring or inactive shareholders Provide flexible capital structures that utilize combinations of debt and equity financing to minimize dilution to existing owners Support portfolio companies through active board participation and by facilitating access to world-class functional expertise to create enduring equity value    Show Less

column6: Braxos Capital is seeking to acquire and operate one privately-held enterprise in the Midwestern United States. Once Braxos acquires an enterprise, our focus is to hold the business for the long-term, carry forward the previous owner's legacy, and create long-term value for the entire organization, including every employee and stakeholder. Resources Braxos Capital is the ideal solution for a business and owner in need of succession planning or an exit event. In order to provide value to the business and its owner, Braxos is able to provide the following resources: Hard-working, principled successor committed to leading the business over the long-term Respect for current employees and owner's legacy within business and community Dedicated Board of Directors with deep operating and investing experience Funding sources able to provide short- or medium-term liquidity to owner Transaction Criteria Braxos Capital is searching for, but not limited to, enterprises with the following criteria: Owner seeking to transition out of day-to-day operating role Revenue of $2.0 to $20.0 million Free cash flow of $0.5 to $2.0 million Historical revenue growth of 2% to 10% per year Historical positive free cash flow for 2 to 3 years Midwest headquarters Seeking new majority owner No start-ups Midwest Healthcare Services    Show Less

column6: Flying Point Capital, LLC is a consumer-oriented lower middle market private investment firm that selectively invests in profitable companies, with competitive products and/or services, doing business in growing markets that are principally located in the United States. Flying Point Capital's "Building for Scale" mentoring program is anchored by a highly practical business management system that has been successfully applied by hundreds of small and mid-sized businesses for almost a decade.Our Principals have significant success as business builders, board members and investors. Our Focus We make control and non-control equity investments in founder and family-owned, owner-operated businesses (äóìOwner-Operatoräóù) that would like to: - Take some capital out of their businesses for estate planning purposes, - Raise additional monies for an acquisition(s) or growth, - Achieve monetization(s) while retaining economic control or a large equity stake, - Partner with experts in helping build their business for scale. How We Help- A Summary We help Owner-Operators meet their objectives by: - Making control and non-control investments that typical provide us with 25% to 75% equity ownership stakes, - Simultaneously helping them raise a modest amount of leverage (typically two to three times EBITDA less normalized capital expenditures), - We support a management operating system for our portfolio companies if they do not already have a satisfactory system to manage matters including vision, people, data, issues and process, making the business more scalable. Our minority stake option is highly attractive to Owner-Operators as it enables them to take up to 75% of their equity value off the table while retaining economic control.    Show Less

column6: Blackbern Partners LLC was formed in February 2010 to seek acquisitions of mature operating companies in the lower middle market. Blackbern is industry agnostic and focuses on special situations, recapitalizations, and high-performing businesses where it can see specific opportunities to add value. The Partnership does not make venture investments. The target investment size (enterprise value) is $10mm to 50mm. For larger investments, Blackbern partners with strategic internationally-connected family offices. Beyond the aforementioned criteria, interest in any investment is situation-specific. The Partnership engages in both time-sensitive and extended/stalled processes and will retain existing management when warranted. In August 2011, Blackbern partnered with the former President of Comdata to acquire Cadec Global Inc., the leading provider of enterprise-class fleet management solutions for fleets that distribute food, petroleum, building materials, and other cargo. Jon Bernstein, Blackbernäó»s Managing Member, was the second member of the Pershing Square Capital Management investment team and has also worked for First Manhattan Consulting Group and Founders Equity. He is currently the Executive Chairman of Cadec Global Inc., Vice Chairman of Corfin Industries LLC, Director of EOL Electronics LLC, Chairman of Minds Matter National, a member of the Columbia Business School Social Enterprise Program Alumni Circle, and a Director of NASDAQ-listed ARC Group Worldwide, Inc. He holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University and an MBA with Honors from Columbia Business School.    Show Less

column6: At ECP, we believe focusing solely on one industry brings with it several advantages. First, because we have reviewed hundreds of potential transactions we have a solid knowledge base to compare opportunities. Secondly, this focus allowed us to develop and maintain an extensive base of contacts among the service providers to the industry including investment bankers, surety companies and brokers and lenders that are comfortable in the space. By focusing on a limited number of investments, we have time for in-depth involvement. Together with our industry knowledge, we believe that this concentration makes us real value added partners for the private equity groups that co-invest with us. Finally, we like participating in an industry that builds real things for real people, like roads, bridges, schools and hospitals. We believe the worldäó»s need for such infrastructure is both significant and growing. In short, we like the long term prospects. By working hard and sticking to our philosophy, we believe we can assist our partners in making significant cash on cash returns on their investments with us. If they are successful, we will be successful. Finally, as we exit earlier investments, we intend to roll increasingly larger co-investments into subsequent transactions. If you are interested in working with us, please give me a call.    Show Less

Corporate divestitures are particularly attractive.  Profitability is preferred but not required.  Total transaction size ranges between $1 - $20 million, and target company revenue level typically ranges between $10 - $20 million.    Show Less

column6: VisioCap was created to execute an investment strategy that outperforms the investment objectives of our Members and delights them in the process.  We believe that in order to consistently deliver outstanding returns, it is crucial for us to focus on opportunities in which we can help create meaningful value appreciation. As such, we target companies in specific consumer goods and services categories - sectors we deeply understand.  Our team has extensive experience owning, operating, advising and successfully monetizing companies across the consumer products sector. As active participants in the industries in which we focus, our team has spent their careers developing proprietary relationships in our sectors of expertise. These relationships advantage us - in our ability to source proprietary opportunities, assess a pospective company's potential, help improve the operations of the companies we sponsor, design and orchestrate value creating opportunities, and execute successful investment exits.  We play an active role in helping drive the investment returns we seek.    Show Less

column6: Lago Vista Capital LLC is an independent sponsor, backed by a team of fully funded, successful investors.  Lago Vista is led by Allen Schaar who brings over 30 years of experience as an executive, investor, entrepreneur and consultant.  Lago Vista Capital LLC acquires and grows middle, or lower-middle market, companies in manufacturing, health care, or business services.  Specifically, Lago Vista seeks acquisitions with enterprise value between $5 and $100 million, with operations based in the United States.  Ideal targets will have strong potential growth opportunities.  While a track record of strong cash flows is desirable, Lago Vista is also positioned to fundamentally improve the performance of the company as a step to realizing the companyäó»s full growth potential.Lago Vista is interested in companies with a talented management team in place who will continue after the acquisition.  Additionally, Lago Vista is particularly interested in acquisitions where the founder/CEO looks to transition their business to a passionate leadership team which will build on the founderäó»s already established legacy, while allowing the founder to monetize the business they have built.    Show Less

column6: AR2 focusses on middle market and lower-middle market private companies in manufacturing, with operations in US, India and China and sales/customers anywhere. We leverage the company strength and our team for skillsets, growing customers and managing against cyclicality.AR2 seeks to acquire dependable cash flow businesses with growth prospects in manufacturing (precision machining, heavy machining, fabrication, assembly) that serve varied customers in automotive, oil & gas, aerospace, hauling, marine, military, trucking, shipping and other industries. column6: D2C Brands is changing the way consumers discover, experience and purchase consumer goods. As the worldäó»s first direct-to-consumer brand holding company, D2C Brands excels at acquiring and growing direct-to-consumer brands that positively impact consumersäó» lives in ways only possible when brands interact directly with the consumer. We leverage our deep experience in online marketing and ecommerce to exceed the expectations of our customers and build extraordinary brand equity. Over the next 4 years, D2C Brands is seeking to acquire 5-7 leading direct-to-consumer brands with high-quality products. We are building a best-in-class technology infrastructure and a team of experienced marketing and brand experts. This will enable us to execute growth strategies not achievable or cost-effective for stand- alone brands. We strive to be the acquirer of choice in the industry. D2C Brands offers entrepreneurs with a viable path to liquidity. D2C Brands has raised $20 million of equity solely for the purpose of acquisitions. Coupled with conservative leverage, we have over $60 million of capital to deploy. With this capital, we offer entrepreneurs a certainty of close, with no financing contingencies. The founders of D2C Brands have a track record. We are experienced in documenting and closing transactions. We work with sellers to help them understand the process.    Show Less

column6: Hayman Properties, LLC is a experienced and disciplined boutique commercial real estate company acquiring value add, opportunistic and core commercial real estate assets targeted to deliver reliable cash flow, significant capital appreciation and most often, both. We acquire assets in CA, CO, UT, Pacific Northwest and TX and focus on the following asset types: äó¢	Office                      äó¢	Medical Officeäó¢	Retail                      äó¢	MultifamilyWe adhere to the Yale and Harvard Endowment Funds allocation and believe that direct real estate investments increase your portfolio returns while reducing the standard deviation. As the GP, we put our own money into every deal while providing accredited investors an opportunity to invest alongside of us and add direct real estate investments to their portfolio as a LP.   Noteworthy is our strategy to avoid competition with REITS, acquiring assets between $10MM - $30MM. We target 8% preferred returns, 7% - 8% annual cash distributions, mid teens and higher IRR's, 2x - 4x multiple and 3 - 7 year holding periods.We manage properties with almost fanatical diligence via wholly owned and operated Advantage Property Management which provides a clear understanding of tenants needs, superior service to the tenants and increased retention.    Show Less

column6: Bilgola Capital LLC is an investment firm led by George Ferris that invests in small dynamic growth companies with strong fundamental business models. I am currently seeking either acquisitions or growth capital investments in small companies with stable cash flow and strong growth prospects. In many cases, the company's founder will have built a successful business but has realized that he needs help to take the business to the next level. With 20+ years professional experience with world class companies as a chief financial officer, private equity investor and investment banker, I have a track record of creating value in multiple industries. My investment capital comes from personal capital and, if necessary, supplemented from a network of partners with a similar philosophy. Unlike traditional private equity firms, my approach involves significant hands on action to drive growth in a non-executive capacity. The goal is to provide the tools to help management be more successful. column6: Allan Grafman is a recognized media operating executive, board director and advisor for growth, turnaround, VC and PE portfolio companies. He is an innovator known for monetizing content, brands and intellectual property for investors and companies, domestic and international, public and private. All Media Ventures (AMV) was founded by Mr. Grafman and three other media industry executives in 1996.AMV is recognized for assisting companies that are raising capital, identifying market opportunities, growing revenue, licensing brands, new business development and timely product release.Mr. Grafmanäó»s board and executive experience includes the following executive operating roles:At Majesco Entertainment Mr. Grafman joined as a Director of this public video game company and was subsequently elected Chairman of the Board. During his tenure revenue increased from $50 million to $132 million, with profits of $11.3 million. He led a sale auction process that led to a successful financing transaction.At the private equity fund Mercury Capital Mr. Grafman was an Operating Partner and Principal. Mercury focused on investing in media, licensing, game and technology companies. He participated in deal sourcing, due diligence, capital raising and portfolio company operations as a Board Director.As President of Archie Comics Mr. Grafman led the monetization and licensing of the comic characters after raising investment capital. During his tenure the company concluded movie deals with Paramount and Miramax, 42 brand license deals for consumer products at retail, and äóìSabrina, the Teenage Witchäóù finalized a seven year TV run.As President and CEO of Modelwire Mr. Grafman led all operations of this venture capital backed ad technology company in the ad agency licensing sector.At Hallmark Entertainment he served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of this $350 million revenue producer of television content. He led the effort that improved cash flow $51 million and supported the launch of the Hallmark Channel.During a 13 year tenure at Tribune Mr. Grafman rose through the ranks, first at Tribune Entertainment and then Tribune Company. At the former he headed finance and business affairs as the company grew from $2 million to $145 million. As Managing Director for International he raised capital for co-productions and conducted world-wide sales and distribution activity.Recruited by the legendary Thomas Murphy, Chairman of Disney/ABC/CCB, Mr. Grafman built broadband cable distribution systems as VP in the Chicago region.Mr. Grafman received his BA from Indiana University (Phi Beta Kappa Honors), Russian Language and Literature, his Masters in International Affairs from Columbia University (International Fellow Honors), and his MBA from Columbia University (Beta Gamma Sigma Honors) Finance.  He began his media career monetizing content as an ad salesman and on air announcer at KSHE Radio in St. Louis.    Show Less

column6: ABOUT BLUE CONSUMER CAPITALBlue Consumer Capital, LLC is a California-based investment vehicle formed by an investor to make an investment in a growing consumer products or services company. The investor was previously the Co-Head of Private Equity Coverage Group at a well-known Investment Bank, and has an extensive history in the deal business. She received her B.A. from University of California Irvine (UCI), MBA from University of Southern California (USC Marshall School of Business) and is based in Southern California.WHAT MAKES BLUE CONSUMER CAPITAL DIFFERENTBlue Consumer Capital is focused on working with a company in the growth phase. In this phase of a companyäó»s lifecycle, entrepreneurs often struggle to find the support they need to grow. In this between phase, companies are often forced to reach out to friends and family, which can include many drawbacks. It also happens to be the phase when they are under the most pressure to perform and make many key strategic decisions to drive future growth. Blue Consumer Capital can help these entrepreneurs. ITS NOT JUST ABOUT THE CAPITAL, ITäó»S A PARTNERSHIPBlue Consumer Capital is interested in investing alongside likeminded founders to help build an exceptional company.  The investor has a broad based knowledge and extensive network of industry experts from her history as an investment banker. She intends to actively provide support to the company.INVESTMENT CRITERIAGeneral Parameters:Control equity investmentEntrepreneurs that are interested in re-investing in partnershipFocus on Western United States. Size:Annual revenues of $2 Million to $15 MillionEBITDA of $400K to $2 MillionSample Industries of Interest:AccessoriesApparel & FashionFoodHouseholdHealth & Wellness Pet     Show Less

column6: Cambridge Wilkinson represents clients seeking $10MM - $500MM of debt or equity financing as well as advisory for mergers and acquisitions. Cambridge Wilkinson also provides a full suite of Specialty Finance services including: Factoring, Asset Based Lending, Purchase Order Finance and Equipment Financing. Our team is industry agnostic and has deep experience across a broad scope of domestic and international engagements. Cambridge Wilkinson provides a full suite of investment banking services for our clients. Our firm has a strong track record of identifying and structuring debt and equity finance solutions, as well providing deal advice in merger & acquisition transactions. We are industry agnostic with extensive expertise in Healthcare, Specialty Finance, Consumer Finance, Real Estate, Sports & Entertainment, Infrastructure, Technology and Transportation businesses. Specific services include: Raising Minority Equity, Control Equity and Equity Growth Capital Raising Debt from Senior Secured to Unsecured facilities Identifying appropriate and strategic capital sources from relationships including large family offices, private equity, hedge funds, bank and nonbank lenders and other institutional investors Developing and optimizing transaction and capital structures Providing comprehensive transaction management, from investor introduction to the close of the transaction Introducing strategic partnership relationships to our clients in conjunction with capital raise efforts M&A Advisory All securities transactions executed by FINRA registered representatives of Source Capital Group, Inc., 276 Post Road West, Westport, CT 06880; (203) 341-3500. Member FINRA/SIPC. Cambridge Wilkinson, LLC is not otherwise affiliated with Source Capital Group, Inc.    Show Less

column6: BCC Capital Partners is a full-service investment banking, commercial real estate advisory, and management consulting firm that specializes in providing customized solutions to companies and investors: Financial Advisory Services*: äó¢ Mergers & Acquisitions äó¢ Debt & Equity Financing äó¢ Employee Stock Ownership Plans (ESOPs) Commercial Real Estate: äó¢ Capital Raising äó¢ Acquisition Financing äó¢ Land Development / Acquisition äó¢ Seller / Buyer Representation Management Consulting Services: äó¢ Strategic Planning äó¢ Process Improvement äó¢ Growth Initiatives äó¢ Brand Development BCC is committed to building long-standing relationships that ensure its clients achieve tangible results that exceed their business goals. column6: Culver Capital has emerged from the financial crowd as one of the premier financial service companies in the United States. Guided by a management team with nearly 60 years of experience in financial services, we have built a solid reputation in the marketplace through a strong commitment to our clients.We pride ourselves in the flexibility we provide our clients. Our experience has shown that each client has a different set of priorities and requirements unique to their situation. Before submitting a proposal we work to ensure that we fully understand the need and then structure the transaction accordingly.Our goal is to become a long-term financing partner and consultant to your organization by meeting your financing needs of both today and tomorrow.    Show Less

column6: Madison Street Capital is an international investment banking firm dedicated to the highest standards of integrity and professionalism äóñ provides corporate financial advisory services, mergers and acquisitions expertise, valuation services, and financial opinions to publicly and privately held businesses through our offices in North America, Asia, and Africa. Our professionals draw on specialized expertise in partnering with middle-market firms in all industry verticals and niche markets to achieve an optimal outcome through a variety of transactions. Madison Street Capital's professionals precisely analyze each client's needs to determine the best match between buyers and sellers, arrange cost-effective financing, and produce capitalization structures that maximize each clients' potential. Madison Street Capital is a trusted partner and industry-leading provider of financial advisory services, M&A assistance and business valuations.äóìMadison Street Capital and Reginald McGaugh was our 3rd investment banker and produced superior results in half the time we spent with the prior two firms at a lower transaction cost. His knowledge of our industry and network connections on financing combined to bring us eight different offers from competing firms and allowed us to choose the best match for our needs. He took the time to understand our unique business proposition and reduced the due diligence time by providing the necessary documentation early on in the process and then stayed with us throughout to ensure that we closed on schedule. He is not only a consummate professional with creative "out of the box" ideas, but a trusted advisor that we will not hesitate to use again for any business opportunity we encounter.äóùRobert Gricius CEO of Naveos    Show Less

column6: Capital Alliance is a Dallas-based private investment banking firm incorporated in 1976. As one of the leading äóìmiddle marketäóù investment banking firms in the U.S., Capital Alliance helps people buy, sell, or finance well-established corporations whose annual sales range from $5 million to $500 million or more. The firm's significant expertise is demonstrated by a proven track record of closing over 180 multi-million dollar transactions with principals in over 40 states and several foreign countries. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, Capital Alliance has a Dallas-based staff of over 20 people with substantial senior corporate operating experience in a wide spectrum of industries. The firm frequently represents the selling shareholders of a corporation, and is also engaged with a number of companies on specific search or financing programs. Œæ Industries: Manufacturing Energy Technology Transportation & Logistics Business Services Healthcare Construction & Engineering    Show Less

column6: FOCUS Investment Bank provides a range of middle market investment banking services with an emphasis on mergers, acquisitions, divestitures and corporate finance. FOCUS is a national firm serving clients from offices in major cities across the United States. FOCUS specializes in business units with transactions or revenues in the $5-300 million range, serving entrepreneurs, corporate owners and various types of investors across a broad range of industries, throughout the U.S. and worldwide. FOCUS bankers are seasoned operating and financial executives with extensive transaction experience. Securities transactions conducted by FOCUS Securities LLC, an affiliated company, registered Broker Dealer member FINRA/SIPC. For more information on FOCUS, visit www.focusbankers.com.    Show Less

column6: Founded in 1956, Corporate Finance Associates is one of the largest and most experienced middle-market M&A advisory and investment banking firms in the nation. CFA has offices across the United States, Canada, Mexico, India, and partner offices in Brazil, China, and throughout Europe. Securities offered through Corporate Finance Securities, Inc., member FINRA and SIPC. The Chicago office serves a global client base of companies across all sectors and has recently completed transactions in the following industries: manufacturing, financial and business services, distribution, technology, aerospace, aviation, defense, food & beverage, consumer, healthcare, transportation, logistics, media, marketing, insurance, environmental, communications, software, plastics, metal fabrication and packaging/printing.    Show Less

column6: Forbes Mergers & Acquisitions is a leading financial and transaction advisor to private companies. We focus solely on the industry sectors and companies that are underserved by the medium to large investment banks, and provide advisory services where our specific industry knowledge, contacts and experience provide the highest value. Our clients generally range between $1 million and $30 million in enterprise values. From our headquarters in Denver, Colorado, and our branch in Washington D.C, we partner with our clients to deliver creative and strategic advice, unique services and exceptional results. As their fiercest advocates, our client's rely on us to maximize their selling price, facilitate mergers and acquisitions, raise capital, solidify exit strategies, and pinpoint strategic direction. We measure our achievements by our clients' successes, and those successes have earned us the reputation as the market-leading transaction firm for lower middle-market businesses in the industries we serve.    Show Less

column6: Carriage Hill is an investment bank that specializes in privately negotiated transactions between private middle market companies and high quality private equity groups. This is accomplished without the use of traditional books and the auction process. We have a prominent record and respected reputation for successfully helping shareholders of privately held middle market companies navigate the challenges of reorganizing assets, accelerating growth through acquisitions, finding hidden value, resolving shareholder disputes, planning generational transitions and planning exit strategies. Discretion and confidentiality underline our approach to recapitalizations. We actively and aggressively seek new opportunities through our professionally managed and trained sales force and our research based approach to origination. Our team is comprised of business people with real in the trenches experiences and our contractual and long standing personal relationships with over $30 billion of the world's foremost private equity groups sets us apart from traditional firms. We are industry agnostic and have completed transactions across many verticals including transportation, software, healthcare and all kinds of manufacturing, service and distribution companies. The common denominator throughout our transaction history is that our clients tend to be high quality companies broadly in the middle market that have a need or a desire to access capital where the right fit is just as important, if not more important, than the last dime.    Show Less

column6: Concord Financial Advisors, LLC is a boutique investment banking and financial advisory firm serving public and private middle market companies in the United States. Concord specializes in private placements of senior debt and subordinated debt / mezzanine financing for companies requiring turnarounds, recapitalizations and growth. Private & Public Companies (Typically $20MM - $300MM in revenues) Private Equity Groups and their portfolio companies Family Businesses Entrepreneurs making acquisitions or seeking growth capital Financial Institutions looking to exit certain credit Manufacturing / distribution and select service companies $2.0MM - $100MM credit facilities    Show Less

column6: Provident is one of the most dynamic and rapidly growing boutique investment banking firms in the country for one basic reason: our focus, both on the healthcare industry and on our clients. Many investment banks try to be all things to all people, but that's not the Provident way. We succeed for our clients because we are highly specialized and industry-focused. Through years of dedication to the healthcare industry, Provident has developed a vast network of high-level, senior industry contacts, a thorough knowledge of market niches and specialties, and unsurpassed insight into the transaction process, allowing us to uncover value and opportunity that others overlook. Provident believes in a client-first approach, and we've designed our business to support this idea. That's why we don't get paid until the deal closes, and it's why we invest our own resources in the process. We believe in nurturing companies through all stages of development- our advisory services offer long-term relationships, helping clients reach both their short- and long-term goals.    Show Less

column6: Paragon Ventures is a leading investment banking advisory for healthcare business mergers, divestitures and acquisition management services. With expertise in market valuations, sales, finance and corporate investment banking, we provide strategic advisory services for healthcare businesses nationwide. The firm is widely recognized for in-depth healthcare sector knowledge and expertise with over a century of combined ownership, operations and management of healthcare companies. Paragon's team is noted for its dedicated service, passion for clients advocacy and the development of strong relationships throughout the healthcare sector. Working with our clients as strategic partners, we identify, explore and execute the strategic options that optimize enterprise value. We place our client relationships first and conduct our business based on unwavering, client-focused principles.What separates Paragon Ventures from the rest of the investment banking and advisory firms is our long history of success, targeted insight specifically in the healthcare sectors we market and an unbridled passion and persistence to get deals closed. We at Paragon Ventures are all former business owners in the healthcare industry and truly appreciate the challenges that owners confront. We have literally walked in their shoes! Pivotal to success in these M&A transactions is understanding the market pulse of the industry in today's dynamic marketplaceäó_ especially in light of competitive bidding and healthcare reform. Our experience has taught us to anticipate hurdles and prepare our clients to successfully navigate to a closing. We are expert in this niche and active in the market every day with buyers and investors motivated to consummate healthcare M&A transactions. Call us today at 1-800-719-1555 www.paragonventures.com All inquiries held strictly confidential.    Show Less

column6: HighBank was formed in 2009 by its founding partner Stephen Gaines. HighBank is a mid market investment bank and financial advisory firm headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland with a regional offices in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Raleigh, North Carolina. Our firm was formed on a mission that our clients deserve to have their highest expectations met and to receive higher value for their investments of money and time. HighBank provides a wide range of investment banking, financial advisory, and restructuring services to meet the needs of our clients. We provide thorough, objective and conflict-free advice, innovative solutions and outstanding execution to both middle market and emerging companies.    Show Less

column6: At Global Capital Markets we specialize in middle market transactions. We take a no-nonsense approach to achieving results in virtually all situations. This approach has made us a leading West Coast financial services provider. For over fifteen years, our team has offered companies a unique blend of sophisticated financial expertise and access to the global marketplace of buyers, sellers and financiers. In order to serve our clients to the fullest extent we generally focus our services on manufacturing, distribution, service and retail companies with revenues between $10 million and $200 million. We have the experience knowledge and resources to make any company's transaction as seamless and beneficial as possible. We look forward to a lasting and beneficial business relationship. Securities offered through GCMI Securities Corp., member FINRA/SIPC, and a subsidiary of Global Capital Markets.    Show Less

column6: Allegiance Capital Corporation, a premier private investment bank, is founded upon the same brand of entrepreneurial tenacity our clients unleashed to create their own successful businesses. Because entrepreneurs are the backbone of the Allegiance Capital Corporation team, we understand our customersäó» needs and make serving them our highest priority. The Allegiance difference is simple: We understand that every business, every client, is different. Weäó»ve personally experienced many of the same challenges business owners face on a daily basis. We take this operational experience and combine it with financial acumen and relentless hard work. Because our number one goal is to realize the best possible outcome for our clients, we work to craft deals that are personalized to each clientäó»s unique needs. As a result, the financial results we deliver often exceed client expectations. Selling a business can be daunting. Allegiance works to smooth the experience for sellers, providing clarity to enable clients to avoid pitfalls while ensuring they remain in control of the process. Through Globalscope, its global network partner that includes 44 firms in 25 countries, Allegiance Capital Corporation assists companies in every aspect of selling and financing a business, including: debt restructuring, mezzanine financing, executing leveraged buyouts, strategic partnering, consulting and other related services.    Show Less

column6: Investment Banking Services for Privately Held Businesses Focusing on privately held companies, Lexbridge International Mergers and Acquisitions Group (Lexbridge) offers comprehensive, global investment banking services for mergers and acquisitions; corporate finance, including private placement of debt and equity; and strategic partnerships and joint ventures. Services We successfully fill the gap between larger international investment banking companies who are not able to economically provide services to smaller and mid-sized businesses, and local intermediaries who can give clients only limited access to mergers and acquisitions (M&A) and capital markets.   Lexbridge M&A Strategic Advisor to BKR International for Mergers and Acquisitions BKR International is a leading global association of independent accounting and business advisory firms representing expertise of more than 135 member firms with over 300 offices in over 70 countries around the world.    Show Less

column6: Vesticor Advisors was founded on the principle that owner-operated companies in the lower middle market are unique and require specialized attention and advice when considering strategic investment and exit opportunities. Vesticor Advisors provides M&A and capital raising advisory services exclusively to founder and owner-operated companies. We support clients with the expertise needed to build their business through growth acquisitions, optimize value in an exit or sale, transition ownership to family or management, divest non-core assets, or raise capital. After founding, building and exiting our own businesses, the partners at Vesticor came together under a shared vision: to build an M&A firm that helps other business owners achieve their dreams of growth, expansion, legacy and financial independence.    Show Less

column6: The DVS Group is a lower middle market merger and acquisition firm. Our transaction focus is on companies in the $2 million to $20 million enterprise value range, which translates roughly to companies producing between $500,000 and $3 million in EBITDA. The lower middle market is a messy, complex world, as it is dominated by individual entrepreneurs and privately-held businesses. Anyone that really knows highly successful entrepreneurs knows what we are talking about. We know all about the world of privately-held businesses and entrepreneurs, and we close deals.

column6: Gruppo, Levey and Co. was founded in 1992 by experienced industry executives, to provide independent financial advisory services to business owners, financial sponsors, growth investors and management teams in the $1.5 trillion direct marketing industry. Over the years, the firm has continued to evolve to address rapidly changing market conditions, new consumer behaviors and advances in technology. GLC is a leading, independent advisory firm helping our clients with exceptional M&A, strategic advisory and private capital raising services. Many of the firm's sell-side clients are family-owned companies and GLC's bankers are known for achieving stellar results through highly efficient, strategic processes. Where We Thrive GLCäó»s clients come from both ends of the transaction experience. We represent sellers and buyers of companies, and users of capital and capital providers. We have broad distribution capabilities in the Private Capital Markets, with particular focus in private equity, growth capital and debt capital. Our expertise lies in three core areas of the economy encompassing a wide spectrum of consumer and business-to-business services companies. Consumer - Digital and Offline, E-Commerce, Retail, Online Marketplace, Direct Marketing, Advertising, Digital Media, Mobile, Entertainment B2B Technology and Data Services- Adtech, Analytics, Market Research, Mobile Platforms, Enterprise Software, SaaS Our Third Decade GLC has broadened its coverage in disruptive technologies that affect all of its core sectors. One of our unwavering perspectives in transaction development is that technology creates a huge opportunity for our clients to monetize the intrinsic value of their distribution channels, content and data, and helps leverage existing and new business models. We believe our integrated approach to incumbent and new business models, based on 20 years of advice to companies as their industries have changed with the introduction of technology, makes us better able to assist both traditional and 21st century businesses. Recognizing the importance of financing and the value-added sponsorship and strategic vision that experienced investors bring to companies, we have increased our commitment to the investor community. We work closely with venture capital, private equity and institutional debt providers to help them identify new opportunities and to grow or find partners for their existing portfolio companies in ways that maximize value.    Show Less

column6: WestPark Capital, Inc. is a full service investment banking and securities brokerage firm which serves the needs of both private and public companies worldwide, as well as individual and institutional investors. We are committed to forging lasting partnerships with emerging growth companies and the investors who back them. Our simple approach is to provide customized financial solutions for virtually any need. A complete range of investment banking and brokerage services are available to our valued corporate and individual clients. Our Capabilities: Our corporate finance professionals have the depth of experience and resources to create integrated financing solutions for both private and public marketplaces. Additionally, we offer an exceptional array of private client services through our dedicated financial consultant group. WestPark Capital understands the importance of strong relationships in today's dynamic business environment and welcomes the opportunity to leverage this power into your success! WestPark Capital, Inc. has experienced professionals with proven corporate finance expertise in all aspects of investment banking, such as: - Initial public offerings and secondary offerings- Private placements of equity and debt- Mergers and acquisitions- Corporate divestitures - Fairness opinions and valuation - Bankruptcy/restructuring advisory services    Show Less

column6: Our Merger & Acquisition advisory firm (LS) is focused on the sale, merger, acquisition, divestiture and recapitalization of companies with revenues ranging from $10 million to $100 million. LS also advises clients on exit planning and business enhancement. We've completed 140 middle market M&A transactions since 1984 by providing creative and personalized service designed to meet each client's stated needs and objectives. Our clients often comment that our service has exceeded their expectations. We successfully conclude over 90% of our M&A engagements. Here is what differentiates us:äó¢	Our senior advisors have over six decades of continuous M&A advisory experienceäó¢	Our senior advisors handle every aspect of an engagementäó¢	Our hands-on approach reduces our clientäó»s work load and stressäó¢	Weäó»ll tell you what you need to hear, not what you want to hearäó¢	We seek out buyers world-wideäó¢	Weäó»ll recommend you reject an offer if it doesnäó»t fit your exit goalsäó¢	We provide exit planning advice 2-3 years before the start of the sale processOur advisors actively advocate for our client's best interests with integrity, professionalism, and care throughout every engagement. Lyons Solutions' mission is to find the best merger and acquisition solution for each of our middle market clients. We work to ensure that the client receives the best price available in the market. It is equally important to us that there is a close cultural fit between our client's company and the buyer. Lyons Solutions maintains a proprietary database of over 2,000 strategic and financial buyers. We also research each assignment for additional prospective buyers by purchasing industry and third-party databases. Our proven, confidential approach to reaching the largest appropriate buyer market serves our clients well. Our motto is äóìever to excel.äóù We look forward to hopefully working with you as you embark on what is likely the most important financial transaction of your life.    Show Less

Structured finance vehicles have also been used to achieve the needs of larger companies, while creating specific advantages that enhance their balance sheets.

Valuation and Financial Advisory We provide an array of services that range from portfolio valuation, transaction opinions, tax and financial reporting compliance and a wide variety of consulting services through our Financial Advisory group. column6: Over the last 20 years, The Capital Corporation has established itself as one of the premier, lower middle market investment banking firms in the country.We specialize in navigating our clients through the complicated and time intensive processes of selling their businesses, acquiring other businesses, and/or securing capital. Our niche is to represent "lower middle market" companies that have revenues between $10 million and $100 million. Over the last two decades, we have continuously refined our networks, approach, and skill-sets needed in order to successfully close transactions with companies of this lower middle market size. Many investment banks shy away from this lower middle market niche due to its complexity and the specificity it requiresäó_We actually gravitate towards it.Our approach is highly unique. We have assembled the only investment banking team east of the Mississippi who can boast the following attributes in the lower middle market space:A top quartile closing rate across hundreds of lower middle market transactionsA broad network of thousands of buyers/investors, including cross-border experienceA first-hand understanding of what it is like to own/operate private businesses (given our team's ownership positions in 30+ companies)A first-hand understanding of what it is like to be a buyer of private companies (including backgrounds of serving as both financial and strategic buyers)A high caliber, blue chip set of investment banking backgrounds from a variety of Wall Street firmsAn ability to offer our clients specific, industry expertise across 40+ different industries and segmentsThe unique attributes described above are not by accident. These differentiators are by design, as they feed directly into our time-tested, formula for success.    Show Less

column6: Founded in 2001, Osage Advisors is a boutique Investment Banking firm dedicated to helping business owners receive the maximum value from the sale of their companies. We use traditional investment banking techniques, typically not available to owners of closely-held businesses to create a competitive environment that delivers multiple options and the best prices for our clients.Our teams of Advisors are former business owners who understand that selling a business is personal and, therefore, we are committed to our clients - not just the deal. We tailor our process to meet the needs of each individual business owner, never losing sight of their personal goals and objectives.We also provide highly, personalized support through the entire process of selling privately-held businesses and work with our clients throughout the transaction until the deal is done!Osage has closed numerous transactions for clients across a broad range of industries and have strong relationships with both Strategic and Financial Buyers increasing our ability to deliver superior results for our clients.    Show Less

column6: Hyde Park Capital is an institutionally focused investment banking firm serving the corporate finance needs of companies typically located in Florida and the Southeastern United States. Our principals have extensive investment banking experience executing merger & acquisition engagements, including purchase and sale of company assignments, recapitalizations, financial advisory, fairness opinions and raising growth capital for companies, including equity, mezzanine and senior debt. With experience in the technology, healthcare, financial services, business services, consumer, and industrial sectors, we broadly represent outstanding growth companies in any industry. As one of the most active investment banking firms in Florida and the Southeast, our professionals have advised on more than 300 corporate investment banking transactions totaling more than $10 billion in transaction value. We are headquartered in Tampa, Florida and are a member of FINRA and SIPC    Show Less

column6: M3 Capital Partners is a global real estate investment banking and advisory firm. We specialize in raising private equity for public and private real estate operating companies and funds, delivering strategic financial advisory services and, through an affiliate, managing real estate private equity investments. M3 Capital Partners operates globally from regional offices in Chicago, Hong Kong, London and New York, and has established investor relationships throughout North America, Europe, Australia, Asia and the Middle East. Specialized and highly focused, M3 Capital Partners is a truly international real estate investment banking and advisory firm.    Show Less

column6: CFA was ranked among the top 10 M&A Advisors for U.S. transactions under $50 million by Thomson Reuters, Corporate Finance Associates is an international investment banking firm serving middle-market businesses. For nearly 60 years, Corporate Finance Associates has been advocating on behalf of business owners who are restructuring a company, either through divestiture, merger, acquisition or recapitalization. We also frequently work with private equity firms and strategic buyers to find acquisition targets. As the whole is generally greater than the sum of the parts, a synergistic acquisition can offer huge potential for sustainable growth. With offices across the United States, Canada, India and partner offices in Brazil, China and throughout Europe, Corporate Finance Associates offers a truly international footprint in the Middle Market Investment Banking industry.    Show Less

column6: Dresner Partners is a middle market investment bank specializing in mergers & acquisition advisory, financial restructuring and corporate turnarounds, institutional private placements of debt and equity, valuation and strategic consulting. Our clients are middle market companies operating both in the U.S. and internationally. We are deeply committed to exceeding client expectations and maintaining the highest levels of integrity. Our experienced professionals have the foresight necessary to navigate through highly complicated transactions to maximize value for our clients. The Firm's investment bankers possess extensive industry and transaction expertise combined with strong relationships developed through the consummation of more than 400 middle market transactions. Our strong reputation has been built through a results oriented approach then executing to deliver maximum value to our clients. The firm is a full service investment bank to middle market companies with service offerings across an array of industry verticals including, but not limited to, industrials, consumer, financial institutions, retail, healthcare and business services.    Show Less

column6: Capstone Partners LLC is a leading international investment banking firm dedicated to serving the corporate finance needs of middle market business owners, investors and creditors. The firm provides merger & acquisition, private placement, corporate restructuring, valuation and financial advisory services. Capstone maintains various industry specialties including business services, consumer products, education & training, government services, health & medical, manufacturing & industrial, and technology & media. The firm also possesses merchant banking capabilities to actively co-invest in transactions. Additional information about Capstone Partners can be found at www.capstonellc.com.    Show Less

column6: Confluence Advisors, LLC is a boutique investment bank that offers financial advisory services to middle market business and private equity firms. The firm provides merger and acquisition, capital market, strategic sourcing, growth capital placement, restructuring and refinancing, and negotiation advisory services. Additionally, it offers divestitures, management buyouts, private placements, strategy and employee stock option analysis, and financial support advisory services. The firm caters to food and beverage, construction, metals fabrication, chemicals, and packaging industries. Confluence Advisors, LLC was founded in 2009 and is based in Wexford, Pennsylvania.    Show Less

column6: Senior-Level Execution With more than 150 years of collective experience spanning over $10 billion in transaction volume, Brookwood's managing directors work hands-on with each client to determine and execute the right investment banking solution. Middle-Market Expertise Our exclusive focus on middle-market companies gives us exceptional insight into the strategic, valuation and transaction issues that are unique to this market. This expertise includes robust Market Knowledge and access to buyers on a worldwide basis. Superior Performance Above all, our clients are interested in superior performance. Brookwood has an excellent track record, a long list of satisfied investment banking clients, and a high percentage of engagements involving either repeat clients or assignments which they refer to us. Thoughtful Attention The combination of hands-on senior-level leadership, deep relevant experience and Brookwood's Commitment to Clients leads to independent, innovative and insightful advice for our clients. These are the key elements that drive our Superior Performance.    Show Less

column6: FTM Synergis Capital Inc. offers a full range of financial advisory services to mid-market companies for mergers & acquisitions and corporate finance transactions. Based in Montreal, the firm was founded by a seasoned team of industry professionals that for over twenty years have advised some of the leading venture capital / private equity funds, private & public companies, as well as their Boards and shareholders. FTM Synergis Capital Inc. was created in response to the growing need for independent, full-service investment banking advisory services for mid-market opportunities, , a service typically only available to large-cap companies engaged in larger transactions. In addition, FTM Synergis Capital's dynamic team and structure enable us to respond quickly and deliver outstanding results for our clients.    Show Less

column6: For nearly thirty years, the consultants at The Inman Company have assisted business owners in fulfilling their dreams. Whether through the sale of their business, an acquisition, a restructuring, refinancing, or recapitalization, we assist in the creation of the wealth through which dreams can come true! We serve as trusted advisors who understand that life is short, the world can change quickly, and for too many business owners, dreams go unfulfilled. We have successfully served hundreds of private companies including some of America's most prominent family businesses. We provide an unprecedented combination of independence, integrity, expertise, experience, and service.    Show Less

column6: Falls River Group, LLC is a global Mergers and Acquisitions advisory firm based in Naples, FL. We differentiate ourselves from other investment banking firms through unique international capabilities and by achieving results that exceed our clientsäó» expectations. Our sell-side clients typically have annual revenues of $20MM to $250MM.  They include both privately held companies and divestitures of publicly traded companies.  Buyers range from private family wealth funds and private equity groups to Global 1000 companies. Extensive participation as a partner in IMAP provides our firm with immediate and confidential access to buyers, sellers and more than 400 industry specialists in key markets throughout the world. This is highly beneficial in cross-border transactions where language, cultural, accounting and legal practices vary from country to country.    Show Less

column6: EBIT Associates is a leading intermediary and investment-banking firm advising private and corporate clients on lower middle market transactions. column6: Lawrence, Evans & Co., LLC provides investment banking, finance, consulting, as well as turnaround and restructuring advisory to small and middle market healthcare providers and service companies as well as transportation and value added logistics. Through capital raising, mergers and acquisition advisory, corporate restructuring work, and business consulting services, Lawrence, Evans & Co., LLC will guide you every step of the way. We are well known for our innovative client solutions to complex financial problems, and precise attention to each client's special needs. We are a boutique firm small enough to provide you the personal service you deserve yet large enough to meet all of your complex needs. The firms five professionals have over 100 years of combined complex transaction, capital raising, financial advisory, management, turnaround, revenue cycle, expert witness and direct lending experience. Client's typically include companies between $1 and $250 million in annual revenues. Since our inception in 2002, we have assisted numerous companies nationwide. With offices in Columbus, Ohio we are a one stop provider for servicing your financial and business interests. Sell-Side Advisory Buy-Side Advisory Financial Advisory Management Buyouts Owner Recapitalization Restructure Debt and Equity Management Consulting Distressed Investing Collateral Analysis and Audits Healthcare Information Technology Audit and Management EXPERIENCE - INDUSTRIES Healthcare Technology including Robotics Logistic Solutions Renewable Energy - Solar, Wind, Water EXPERIENCE - HEALTHCARE Our in-depth knowledge and experience in virtually every healthcare sector enables our healthcare investment bankers to provide the value-added advice vital to maintaining a strategic and competitive advantage in today's rapidly changing healthcare environment. Our Healthcare Group has worked with clients representing a broad spectrum including: Physician Practice Management Laboratories / Imaging Centers Health Maintenance Organizations Medical Office Buildings Healthcare Software and IT Revenue Cycle Management Hospitals Nursing Homes / Assisted Living Outpatient Surgery Centers Physician Practices / IPAs Home Healthcare / Rehabilitation Medical Device Manufacturers    Show Less

column6: With over 75 years of combined experience and over $250 billion in successfully completed transactions, the professionals at DelMorgan provide world-class financial advice and assistance to companies, institutions, governments and individuals around the world. Our services are fundamentally centered on achieving our clients' aims to consummate strategically important transactions and to enhance shareholder value. Our core competencies include: Raising capital for growing companies looking to grow their operations or expand their shareholder base Mergers & acquisitions (M&A) involving acquisitions or divestitures Sale of a company Strategic advisory (shareholder relations / hostile defense / unsolicited acquisitions / strategic financial advice / restructuring special committee advisory fairness / valuation opinions, expert witness testimony) Because of DelMorgan's unique approach, our clients can be assured of having engaged a trusted advisor and partner who will dedicate an extraordinary level of focus, energy and experience in the pursuit of our clients' objectives. By aligning our interests with those of our clients, DelMorgan can ensure that our passion for success is effectively joined with our clients' ambitions. We are proud of the way our services translate into success for our clients, and we strive to build relationships that will be mutually beneficial over the long term.    Show Less

column6: Madeira Partners is a mergers and acquisition (M&A) advisory firm that represents lower middle market companies in niche manufacturing, value-added distribution, business services and specialty retail with $5 million to $100 million in annual revenue.We provide M&A advisory services to closely-held, family owned, private equity sponsored and corporate shareholders that wish to sell all or part of their company, a division, a product line or a subsidiary.

column6: Copper Run Capital is a boutique M&A advisory firm focused on serving the needs of the lower middle market. Our firm is committed to providing lower middle market companies with high quality merger and acquisition advisory services. We provide clients with senior level attention and are 100% focused on achieving our clientäó»s objectives.Copper Run Capital LLC was founded to make merger and acquisition advice and assistance available to corporations and individuals whose transactions are too small or infrequent to attract the interest of bulge bracket investment bankers. Many of our clients face unprecedented strategic opportunities or problems but lack the experience or resources to assess or to respond to it effectively.The founders of Copper Run Capital believe the middle market is incredibly under served when it comes to their investment banking needs. We are committed to delivering the highest level of service and results to our clients. We have more than $11 billion of M&A transaction experience.Copper Run Capital was founded on the principles of honesty, integrity, hard work, and family. We believe those principles will be key in building and keeping lasting relationships with our clients and our community.    Show Less

column6: Company Overview Dallasäóîbased investment banking and private equity investment firm Provide M&A advisory and equity and debt funding solutions for emerging growth companies Acquire controlling or minority interests in middleäóîmarket companies valued at up to $100 million Partner with institutional equity and other private funding sources on dealäóîbyäóîdeal basis Flexibility in deal structure and holding period Partner with seasoned managers in attractive industries Add value through access to capital, sourcing of strategic partners, and active board oversight Deep transaction and capital markets experience with strong relationships across investment industry Dedicated to helping companies fund and grow their businesses Professionals with 40 years of combined financial and investment experience: Chris D. Cuzalina, Managing Partner, has 20 years inäóî vestment experience as an investor, portfolio manager and investment banker. Prior to Cascata, Mr. Cuzalina was a Managing Partner of Vista Verde Capital Manäóî agement, a hedge fund, a Partner with McGarr Capital, a hedge fund, a Portfolio Manager with Hintz, Holman & Hecksher, a $1 billion hedge fund in New York, and a Financial Analyst in Mergers & Acquisitions with CS First Boston in New York. Mr. Cuzalina serves on the Price College of Business MBA Advisory Board at the University of Oklahoma. He received his MBA from Stanford University in 1996 and a BBA in Finance with Special Distinction for a 4.0 GPA from the University of Oklahoma in 1991. Mr. Cuzalina is a registered repreäóî sentative of WFG Investments, Inc., member FINRA/ SIPC. J. Chris Quinn, Partner, has 20 years investment and finance experience with an emphasis in valuation and credit analysis, transaction structuring and strategic advisory work. Prior to Cascata, Mr. Quinn was a Vice President in Mergers & Acquisitions with Dresdner Kleinwort Wasserstein, an Associate in Investment Banking with Solomon Brothers in New York, and a Commercial Lending Officer with Bank of Oklahoma. Mr. Quinn received his MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania with Director List Honors in 1998, and a BBA in Finance with Dean's List Honors from the University of Oklahoma in 1991. Mr. Quinn is a registered representative of WFG Investäóî ments, Inc., member FINRA/SIPC.    Show Less

column6: Cascade Partners provides investment banking advisory services that are highly customized to meet the specific goals and objectives of each of our Partners. Our advisory services include: - Mergers, Acquisitions, Divestitures and Corporate Finance activities in support of businesses, shareholders and operators focused on the middle market. Each member of our team has a formidable combination of operating, investment and transaction experience, which we draw on to address the unique needs of transaction. We have used this experience and a research driven process to partner with large public companies as well as entrepreneurial businesses to meet their global investment banking needs. While others use words like äóìclientäóù, äóìcustomeräóù or äóìdealäóù we prefer to think of our relationships with select companies, owners and operators as long-term partnerships. Our long-term approach provides us with the opportunity to first serve as an unbiased resource to help management or shareholders understand their alternatives, long before they need transactional services. This approach enables us to better understand each unique situation, help evolve our Partnersäó» strategies, and hit the ground running when a transaction develops. Cascade Partners is a licensed broker dealer.    Show Less

column6: BlackTorch Capital is a results-driven investment banking firm providing strategic and financial solutions customized to meet the needs of public and private middle-market companies and their capital providers. SINGULAR SOLUTIONS No two companies are exactly alike. Their circumstances and challenges always differ. Thatäó»s why, before recommending any specific strategy, we always invest the time necessary to understand your issues, your business model and your objectives. Remaining flexible and focused allows us to create singular, innovative solutions. PROVEN EXPERIENCE Our senior investment bankers provide strategic perspective, middle market expertise, balanced judgment and a vast network of relationships to every client engagement. Weäó»ve originated and closed billions of dollars in transactions of varying size and complexity. Our senior partners infuse middle-market investment banking with large-firm possibilities. DIRECT ENGAGEMENT A senior partner always spearheads our firm's engagements. We work directly with the client throughout each transaction, delivering our creative, top-tier merger and acquisition capabilities. Our experience spans borders, industry sectors and economic cycles. Weäó»re also keenly aware of the nuances of varying transaction situations and strategies. LASTING RELATIONSHIPS We view the close of a successful transaction not as the end of a client relationship, but rather as part of a continuing relationship that will enable us to provide the objective advice critical to helping clients achieve their long-term goals. The breadth and depth of our relationships is key to the success of our firm and the clients we represent.    Show Less

column6: MidCap Advisors, a middle market investment bank headquartered in New York, with offices in Chicago and Boston, specializes in mergers and acquisitions, corporate finance, capital raises, ownership transition planning, business valuations and negotiation support services for companies generating $5 million to $250 million in revenues. A business owner's definition of success is multi-faceted. For some, it is selling a business for maximum value. For others, it is effecting a smooth ownership transition to key employees or family members. And for others, the question has not been fully answered yet. Thatäó»s why our experienced and knowledgeable advisors created and adopted a 360 degree approach to help business owners identify and accomplish all of their goals. MidCap Advisors also represents corporations, private equity firms and investors who are seeking to grow through acquisition. We can help formulate acquisition strategies, identify prospective acquisition targets, initiate contact, assist in negotiating terms of an acquisition, and help obtain acquisition financing when necessary.    Show Less

column6: MS Capital Advisors Ltd. is a private investment banking and corporate financial advisory firm committed to providing discreet, trusted advice and transactional services across a broad range of industries and situations. Mark Stafford founded MSCA in 2006, intending to impart high quality, "Big Firm" execution and services to small and middle market companies. Although Mr. Stafford has worked on both large and small transactions during his investment banking years at Bankers Trust, The Bank of New York and Fieldstone Private Capital Group, he has enjoyed and had more of an overall impact working with smaller businesses. Mr. Stafford is a specialist in executing complex transactions, deals we affectionately refer to as "Story Paper". Story Paper deals are complicated corporate financing problems which typically require more attention, time, creativity and perseverance to solve; they also demand a unique ability to articulate the "story" and extensive relationships with investors and lenders. Services Provided: Structuring and Raising Capital äóñ the full spectrum of debt and equity securities M&A Advisory äóñ both buy and sell-side Capital Markets Advisory Corporate Finance Strategy    Show Less
