column6: Bentley is comprised of senior level investment bankers providing a full array of services to middle market and growth companies. Founded in 1990, our senior level investment bankers joined Bentley over the years from such firms as Bear Stearns, Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Lehman Brothers, Merrill Lynch, Nomura Securities, PaineWebber, Prudential Securities, Salomon Brothers, Schroders, Bankers Trust, Chase, Citicorp and J.P. Morgan. As a result, our investment banking capabilities are comparable to almost any major Wall Street firm. With 27 senior level investment bankers, Bentley has assembled the "critical mass" of experienced professionals to meet the needs of our clients. Our investment bankers, typically with 15-25 years of experience, have executed a wide variety of transactions. Our clients are in many diverse industries, both domestically and internationally. In 2008 Bentley professionals worked with over 50 clients. As a result, our investment banking capabilities are comparable to any major Wall Street firm, with one exception -- their higher overhead costs often preclude them from devoting their senior level talent to anything other than large, prestigious clients and transactions. Because of this key difference, mid-sized companies can expect superior results from Bentley.    Show Less

column6: Merit Harbor Group is a boutique Investment Bank focused on helping lower middle-market companies achieve their goals. We help entrepreneurs and CEOs accelerate and capture value through:  äó¢ Sell-Side M&Aäó¢ Buy-Side M&Aäó¢ Capital Raises via debt or equity As a boutique licensed investment banking firm, our goal is to help business owners create, grow and optimize enterprise value. As a business owner, you have worked hard to build your company and provide a world-class service, product, or solutions. Maximizing and capturing that value is your reward. Whether you want to take a few chips off the table, buy a competitor or sell your company for top dollar, we can help. When it comes to growth, far too many entrepreneurs are constrained because they do not have the right advice when it comes to finding and utilizing appropriate capital to grow. Our investment bankers provide an array of options to finance growth. Our firm is built and run by experienced entrepreneurs, CEOs, CFOs and investment bankers that have been successful in executing M&A liquidity events. Trust the experience of a unique investment bank whose members have been in your seat and have captured real value for themselves and clients like you.     Show Less

column6: Clarke Advisors LLC is a specialized Financial Advisory and Merchant Banking Firm, providing the highest quality Investment Banking services including institutional financing, merger, acquisition and divestiture for small to medium-sized private and public companies. Clarke's Industry Focus is Transportation, Logistics and Technology. Members of Clarke are FINRA Licensed Series 7, 79 and 63 . Based in the Phoenix metropolitan area, Clarke's services include: Sell-Side, Buy-Side and Capital Market placements including; venture capital, private equity and debt recapitalization's Clarke's Merchant Banking services include principal transactions in profitable lower middle market entities. As a boutique investment banking firm, Clarke has the ability to handle lower middle market transactions, between $10 and $250 million. Clarke is unique with the strength of additional resources which include Penates Group, Inc. (FINRA/SIPC), RBC Investment Banking (for larger transactions) and RBC Wealth Management. Clarke's Merger and Acquisition practice has a market focus on lower middle market companies; including Technology, Transportation and Logistics where we cover buyers and sellers and alternative forms of capital on a nationwide basis. Our preference is to focus on Private Equity and the Larger Strategic Buyers of these companies where a clean transaction can be closed without the need for Promissory Notes, Owner Carry Backs or Resets based on future performance. Clarke's capital markets focus is on institutional placements of equity and debt (Series A, B or C) of between $10 and $50 million. We are available for consultation about your plans and objectives at 480-488-1929 or nec@clarkeadvisors.net    Show Less

column6: Founded in 1987, Versailles Group, Ltd. is a Boston-based investment bank that specializes in mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures, as well as other specialized advisory services including: corporate strategy and planning, new venture formation, interim executive management, joint ventures, strategic alliances, management buyouts, restructurings, private placements, valuations, and Fairness Opinions. For more than 25 years, Versailles Group has created value for its clients. Our senior level bankers have consistently proven that they can successfully close transactions that meet or exceed demanding clients' expectations. Furthermore, for international transactions, Versailles Group has in-depth experience and expertise in the complexities of cross-border transactions. Versailles Group's engagements are always staffed and serviced by senior level bankers. Since inception, our focus has been on companies with US$1 to US$250 million in revenues in a broad range of industries. We do have special expertise in the biotech, computer (hardware and software), manufacturing, medical, process control, and telecommunications industries. Our mission is to satisfy your needs, exceed your expectations, and add your testimonial to our growing list of clients.    Show Less

column6: The DAK Group, Ltd. is an established middle market investment bank providing advisory and execution of exit strategies, divestitures, mergers, acquisitions, financing and restructuring solutions. Committed to optimizing value for the business owner and stakeholders, The DAK Group applies a hallmark approach characterized by a deep understanding of the strategic value of a business. Since its founding in 1984, The DAK Group has successfully closed hundreds of transactions involving public and privately-held corporations, cross-border transactions, family businesses and financial sponsors. The DAK Group is a member of FINRA and is located in New Jersey and New York City.    Show Less

column6: FocalPoint is a leading independent full-service Investment Bank. With a diverse range of M&A, capital raising, and restructuring advisory services, we are ideally positioned to meet the needs of middle market companies in all stages of the corporate life cycle. We pride ourselves on providing objective advice and "outside the box" thinking in order to come up with the right solutions for our clients without the conflicts experienced by many of our competitors. The following are some of the ways we differentiate from other middle market investment banks: - Not a One-Trick Pony: Our diverse range of transaction capabilities allows us to provide unbiased advice committed to maximizing its client's value and building long-term relationships - No "Cookie-Cutter" Approach: We recognize that no two companies are alike and therefore no two deals are alike. We approach every situation from the ground up in efforts to create maximum value through innovative solutions - Bringing "Wall Street to Main Street": All of our senior level professionals come from diverse institutional backgrounds offering a level of transaction sophistication unique to the middle market - Senior Level Attention: Senior level professionals integrally responsible for execution äóî no disappearing act after the pitch; Supported by highly qualified junior resources - Broad Geographic Reach: Bi-coastal firm with network of contacts spanning the US; Experience of cross-border transactions in Europe, Latin America, and Asia    Show Less

column6: Technology Square Partners, LLC is a boutique advisory primarily to family offices and investment funds. The firm provides investment advisory, due diligence, strategy, and we often participate as an investor in our transactions. We are focused on introducing capital sources to late-stage venture capital, mezzanine, and middle-market companies. In many cases we take part in assisting operational management and board level advisory on an ongoing basis. We cater primarily to energy infrastructure, greentech/cleantech, media, telecommunications, Internet, healthcare, and biotechnology sectors, or basically any intense R&D or highly technology dependent industry. Our unique speciality is in overlapping industry spaces such as clean energy storage for telecommunications applications. We are also specialists in investments with heavy emerging markets exposure.    Show Less

column6: The Perreault Birmingham Group LLC acts as a financial advisor for smaller and medium size companies in financing transactions that facilitate growth and in M&A transactions that create either ownership opportunities for purchasers or exits for founders, owners and investors.Founded in Palo Alto in 2003, the PB Group specializes in working with the technology-driven and entrepreneurial businesses that flourish in Silicon Valley.  This includes companies involved in core technology products and services such as hardware and software, IoT, biomedical and medical devices, and education technology, as well as other entrepreneurially driven businesses.The PB Group principals collectively bring over 150 years of experience in working with Silicon Valley companies ranging from small startups to technology icons, such as HP and Apple.  In addition to their investment banking services, the principals of the PB Group apply a wide range of skills and experience from prior management positions in such diverse areas as sales & marketing, operations, legal, finance. The PB Group maintains an extensive network among Silicon Valley companies, venture capitalists, and private equity firms.The PB Group is a boutique investment bank that prides itself on providing personalized service to a small, select group of clients.  As such we are committed to the following guiding principles of our business:äó¢	Bring our management perspectives and experience to each engagement;äó¢	Use our experience to work closely with managements to develop operational and financial plans that achieve clientsäó» objectives and greatly enhance the opportunity for a successful transaction;äó¢	Maintain absolute integrity in dealing with clients and third parties in marketing and closing a transaction;äó¢	Take a long term perspective in working with clients that goes beyond the execution of a single transaction;äó¢	Support clients in their efforts to foster innovation; andäó¢	Provide superior service to clients that enables realization of goals and objectives.The specific services provided by the PB Group:äó¢	Business Consultingäó¢	Equity and Debt Placements äó¢	Mergers & Acquisitions/Sell side and Buy sideäó¢	Strategic InvestmentsRepresentative transactions by PBG principals:Transaction Amount	TypeSale of optical telecommunications components company	$175M 	(M&A)Acquisition of enterprise software company	$150M 	(M&A)Negotiation and structuring of strategic, cross-licensing partnership with Microsoft 	$125M 	(SP/C)Raised funding for and managed San Francisco based venture capital fund	$125M 	($)Acquisition of software retailer	$90M 	(M&A)Raised funding for and managed telecom centric venture capital fund	$80M 	($)Sale of advertising management software company	$30M 	(M&A)IPO of mainframe software company	$27M 	($)US IPO of Canadian midrange software company	$27M 	($)Acquisition of two aerospace components manufacturers	$15M 	(M&A)Acquisition of publicly traded branded nutraceuticals marketer	$12M 	(M&A)Add-on asset purchase of branded nutraceuticals product line	$3M 	(M&A)      M&A=Merger & Acquisition including sales/divestitures		     SP/C = Strategic Partnering/Consulting		     $ = Fundraising		The Perreault Birmingham Group, LLC offers Investment Banking/Securities services through Western International Securities, Inc., member FINRA, SIPC, Hobart McK. column6: The London Manhattan Company works with clients to find the most advantageous financial structure available in the marketplace, given their financial situation. This may involve refinancing existing debt to provide longer repayment schedules or improved interest rates, finding equity, or placing subordinated debt to increase financial capacity for growth.Companies that have a complex debt structure or that have been unable to arrange satisfactory commercial financing or refinancing on their own can work hand in hand with a LMC director to refinance, consolidate debt, and improve their financial position. London Manhattan's clients include both those having excellent credit and those who may have credit quality issues. We can also assist in mergers or acquisitions, and maximize a company's financial opportunities.London Manhattan is a long-established corporate finance firm. London Manhattan has arranged more than $1 billion in debt and equity facilities for its clients over the past ten years. London Manhattan has successfully completed assignments in many industry sectors including: manufacturing, oil and gas, healthcare, telecommunications, information technology, environmental services, food services, government contracting, information processing, commercial real estate, retail and financial services.Most of the London Manhattan team have started their own businesses or held chief executive officer, chief financial officer or senior management positions for prominent private and public organizations. Consequently, London Manhattan brings to its clientele more than just corporate finance proficiencies; it brings valuable perspective gained from senior level involvement in many different industries, businesses and situations.London Manhattan has been so successful for its clients that it requires no advance payment of fees. At no expense to the client, London Manhattan prepares a Financial Options Report, based on preliminary due diligence, which reveals the terms and conditions the client can expect, given its business profile and goals.London Manhattan's references are available upon request.    Show Less

column6: Attract Capital (AC) is a nationally focused mezzanine lender-related firm that was founded in 2000. AC delivers junior capital funding solutions and merger and acquisition services to middle market companies.  We have over 100 lenders that we source financing from for our clients.  We have been involved in over $1 billion of middle market financings. We specialize in helping middle market business owners, fundless sponsors and sell side brokers quickly source debt capital. Deal sizes range from $3 million to $50 million.

column6: PineBridge Investments is an independent asset management firm with approximately $77 billion of AUM spanning multiple asset classes across the globe, including public equities, fixed income and alternative investments. PineBridge Structured Capital is an investment team within PineBridge Investments which provides creative junior debt and equity to middle market companies operating in a range of industries. The PineBridge Structured Capital team has invested over $2.0 billion and completed 70 investments since 2000 in a variety of situations including buyouts, recapitalizations, and growth financings.    Show Less

column6: RLJ Credit is a middle-market private equity firm and Junior Capital Providor focused on generating long-term capital appreciation by investing in profitable, growing businesses led by strong management teams and by providing Mezzanine, Debt, Unitranche, and Credit and or Lines of Credit. Founded in 2006 by Robert L. Johnson through a strategic alliance with The Carlyle Group, RLJ originates, structures and invests in traditional buy-outs, recapitalizations, and growth capital infusions (Debt, Mezzanine, Unitranche, Senior Debt). Our mission is to establish RLJ as the pre-eminent middle-market private equity firm in the United States. Our advantage stems from the access and resources provided by our founding partners, combined with the extensive relationships and operational expertise of our Executive Network, an accomplished group of proven industry leaders which collectively brings a unique depth of business experience to our investments. Our approach is to leverage these relationships to source proprietary investment opportunities, consistently create value within our portfolio companies, and generate superior returns for our investors through debt, credit, and unitranche. RLJ Credit provides flexible debt, unitranche debt, mezzanine, and credit solutions for both private equity sponsored and non-sponsored lower middle market companies. RLJ can provide senior, subordinated, or unitranche loans to support buyouts, recapitalizations, refinancings, and growth financings. RLJ Credit generally will invest between $3 to $10 million per transaction, with the capability to complete larger transactions through co-investments from the Fund's limited partners. RLJ Credit can provide several debt and equity instruments including but no limited to: Unitranche or "One-Stop" Debt Financing "Last-Out" Senior Credit Facilities Senior Secured Lien Notes Subordinated Debt Equity Co-Investments RLJ Credit - www.rljcredit.com Contact: Dwayne Boothe    Show Less

column6: Highlights * Cash from an intellectual property acquisition valued at 3X to 7X trailing 12 month EBITDA * Transactions between $20 million and $250 million cost competitive with senior or unitranche debt * Leveraging U.S. Economic Development Programs to provide a new and unique way to provide capital.Leeward provides capital to technology enabled businesses through the acquisition of the Company's Enterprise Resource Platform or Information Technology Systems ("ERP/IT"). Instead of underwriting the book value of these assets, Leeward underwrites the strategic value of the ERP/IT systems to the Company. Leeward provides for the use of the acquired ERP/IT systems back to the seller through an exclusive Application Service Provider agreement. Leeward can provide enterprise level multiples at a cost of capital competitive with senior or unitranche debt so long as the ERP/IT system is mission critical to the Company's product or service offering. Leeward offers Financial Sponsors a unique source of capital for acquisitions and Owner/Operators a significant liquidity event without the sale of equity. Leeward's unique structure leverages the U.S. Virgin Islands' economic development programs and the Territory's robust telecommunications infrastructure.    Show Less

column6: Noble Lending Group, a division of Noble Funding, provides no collateral business loans $25,000-$2 Million. Our loans are fully subordinated debt to senior secured lenders such as banks, asset based lenders, and factors. We do not charge any upfront fees or closing fees, so our clients receive their approved loan amount in full. We furnish loan offers within 24-48 hours of submission, and fund in 3-4 business days. Our working capital loans are generally re-paid within a year. However, our clients may re-borrow once their loan has been paid down to half. For example, on a $100,000 loan, once the loan has been paid down to $50,000, clients may re-borrow $50,000 over and over like a line of credit. This feature provides ongoing working capital to satisfy growth initiatives beyond what a senior lender can offer. Noble Funding arranges asset based lines of credit $1 million-$35 million leveraging clients A/R, inventory, M&E, commercial property, and intellectual property. Both Noble Lending Group and Noble Funding have A+ ratings with the Better Business Bureau and have never received one complaint since our inception in 2005.    Show Less

column6: The Peachtree team founded the private equity business of Wachovia bank in 1997. While there, they were responsible for the bank's mezzanine investing, direct private equity investing plus commitments to third party, independent funds. In 2002 the team formed Peachtree Equity as an independent private equity fund to provide growth equity to profitable, Southeast businesses managed by owner-operators. In 2009, the team established Peachtree II to capitalize on attractive opportunities in the mezzanine debt market.

column6: Banyan Mezzanine Fund, L.P.was founded in 2002 to provide mezzanine capital to smaller middle-market companies headquartered primarily in the Southeast. Mezzanine capital is used to supplement a company's debt capacity beyond banks' credit limitations and is a substantially cheaper and less dilutive alternative to equity financing. With over $400 million of committed capital from Fund I (2004) and Fund II (2007), we can provide financing of approximately $2 million to $8 million to companies which meet our investment criteria, generally structured in the form of subordinated debt with attached warrants (for the future purchase of common equity). Banyan can also arrange larger financings through its partners or affiliations with other firms. Such financings are typically used for growth expansion, acquisitions, recapitalizations and management buyouts. Banyan's focus is on companies with seasoned management teams, revenues greater than $5 million, profitable high margin operations and in growing industry segments. We will not invest in start-ups, turn-arounds, or in real estate development, oil and gas operations or direct lending businesses. We strive to contribute beyond the capital we provide to our clients, by entering into a close partnership arrangement with management teams coupling high integrity with a desire to build substantial enterprise value. We expect to be active following the financing, making available our extensive corporate finance, lending and strategic management advisory experience. Investment Objectives: Banyan expects to form a close working partnership with each portfolio company's management team with the ultimate goal of enhancing each company's enterprise value. Our belief is that our capital commitment combined with our financial and operational expertise will provide each of our portfolio companies with a significant competitive advantage. Investment Criteria: The Fund seeks investment candidates that have the following: Companies with revenues generally greater than $5 million Experienced management teams with meaningful ownership interests Historical and sustainable high margin cash flow, with minimal cyclicality Solid industry fundamentals with favorable prospects combined with a defensible market position Effective financial controls and information systems Private and public companies No real estate development, oil and gas exploration, direct lenders, start-ups or turn-around situations. The Fund will primarily pursue investment opportunities in the Southeastern United States, with particular emphasis placed on Florida, although we will also invest in opportunities outside the Southeast. In fact, several investments are diversified geographically from Southern California to Texas to Pennsylvania    Show Less

column6: Harvest Capital Credit Corporation is a publicly-traded (NASDAQ: HCAP) specialty finance company that provides customized financing to small and mid-sized businesses. Harvest provides tailored revolving lines of credit, uni-tranche term loans, subordinated debt investments and equity investments. Harvest offers a creative and flexible approach in multiple layers of a company's capital structure. Target Market Harvest provides cash flow-based credit facilities for companies with a history of consistent profitability and opportunistic asset-based transactions in situations where collateral coverage mitigates recent operational under-performance. Harvest works alongside private equity sponsors as well as directly with business owners/operators for companies with revenues of $10 million to $75 million. Target Investment Size Flexible investment structures can be in credit and equity form. Investments range in size from $3.0 million to $15.0 million, and Harvest has closed larger deals alongside select partner relationships. Investment Objective Harvest's primary investment objective is to generate current yield income.  An ideal financing candidate for Harvest Capital Credit has the following characteristics: äó¢ Is an established, U.S.- or Canadian-based company äó¢ Maintains significant market share in a defensible industry niche äó¢ Has sound historical financial performance with industry appropriate margins äó¢ Has low risk of technological and/or product obsolescence äó¢ Maintains a diversified customer and supplier base äó¢ Has a solid and proven management team with aligned incentives äó¢ Generates minimum EBITDA of $1,500,000 äó¢ Has a financing need of at least $3,000,000    Show Less

column6: Marquette Capital Partners is a private investment firm established in 1997 to make junior capital investments in mature lower middle market companies. Marquette Capital Partners was initially funded with capital from the family of the late Mr. Carl R. Pohlad, a highly successful entrepreneur and businessman. Mr. Pohlad built his business from the ground up with hard work and prudent investment decisions. He surrounded himself with quality people to enable him to realize his vision. That entrepreneurial, dedicated investment style remains the bedrock of our firm.Marquette Capital Partners is managed by a small number of seasoned professionals who provide significant resources as a result of their affiliation with a sophisticated and supportive financial services conglomerate. The investment business is truly a people business, driven by trust and mutual respect.The common thread to our success has been our commitment to partner with companies and management teams with a proven business model and a well-conceived strategy for long-term earnings growth and value creation.We offer a flexible approach. Equity investments may be on either a minority or a majority ownership basis with equity partners. This broad flexibility enables us to provide capital solutions that are tailored to the situation and accommodate the needs of small and medium-sized businesses throughout the United States operating principally in the manufacturing, distribution, and business services industries. Marquette Capital Partners currently invests via Marquette Capital Fund II, LP, a Small Business Investment Company (SBIC) licensed by the US Small Business Administration. The fund, which raised approximately $95 million, has been in operation since 2011. To date, we have raised three funds and invested in a total of 42 companies primarily in the form of mezzanine debt securities usually with some form of equity participation. Our investments have funded internal growth strategies, new acquisitions, management buyouts, leveraged buyouts, and recapitalizations. We have partnered with numerous financial institutions and a wide array of ownership groups, including a significant number of family-controlled companies.In addition to completing transactions for the fund, Marquette Capital Partners has the ability on a select basis, through the resources of its affiliates, to make investments that do not fit SBA parameters.    Show Less

column6: Saratoga Investment Corp. is a publicly traded (NYSE: SAR) business development company (BDC). We provide customized financing solutions for middle market companies located in the United States. Our investment professionals have a combined 80+ years of experience investing over $4 billion in middle market businesses. Flexible Financing SolutionsWe take a solutions oriented approach to investing and seek to craft capital structures that work for all stakeholders. We understand the importance of providing feedback quickly, being creative in transaction structuring, and closing transactions on time. Saratoga offers a broad range of financing solutions for our partners, including subordinated debt, first and second lien loans, oneäóêstop and unitranche structures and equity coäóêinvestments. Partnership ApproachWe seek to partner with owners and operators of middle market businesses to help create value over the long term. Our professionals have unique experience investing in all parts of the capital structure across numerous industries. We use the perspective gained from our experience to support business owners (equity sponsors, independent sponsors, familyäóêowned businesses) and management teams with patient capital and guidance as they execute their business plans. We typically make $5 million to $20 million investments in:Leveraged & Management Buyouts ŒæRecapitalizations ŒæŒæGrowth FinancingsŒæAcquisition Financings ŒæŒæTransitional FinancingsŒæDownload our marketing brochure here:http://www.saratogainvestmentcorp.com/SAR_Overview.pdf    Show Less

column6: Capital Southwest (NASDAQ: CSWC), is an internally-managed, credit-focused BDC that is an active capital provider to middle market companies across the capital structure.Relationships drive our businessRelationships are the key driver of our business. We consider what is best for our long-term relationship in every decision we make.We are highly responsiveWe believe that a quick äóìnoäóù, with constructive feedback is always better than a drawn-out, unnecessary process. Our team constantly communicates with one another, which allows us to respond quickly to investment opportunities.We deliver on our promisesWe will clearly communicate what we are willing to do and deliver on our promises. Our tight-knit organization allows for senior deal professionals to continually communicate with one another and äóìspeak for the firmäóù throughout the transaction. We believe this provides a more predictable diligence, approval and closing process.We are creative and flexibleOur team has invested together across credit cycles and understands the nuances of middle market companies. We have the mandate to invest senior debt, subordinated debt or equity äóñ or combinations of the three äóñ in each transaction, to meet the unique objectives of the company, and fairly price the underlying risk.We always have capital to investAs a public company, we enjoy a permanent capital base and are never "between funds." We are therefore able to provide capital for growth and acquisitions over very long periods of time. We believe our best opportunities are ones in which we can support company management teams in industries in which we have gained a track record of value creation and back them in significantly scaling their businesses.    Show Less

column6: Super G Funding, LLC, based in Newport Beach, CA, is a national provider of entrepreneur friendly small business financing solutions with loans ranging in size from $100,000 - $5,000,000. Super G Funding specializes in residual and commission based loans in addition to traditional cash flow loans. Super G Funding offers fast and easy funding with terms ranging from 12-to-48 months and a broad use of funds with owner friendly covenants.Super Gäó»s cash flow lending division structures and funds senior and second lien cash flow loans to lower-middle market and middle market businesses in a variety of industries across the country.  This unique product provides capital to companies that often fall into one or more of the following scenarios: (i) additional capital is required and the existing senior lender is unable to increase availability, (ii) ownership is seeking a non-dilutive growth capital solution, (iii) the business cannot obtain traditional bank financing, or (iv) there is a special business situation and a quick deal closing is necessary.    Show Less

column6: Intermediate Capital Group is a leading, global investment firm with approximately $17 billion of assets under management. We are focused on providing creative capital solutions and dependable execution for middle market companies. We have the flexibility to invest across the capital structure and in various currencies, which allows us to support companies through the different stages of their life cycle. In North America, we are looking to invest $20-100 million in market leading companies with $10 million of EBITDA and up.

column6: Decathlon Capital Partners provides revenue-based funding solutions to established companies across a wide range of industry segments and U.S. geographies. As a leading provider of revenue-based financing, the Decathlon team has worked with hundreds of growth-focused businesses during the past decade and offers companies flexible, patient, capital solutions without the dilution, costs, operational overhead and loss of control that typically comes with equity-based funding. Decathlon's revenue-funding approach allows companies to secure growth capital in exchange for a small, fixed percentage of future revenues without any dilution, personal guarantees or financial covenants. Decathlon typically works with companies who have between $2 million and $50 million in annual revenue and are seeking capital to fund growth, operational enhancements or founder-liquidity needs. To learn more about how Decathlon's revenue-based financing solutions can provide company-friendly growth capital to your organization please visit www.decathloncapital.com.    Show Less

column6: Seacoast Capital invests mezzanine and equity capital in small, growing companies led by strong, entrepreneurial management teams. We invest in high quality U.S. businesses that are market leaders in our target industrial sectors of manufacturing, distribution, business services and industrial technologies. We look for companies in growing or fragmented industries with revenues in excess of $10 million and operating earnings in excess of $2.0 million. The investment opportunity may be an acquisition, management buyout or internal growth. We have a particular interest in companies located in underserved urban and rural markets. In all cases, we partner with managers who have proven track records and significant equity stakes    Show Less

We invest in a broad range of industries throughout North America, but have been particularly active over the years in asset-light service businesses.    Show Less

column6: Triangle Capital Corporation is a publicly traded, internally managed business development company ("BDC"). We provide customized financing solutions for lower middle market companies located throughout the United States. We typically invest $5 to $25 million for: Leveraged Buyouts Management Buyouts Recapitalizations Growth Financings ESOPs Acquisition Financings Triangle offers a wide range of financing structures to our private equity partners, including subordinated debt with warrants, first and second lien loans, one-stop and uni-tranche structures, and equity co-investments. We also have extensive experience partnering with financial sponsors and leading unsponsored transactions. We focus on investments in lower middle market companies with a history of generating revenues and positive cash flows, an established market position, and a proven management team with a strong operating discipline. Our target portfolio companies typically have revenues of $10 million to $200 million, and EBITDA of $3 million and up. Triangle's management team has a unique mix of finance and operating expertise in a wide range of industries. Our portfolio contains investments in many business sectors including manufacturing, distribution, transportation, energy, communications, health services, restaurants, and others. We understand the importance of evaluating transactions quickly, following through on our commitments, and closing deals on time.    Show Less

column6: St. Cloud Capital is a Los Angeles-based private investment firm founded in 2001 that provides growth capital to the lower middle market. St. Cloud takes an opportunistic and flexible approach that provides for a diverse range of transactions. St. Cloud has made 50 portfolio investments across three funds. Investments have been made in a wide range of industries and in every layer of the capital structure, including senior secured debt, subordinated debt, and preferred and common stock. St. Cloud typically invests in non-control situations, acting as both a financial and strategic partner to strong management teams and industry entrepreneurs in fulfilling their long-term growth plans.    Show Less

column6: Canal Holdings, LLC is a private equity firm investing junior capital (mezzanine, preferred equity, and minority common equity) in growing businesses at the lower end of the middle-market. Canal provides investment capital and strategic insight to the owners and management teams of closely-held companies. Companies seek Canaläó»s investment to finance organic growth, add-on acquisitions, recapitalizations, buyouts, and other ownership transitions. Canal believes that people and process are the key drivers of long-term meaningful performance. We invest in and partner with those management teams that have the appropriate executive talent in place, are provided the right incentives to succeed, and can document a history of sound business decisions.Canal typically invests $2-$7 million per transaction in companies with revenues of $5-$50 million and EBITDA of $1-$5 million.  Often, Canal is the sole, and only, institutional investor, and we seek to provide our portfolio companies with the benefits of our extensive financial, strategic, and operational experience.    Show Less

column6: Alloy Merchant Finance (AMF) provides specialty financing (mezzanine and similar structures), asset and cash flow based lending, and leasing to growth companies in Mexico and the United States. AMF focuses on the Hispanic market in the United States, but also considers opportunities in the broader economy - especially in situations where there is a tie to Mexico.The company began operations in 2015 and has offices in Houston and Mexico City.AMF's target check size is $250,000 to $2.5 million.

column6: Northport Capital is a direct lender that specializes in providing credit facilities to private middle market and lower middle market companies.åÊ Northport Capital, LLC is a subsidiary of Resource America, Inc. The members of the Northport Investment Committee have over 70 years of combined corporate credit experience. In 2014, Northport closed over 25 transactions.    Show Less

column6: With over $2 billion of assets under management, CION Investment Management, an ICON Investment company, and its affiliates ("CION"), provide flexible debt capital to domestic and international middle market companies through senior, subordinated, unitranche, and second lien secured loans as well as capital and operating lease financings. CION has executed more than $4.5 billion of investments over the years and it has the industry expertise, capability, and willingness to provide your business with cash flow loans and asset based financings for growth, working capital, capex, acquisitions, buyouts, recapitalizations and more. With over 30 years of history supporting manufacturing and industrial businesses with creative financing solutions, CION is the ideal partner for your capital needs. Learn more about the ICON Investments at http://www.iconinvestments.com/.    Show Less

column6: Zuber Lawler & Del Duca's seasoned corporate and commercial attorneys represent numerous private equity groups and companies seeking transactions in various sectors, including: Biotechnology; Business Services; Clean Tech; Chemicals; Consumer goods; Distribution (both wholesale and retail); Energy; Entertainment; Finance; Financial Institutions; Food and beverage ; Health Care; Hospitality; Life Sciences; Logistics; Manufacturing; Materials; Media; Medical Devices; Nanotechnology; Real estate development; Retail; Software; Technology; Telecommunications; and Transportation. Zuber Lawler & Del Duca's mergers and acquisitions practice is rich and diverse, both in deal size and complexity. As a full service, multi-disciplinary law firm, we bring the full breadth of our practice to bear on our M&A representations. While the primary responsibility for conducting a merger and/or acquisition transaction rests with our corporate department, we regularly introduce to these transactions attorneys from our other departments who themselves have developed substantial M&A expertise within their areas of specialization. These include members of our bankruptcy, employment, environmental, intellectual property, real estate and tax practice groups. Our deal roster includes a wide variety of: Corporate mergers and acquisitions as counsel for both purchasers and sellers; Acquisitions and dispositions of divisions, business units and specific assets; Purchases and sales of minority and controlling equity positions; Cross-border transactions; and Joint ventures and strategic alliances.    Show Less

column6: I am an M&A lawyer with K&L Gates in Los Angeles and help my clients and contacts find companies to acquire and I also help them get financing to make the acquistions.My clients are either management teams from industry or companies in the business of the target. Prefer acquistions of at least$5M EBITDA ..K&L Gates represents leading global corporations, growth and middle-market companies, capital markets participants and entrepreneurs in every major industry group as well as public sector entities, educational institutions, philanthropic organizations and individuals. Our practice is a robust full market practice ‰ÛÓ cutting edge, complex and dynamic, at once regional, national and international in scope. Over the last three years our revenues exceeded $1 Billion and, as stated in the July 2010 issue of the UK publication Legal Business, the firm "has further cemented its position as the Global 100's fastest growing firm."Mergers & Acquisitions Names K&L Gates 2012 "Law Firm of the Year" for Mid-Market M&ANew York - Global law firm K&L Gates LLP has been honored as "Law Firm of the Year" in Mergers & Acquisitions magazine's 2012 M&A Mid-Market Awards. The award recognizes K&L Gates for its strong performance in 2012 and its global approach to middle market mergers and acquisitions, as well as its own continued growth, including the firm's recent combination with Middletons in Australia."Our M&A team is emblematic of the firm - integrated across the globe, rooted in our 47 communities, and serving the full market," said Peter J. Kalis, K&L Gates Chairman and Global Managing Partner. "This extraordinary distinction is well deserved."During 2012, K&L Gates completed more than 160 M&A transactions - of which 45 were cross-border - having an aggregate value of approximately $39 billion. While the firm's corporate lawyers also work on very large transactions, including for example assisting American Airlines in its pending $11 billion merger with US Airways, the vast majority of K&L Gates' M&A activity involves deals in the $25 million to $1 billion range.The firm's worldwide 350-lawyer M&A group has experience across a wide range of industries, with particular strength in technology, media and telecom; energy, infrastructure and resources; financial services; manufacturing; healthcare/life sciences; and transportation. Deals for 2012 included such representations as:. Advance America, Cash Advance Centers (NYSE:AEA) in its $780 million sale to Grupo Elektra of Mexico. Microsoft in its sale to NBC Universal of its 50% interest in MSNBC. Halliburton subsidiary Landmark Software and Services in the acquisition of Houston-based Petris Technology, a global data management and geoservices company. TxVia, a leading payments solutions company, in its sale to Google. The Carlyle Group in its $100 million takeover of vwd group, a German public company providing market data solutions. Ridgemont Equity Partners in the leveraged acquisition of Hometown Urgent Care, an owner/operator of urgent care clinics in the midwestern United States. Boralex (TSX:BLX) in its acquisitions in France of a wind farm from AES Corporation (NYSE:AES) and three wind projects from Innovent SAS. Omnicom Group's Diversified Agency Services in its acquisition of a majority stake in Medical Collective Intelligence Co. Ltd., a leading Japanese online medical communications agencyRobert P. Zinn, co-leader of K&L Gates' firmwide corporate practice, stated: "We are grateful to receive this market recognition of our leading global M&A practice serving the expanded middle market. We do bet-the-company deals for mid-sized and emerging growth companies - and private equity firms investing in them - and middle market as well as large deals for big companies. Our emphasis is on providing integrated, multi-disciplinary, global, and cost-effective services to these otherwise often underserved client markets."    Show Less

column6: Ganatra Law PLLC - US Law for Global Business (SM) Based in Manhattan and a stone‰Ûªs throw away from the United Nations, Ganatra Law PLLC is a New York City law firm providing exceptionally high quality and sophisticated US corporate and business law services. Avinash ‰ÛÏAvi‰Ûù Ganatra is the Firm‰Ûªs President and Head of Global Corporate Practice. Avi is the quintessential US and cross border corporate lawyer. He brings to bear for the benefit of his clients a formidable combination of exceptional experience, dedication to client service, rich professional and cultural diversity and multi-faceted creativity. Avi has 20 years of experience practicing as a US and cross border capital markets, leveraged finance, private equity and M&A lawyer in New York City. Avi practiced for the majority of his career at the preeminent global law firm, Skadden Arps, in its New York office. column6: Welcome to gunnercooke‰Û_‰Û_a very different type of law firmgunnercooke is a boutique corporate law firm with one, clear vision: to challenge, improve and evolve the way legal services are provided.An uncompromising business, the firm is built around a simple premise: at all times maintain a strong client centric core that focuses on adding value and going above and beyond what clients expect. After all, in today's competitive marketplace, we know that being a good lawyer is just not enough. So we give more relevant advice, do more than our clients expect and work with them, as opposed to for them, in true partnership.The firm takes great pride in accomplishing an objective. Employing only the brightest, most experienced, and most commercially aware lead partners ensures our clients will always have an edge. Indeed, the quality of our lawyers is essential to the growth of our practice and we invest heavily to ensure that we have not just the best legal brains, but the best business ones too. Our lawyers are dealmakers in the truest sense of the word. But whilst we ensure that what we do makes a real difference, we also know the way we do it is equally important and by challenging the traditional delivery of corporate legal services, it's our service delivery model that truly sets us apart. Our overheads are kept low so we can keep your overheads low, operating a fixed fee system. So no timesheets. And technical support is acquired from the best, brightest and most appropriate lawyers in the UK and worldwide: without restriction.Our ambitions are large and our experience is beyond measure. If you feel having looked through our website that you would benefit from talking with gunnercooke and using our model, please get in touch. We'll listen to your goals and work with you to make them happen.Darryl Cooke"I don't want lawyers to tell me what I cannot do; I hire them to tell me how to do what I want to do." JP Morgan    Show Less

column6: Generational Equity and its professionals have worked with Middle Market business owners who are contemplating a sale or seeking merger and acquisition opportunities. We assist owners in all areas of stock or asset sales, mergers, or divestitures. Our highly experienced Merger and Acquisition specialists provide insight and strategies on such matters as: When is the right time to sell? Should all or part of the business be sold? Is the company ready for sale, or should the focus be on building value for a future sale? For most Middle Market business owners the sale or other transition of a business is the single most important, and perhaps the largest, financial event that occurs in the life of the owner. Most Middle Market business owners do not have an exit strategy. Selling at the wrong time or without the right information can substantially lower the value of the business. We regularly conduct informational one-day conferences that provide business owners with an overview of the process necessary to successfully sell a private middle market business for maximum value. The information presented in the conference will be a vital part of a strategy to ultimately sell your business for the highest possible price. Our seasoned M&A professionals can help the business owner anticipate challenges and understand what needs to be done at every juncture of a transaction. For each business owner, we can prepare a customized marketing strategy that presents the business to the most appropriate potential buyers while maintaining strict Client confidentiality. We also have access to thousands of buyers who are actively seeking to acquire middle-market companies.    Show Less

column6: BTI Group is the largest and most active merger and acquisition ("M&A") firm serving the western United States. The firm provides expert M & A services to privately held, mid-sized companies with revenues of up to $100 million. With an unmatched depth of experience and a vast network of buyers including corporate strategic buyers, private equity groups, and high net worth individuals, we have completed more than 5,300 transactions since 1981. Our international affiliations enable us to reach buyers and sellers represented by other intermediary firms throughout the world. With our team of experienced professionals, BTI Group is well prepared to help our clients achieve their goals through successful mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures. In addition to possessing extensive deal-making expertise, our team members are experienced entrepreneurs and operators who have founded, owned, and run companies. Our value-added services include business valuation, pre-marketing consulting to maximize value, and exit strategy planning.    Show Less

column6: At International Business Exchange Corporation we realize that buying or selling a business might just prove to be the largest and most important transaction you undertake in your lifetime. Results are what our clients engage us to achieve and our accomplishments are measured by fulfilling those results. With combined experience of over 100 years, intermediaries at International Business Exchange Corporation are certified, seasoned and qualified professionals that abide by an unwavering code of ethics and are dedicated to assisting individuals, business owners, public companies and private equity groups with selling and buying all types of privately held businesses. Our team of experienced account representatives understand private companies, how they operate and how to present them properly to prospective buyers and focus their efforts on making your sale or purchase experience as hassle free and rewarding as possible. In addition, we also have the business contacts, the proper tools, a skilled support staff and the financial resources to identify and attract buyers whose goals are compatible with those of the sellers.By partnering with IBEC, you will be working with extremely competent, results oriented professionals who completely understand the details of the process and emotions involved in selling and buying a business.    Show Less

column6: IAG, LLC is a business intermediary consulting firm that facilitates the buying and selling of businesses. For more than 25 years our management team has helped lead the industry, allowing owners of privately-held companies to get the best payoff possible. Services include consulting, securing accredited third party business valuations and pro forma portrayals of future business performance, seller-buyer matching, providing funding resources for buy/sell transactions, tax planning and deal structure analysis. IAG locates buyers, engages them in a competitive process, and helps negotiate successful transactions - all while protecting confidentiality on both ends and minimizing litigation and other risks.    Show Less

We service a wide variety of Businesses on a Professional and Confidential Basis.We can HELP YOU SELL YOUR BUSINESS, COMPANY or CORPORATION.They include SERVICE COMPANIES, HEALTH AND MEDICAL, EDUCATIONAL, AEROSPACE, BEAUTY INDUSTRY, DISTRIBUTERS, HOTELS, THEATERS, WHOLESALERS, MANUFACTURERS, INTERNET MARKETING, IMPORTERS, PRODUCTION, MARKETING, DISTRIBUTION and TECHNOLOGY Companies AS WELL AS PATENT HOLDERS of MANY DESCRIPTIONS..LISITEN ASSOCIATES Personal Attention, Professionalism, Methodology and Integrity COMPLETELY SET US APART from other Brokerages Serving this Market.We can HELP YOU SELL YOUR COMPANY , BUSINESS or CORPORATION or LICENSE your Business WORLDWIDE.If you are not ready to sell, LISITEN ASSOCIATES BUSINESS BROKERS can help you on a CONSULTING basis to aid you in Valuing your Company , Strategies for Growth, EXIT Strategies, EMarketing, Sales, Advertising, Production, Business Operations and Planning Improvements.Today LISITEN ASSOCIATES has become the LEADING PREMIER BUSINESS BROKERAGE COMPANY in The Tri-State Area according to "NEWSDAY" , "WSJ" , THE DEAL ONLINE, WOMEN'S WEAD DAILY, LICENSING BOOK, DNR, ,and " CRAINS NEW YORK BUSINESS".MEL LISITEN appears regularly on "THE BIG BIZ SHOW " Radio and TV. as well as teaching "How to Buy or Sell a Business" at TOURO College in Manhattan.Most Recently , LISITEN ASSOCIATES has been Awarded the COVETED"2008, 2009, 2010 ,2011,2012 , 2013 , 2014 AND 2015 BEST BUSINESS BROKER AWARDS" given by the USBLA.LISITEN ASSOCIATES is the only Business Brokerage Company to win this Award EIGHT YEARS IN A ROW.2015 - LISITEN ASSOCIATES GETS NOMINATED TO "THE BUSINESS HALL OF FAME"    Show Less

column6: BCMS Corporate specializes in sell-side advisory services for middle market business owners. Entrepreneurs spend years building a business. Ultimately, they reach a point when it's time to sell. Most at this point face the largest economic event of their lifetime. Future plans and goals hang in the balance. At BCMS, we understand the time and effort owners put into building their businesses. Our focus is on achieving deals that recognize the true value of the business. The inspiration for BCMS was laid over 20 years ago when founders Brian, Dave and Stephen Rebbettes sold their first company, Contract Leads. Since that time, BCMS Corporate has grown to over 200 employees across three continents. Our Philosophy: Conceptualizing value when selling a business The most crucial advice we give our clients when selling a business is to distinguish between value and price. Many clients are eager for us to appraise their business. They believe that an appraisal of a business will indicate the price that a buyer would be willing to pay. Yet, traditional business appraisals are calculated using return on investment metrics ‰ÛÒ they calculate price based on standard industry multiples of historic profit. While this approach may be appropriate for a bank evaluating a loan proposal or for a company in severe decline, it will likely discount the true market value of your company based upon its future potential in the hands of a purchaser. What distinguishes price from value? Could there be more? Consider the additional value found in your client lists, skilled workforce, reputation, and other intangibles that aren't expressed in numbers. How could a buyer with better resources take your company to the next level? At BCMS, we focus on marketing and selling your business in a way that promotes the added value of these elements when exposed to the market. Those intangible components are part of what makes your business unique, and they fundamentally enhance its salability. Your business is worth every penny the market is willing to pay. We're here to help you find out how much that can be.    Show Less

column6: Core Capital Group is an M&A advisory firm that has served the strategic transactional needs of business owners for more than 20 years. The skills, contacts and specialized experience of all senior-level dealmakers are brought to bear to support you. We work with companies across the nation and throughout the world. We welcome the opportunity to speak with you about how we can help your company grow and thrive.    Show Less

column6: The management at United brings with them years of entrepreneurial experience in finance, marketing, and operations. Each of the Directors at United has owned and managed medium to large businesses and subsequently sold them. This means that all those within United's Management team have gone through the same experience as their clients. United understands every aspect of the business world and has gained a great reputation within the Mergers & Acquisitions marketplace. In addition, United has developed strong alliances within the legal, financial, and accounting communities. We provide an in-depth company review and recommend the right resources to improve the value of your company. United is an expert in staging the right resources for any particular need to add significant business value. United's experience and alliances has proven to be a winning formula within the Mergers and Acquisition marketplace. Just ask our clients who have used our services. Consulting: Our Mergers & Acquisitions Consulting practice comprises a team devoted exclusively to deal development and transaction closure. United Mergers & Acquisitions Consultants' multi-disciplinary approach engages financial, legal and regulatory specialists from appropriate industries and geographic locations to suit the client's needs, and maintains strict professional confidentiality throughout each deal.    Show Less

column6: American Healthcare Capital is a 25 year old, full service, nationwide mergers & acquisitions advisory firm. With over $1 Billion in active Sell-Side and Buy-Side engagements, we cover the entire spectrum of the healthcare industry including but not limited to Home Health, Hospice, Private Duty, Behavioral Health, IDD, DME, Medical Staffing, Long Term Care and all types of Pharmacy. With an emphasis on healthcare transactions, we understand the need for a unique approach to the healthcare services sector. Since we're always in the market, we pride ourselves on our intimate, real time knowledge of the marketplace. Since our network of buyers is larger than any other middle-market advisory firm, we know who's buying for a premium, who is selling for a discount, and what deals can get financing. We also own Healthcare Receivable Lenders, which provides competitive, non-recourse accounts receivable financing in conjunction with Union Bank, as well as real estate loans for healthcare facilities. Our full scope of services include: 1. Sell Side Engagements 2. Buy Side Engagements 3. Accounts Receivable Lending 4. Real Estate Loans for Healthcare Facilities    Show Less

column6: World Business Brokers is based in Miami, FL and has been a leader in the merger and acquisition business. As Lower Middle Market Intermediaries, we assist principals of both privately held and publicly traded businesses in Buy-Side or Sell-Side opportunities. For over 40 years, we have been successfully serving South Florida and have handled over a billion dollars worth of transactions. World Business Brokers has been constantly rated by South Florida Business Journal and other media publications among the top commercial brokerage firms. One of the keys to our long standing success on the Sell-Side has been our ability to market companies without employees, customers or competitors knowing an owner is considering an exit strategy. In addition, business owners find using World Business Brokers enables them to continue running their business as usual. Potential buyers are prequalified, vetted and placed under Confidentiality Agreements and Non-disclosure Agreements before being introduced to an opportunity. Our entire process allows business owners considering an exit strategy to be more productive and stay in control of the process. In representing buyers, World Business Brokers acts as a third party for buyers who prefer anonymity. Our search includes the identification, initial contact, and screening of potential targets. These targets are qualified based on the buyers criteria and then presented for consideration. Contact us to assist you in meeting your company‰Ûªs objectives. Whether your needs are immediate or long-term to sell your business or to make acquisitions, assist with mergers, joint ventures, private debt and equity financing or succession planning, give us a call and let us show you how we can help your business plans achieve all your goals.    Show Less

column6: Since its founding in 1987, ProForma West has established itself as one of the top independently owned merger & acquisition and business broker firms in the western United States. We have distinguished ourselves with the outstanding quality and professionalism of our business intermediaries, excellence in our procedures and deal management and, most importantly, our dedication to our clients' success. Our primary market focus is on companies with more than one million dollars in annual sales revenue.Business owners who are ready to make a transition are faced with critically important decisions. Choosing the right team to help you get your company ready for sale and position it for maximum value is the first phase. The second phase is working with that team to take it to market, find the right buyer, and achieve your value goals in a deal that reflects the hard work that went into building your company.At ProForma West, our job is to understand your exit objectives, help you understand what buyers and investors are looking for so we can help you position your business for maximum value, and then locate quality business buyers and manage the deal to a successful closing. With offices in Colorado and California, our multi-site approach allows us to gain far greater exposure to business owners and prospective business acquirers in the western U.S., throughout the country and internationally.    Show Less

column6: Sand River Capital Advisors is an independent advisory firm providing corporate finance and strategic consulting services to corporations, private equity firms, financial institutions and institutional investors. Sand River strives to serve as an advocate and critical long-term partner to its clients through a partnership approach and a commitment to exceptional performance and uncompromising integrity. Sand River can assist management teams by identifying value-enhancement corporate finance opportunities and developing a comprehensive and executable plan with respect to the articulation of the business, optimal capital structure and capital raising strategy. Sand River's corporate finance capabilities and services include: - Comprehensive financial analysis of a potential transaction - Advice on optimal capital structure - Guidance on proposed transaction structure - Assistance with preparation of deal materials to articulate a transaction, such as management presentation, teaser memo and supporting financial models and documentation - Support of management, in coordination with counsel as appropriate, in the preparation of offering memorandum and supporting documentation - Development of capital raising strategies, including the identification of prospective investors from a universe of traditional and alternative sources of both equity and debt financing - Advice on structuring and negotiation of transaction terms and conditions - Facilitation of the documentation and closing process    Show Less

column6: McCulloch Capital Advisors helps entrepreneurs build successful venturesMcCulloch Capital is a venture merchant bank and advisory firm that partners with business owners to define, finance, and implement growth initiatives or execute critical transactions.‰Û¢Have a promising venture but need help getting to the next level?‰Û¢Interested in expanding via acquisition?‰Û¢Could you use help raising capital to fund your growth?‰Û¢Too busy running the business to make progress on expansion strategies?‰Û¢Ready to explore a sale of your business?McCulloch Capital brings a deep background in strategy consulting, venture capital, and M&A to help clients address these challenges and realize the potential of their ventures.We selectively make principal investments with clients, making the firm part merchant bank, part strategy consultant.  We also provide investment banking and outsourced corporate development services including capital raises, acquisitions, and sell-side M&A.Our focus is on ventures in the following areas:‰Û¢Technology-enabled B2B services such as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)‰Û¢Design and manufacture of advanced components and hardware (e.g., instruments, semiconductors, sensors, MEMS, materials science products, diagnostics, optics, medical devices, power systems).The firm was founded in 2007 and is led by Eric Sigler, a former strategy consultant, venture capitalist, and corporate development executive who has led dozens of transactions totaling over $200M during his 20 year career in Silicon Valley.    Show Less

column6: RedRidge Finance Group was built to address the needs of a changing financial marketplace.Whether it's a middle market company looking to grow or restructure, or a client seeking straightforward, professional advice and diligence, our boutique approach allows us to provide the highest level of service and a range of offerings tailored to meet the needs of the companies, funds and banks we serve.RedRidge Finance Group was created to address the needs of small- to mid-size businesses at the inflection point of growth or restructuring, and for investors who manage and purchase assets. We commit to providing the highest level of client service and fiscal responsibility and provide a range of services tailored to the current market conditions and changing customer needs, including:Direct InvestmentDue Diligence ServicesDebt AdvisoryRedRidge's team of experienced professionals understands both a borrower's and lender's point of view. We know that execution by your financial partner matters, and having real time feedback and response is key to completion of any transaction. Whether it's a privately held manufacturer or a purchaser of assets, a $5.0 million refinance or $500 million placement, RedRidge supplies the critical information and analysis to execute the transaction quickly and at maximum value.Transactions come and go but relationships last, and in RedRidge you will find a lasting partner to help you build your clients' business for years to come. If you have a finance or diligence-related need, please call us and allow us to be a partner in your growth.    Show Less

column6: Founded in 1991, Newport Partners is a middle-market focused private equity and merchant banking firm. We provide capital, credit, leadership, and advisory services in industry-agnostic management buyouts, sponsored business acquisitions, M&A transactions, and we also finance and fund ongoing business operations, growth initiatives, re-caps, dividend events, debt re-fi's, exits, and special projects. We seek to fund and finance projects from $500,000 to $50,000,000. We often syndicate our projects with another lender and/or private equity firm, allowing Newport Partners to offer extremely favorable price and terms on conventional projects, or be the go-to source on difficult projects.    Show Less

column6: Blue Ocean Engineered Capital helps small businesses reach the middle market by achieving $5M in EBITDA in a system which deploys financial capital simultaneously with human capital to increase the speed and probability of success.We provide access to our Brain Bankå© of former CEOs, entrepreneurs, and corporate executives to advise, along with $2M - $7M in co-invested funds, to implement a profitably successful fast growth strategy through to a Monetization Event/Exit, in a system known as Engineered Capitalå©.The five phase system focuses first on using its electronic technologies to speed time to Financial Sponsorship ‰ÛÒ ideally in 6 weeks. Then over a fast track 36-60 month time period with the help of the Brain Bank, a company will grow and Fortunize itself. In the last phase, a company monetizes the growth through a partial or full sale or public offering.    Show Less

column6: Commenda Capital is a financial advisory firm and a merchant bank that assists established management teams with the tools, contacts, business strategies critical to growing their business. We also provide the capital necessary to exercise those strategies.Our approach to funding enables companies that need cash, but have exhausted traditional lending sources, to pull liquidity - vital to operations - out of their tangible assets. We can do this because we know your industry, we recognize the value of your assets and we know how to help your company grow rapidly to achieve a clearly defined objective. We understand how to mitigate our investment risks so that we can provide the growth strategies, contacts, and capital that you need to grow your business at a time when your full attention to operations (not raising capital) is critical.    Show Less

column6: We provide the means to enhance the value of small and medium-sized enterprises that have a proven successful business model.  We do that by providing advice and arranging financing. We recognize that small and medium-sized businesses are often at a disadvantage in securing credit or investment financing.  To that end, a group of experienced business executives came together to form Ash Creek Capital Advisors LLC.  Successful ourselves, we want to use our skills to help others succeed while benefiting everyone involved. Ash Creek is an unusual merchant bank.  Not only do we secure financing but we also employ our principals‰Ûª strategic, management and financial expertise and experience. That adds significant value and helps maximize the return on invested capital for each individual transaction. Ash Creek offers large investors the opportunity to participate in individual transactions for small and medium-sized businesses.  This is an often-overlooked investment category that can offer diversification and incremental returns. We focus on transactions that create significant upside potential, where our participation can add value, and that are designed to be a ‰ÛÏwin-win‰Ûù for all the parties involved. We become actively involved with only a small percentage of the businesses that seek our consulting and financing services.  We target opportunities that, with our advice and counsel, can optimally benefit from various financing sources.    Show Less

column6: Middlemarch Partners is a merchant banking firm focused on providing the strategic capital raising solutions and acquisition advisory services of an investment bank with the direct co-investment capital of a private equity investor.Middlemarch focuses on high-growth financial services, financial services-enabling technologies, and business services companies; sectors where its Principals have deep domain expertise as bankers, investors, and operators.  The firm is active across financial services with a particular focus in specialty finance, transaction processing, electronic capital markets, analytics/risk management, and technologies that enable financial services products.The firm advises and invests across the spectrum of mid-stage venture, growth capital, and growth buyouts transactions. Middlemarch has deep relationships with leading institutional, strategic, and high net worth investors and is able to craft the appropriate investor set for specific transactions. Middlemarch focuses on Financial Services and Business Services, where our Principals have spent their entire careers as investment bankers, investors, and operators. The firm concentrates on technology-enabled financial and business services companies that exploit disruptive technologies, transform the economics of their industry, and can successfully navigate the changing landscape of the Financial Services market.The firm believes the unique characteristics of the Financial Services sector require deep expertise to exploit growth opportunities and to minimize exposure to risk. Key issues include:Evolving regulatory environmentMarket dislocations and cyclicalityTechnology and product innovationAlternative service delivery and globalizationUnique capital structure needsOur banking, lending, and investing experience allows us to serve a broad range of financial services companies, including those that require unique balance sheet requirements.We think like sponsors, act like principals, and advise for the long term.    Show Less

column6: Principal Transactions Group (‰ÛÏPTG‰Ûù) is the principal investing arm of Macquarie Capital. With flexible investment criteria, PTG is able to deliver unique, tailored capital solutions for our clients, working in partnership with the other service offerings of Macquarie Capital and the broader Macquarie Group. PTG deploys the Macquarie Capital balance sheet into investment opportunities alongside of and in support of our clients. PTG aims to build long-term relationships with clients (corporates, financial sponsors and entrepreneurs) by using our balance sheet to facilitate capital solutions to support growth initiatives, acquisitions, refinancing or other strategic goals. With flexibility around investment size, hold period and capital structure, PTG can develop a financing solution that fits the situation facing our clients. As an investor, PTG is: ‰Û¢ Able to make investments of differing sizes, from small positions to substantial commitments required to facilitate large strategic and financial sponsor transactions ‰Û¢ Flexible with respect to the expected investment hold period, with investment horizons ranging from short-term bridges to longer-term holds ‰Û¢ Capable of investing in any part of the capital structure, from senior secured debt to common stock ‰Û¢ A long-term partner that can provide significant global resources and specialist expertise to help create value PTG has a strong, proven track record of providing specialized capital solutions to suit the unique needs of our clients. Since 2011, PTG has invested over $1.0bn of capital in 27 deals in the US.    Show Less

column6: Trivergance is an entrepreneurial-driven private equity and merchant banking firm led by a team of successful entrepreneurs and investors with a tremendous track record of creating significant value. Our fundamental strategy is to creatively apply our unique assets of extensive operating skills, access to capital, extensive network of resources and relentless pursuit of excellence to super-charge businesses we start, build or buy. Our Operating Team has raised less than $15 million of equity into its various start-ups and companies over the past 20 years, and has converted that capital in exit values in excess of $425 million. Our Investing Team has deployed more than $5 billion in capital with exceptional returns. By combining these skills and resources, we have refined a model of ‰ÛÏengaged and active investor‰Ûù, where we can help drive significant, tangible value for those companies in which we invest. Trivergance expertise lies in its ability to uniquely bring three forces of capital together: 1. Human Capital. 2. Intellectual Capital. 3. Financial Capital. In the Trivergance business model, we understand how to best leverage these forms of capital individually or in combination to "Infuse" a transaction, a business, or a start-up. When Trivergance becomes involved with a transaction or a company, we apply a very powerful, strategic approach to providing or facilitating all the required forms of Capital. This is capital.infused - our powerful platform for value creation and enhancement.    Show Less

column6: MacroTrend Venture Partners (‰ÛÏMVP‰Ûù), was founded in 2008 as a strategic executive consulting firm and soon grew into an international merchant banking and strategic consulting firm to capitalize on opportunities resulting from severe constraints in domestic capital markets. Growing organically and through strategic joint venture acquisitions of performing assets, MVP is positioned as a true private global investment and development firm with over 150 years of combined experience among its executive team in the private and public capital markets. As an Ultra Private provider of strategic financial services and structured principal investments, the firm has extensive relationships with trusted providers of finance and banking products, including conventional debt offerings, structured debt offerings, project funding, and trade finance. In addition to providing equity and debt capital solutions to project developers, the firm invests in the development of advanced alternative & disruptive technologies and Infrastructure in urban commercial and residential communities worldwide; deploying capital for attractive acquisition targets and or special turnaround situations. MVP is an ultra-private, confidential, strategic finance operation in the business of international finance for qualified members of its private alliances, and via its proprietary resources as the strategic arm for a global finance syndicate.    Show Less
