column6: Spouting Rock Capital Advisors, LLC ("SRCA") is a Merchant Bank that provides investment banking, private equity and corporate advisory to emerging growth and lower middle market enterprises. SRCA is a registered broker-dealer (member FINRA/SIPC) licensed for private placements and M&A in 24 states.SRCA focuses on indentifying companies that can take advantage of secular shifts occurring within a particular industry or market. This predominantly includes companies in the technology, communications, consumer goods, financial services, and infrastructure sectors, though we opportunistically engage companies outside of these core focus areas. The common underlying theme in all of our client engagements is SELECTIVITY. SRCA performs rigorous due diligence on prospective clients prior to accepting any engagement. As former entrepreneurs, company executives, corporate strategists and venture capitalists, our team of investment bankers is highly capable at identifying companies with strong management teams, sound execution strategies and sustainable competitive advantages.Investment BankingSRCA's investment banking services are segmented between Private Capital Markets and Mergers & Acquisitions. We serve our clients by accessing our vast network of individual, financial and strategic investors and/or buyers and acting as intermediaries between our clients and prospective investors and/or buyers. We advise clients as to the most appropriate structure, terms, and valuation. SRCA's expertise enables us to reach a broader audience, develop competitive situations, and negotiate more favorable transaction terms for our clients. Specific investment banking services include:Private Capital Markets Early-stage & growth equityConvertible bridge notesAcquisition CapitalFounder share salesMezzanine debtRecapitalizationsMergers & AcquisitionsSell-side acquisitionsBolt-on & roll-up acquisitionsSpinouts / Carveouts"Dual track" processesIn capital raising engagements, SRCA specializes in transactions ranging from $5-$20 million. In M&A engagements, SRCA focuses on lower middle-market companies ($15-$100 million in enterprise value) that are overlooked by most financial institutions. By focusing on these under-served market segments, the SRCA team is able to identify and unlock value within companies that are well-positioned to capitalize on explosive growth opportunities.    Show Less

column6: Victory Partners is unique, unlike any other financial advisory and private equity firm serving the middle market you will find.åÊ If you walk our halls, you will not find anyone who talks with a locked jaw or wears an ascot.åÊ None of us were sitting on the fortunes of our forefathers when we set out to build a world class firm.åÊ We have earned our reputation the old fashioned way, through hard work, perseverance, and truly understanding the tenets of entrepreneurialism. Everything we have built over the last 10 years has been around celebrating the entrepreneur.åÊ Our great economy garnered its roots from those entrepreneurs who dared to dream, those whose faces have been mired with blood and sweat, not fearing the arena in which they were engaged.åÊ This country was built on the backs of great thinking and equally daring entrepreneurs and it is those entrepreneurs who will keep this nation great.  We plan to be there in the arena, side by side with them.Royal Ascot Partners, LLC is the private equity affiliate of Victory Partners and invests alongside family-offices it has deep relationships with, making both controlling and minority investments in operating companies in many different industries.  Royal Ascot‰Ûªs model is to partner with an existing management team in conjunction with its own operating partners, identify a target company, and acquire a stake in the company and grow it organically first, then look to make bolt-on acquisitions over-time.  Royal Ascot seeks to invest for the long-term, so immediate exit opportunities are never included in our investment thesis.  The firm‰Ûªs principals believe that if you take care of your house, the right exit will present itself.  We do not over-lever companies and focus on fundamentals that make companies successful.  We are highly active investors and work alongside management to effect the greatest impact to enterprise value.  Investments have been made in Consumer Brands, Specialty Retail, Alternative Energy, Entertainment, Financial Services, Defense, and Technology.Why Invest with Victory Partners / Royal Ascot?The team at Victory Partners has several notable distinct competitive advantages to offer the entrepreneur, during a succession plan, or transition period for their most prized financial asset, their company.  The firm believes its team is unique in understanding the desires and needs from both a financial and legacy standpoint of a business owner.  Victory Partners is one of the few firms that offer a team made up of all entrepreneurs, has in-house Operating Partners, and possesses the investment flexibility and transaction experience from both the perspective of a purchaser, as well as a seller of businesses.  Victory Partners, comprised strictly of entrepreneurs, celebrates the entrepreneurial spirit that made this country great.  Possessing the DNA of the entrepreneurial mindset, together with deep transaction experience and professional knowledge and discipline makes the firm uniquely positions to assist companies in all stages of their growth and maturation.    Show Less

column6: We can help you find the resources you need to make your enterprise grow, or allow you to take advantage of short-lived windows of tactical opportunity ‰ÛÒ and can often make the difference between success and heading back to the drawing board. But the defining assets we bring to the table are experience and strategic thinking: the experience of having advised on numerous transactions for emerging-growth companies. And the strategic depth to help you take a clear look at the right direction for your organization at the right time ‰ÛÒ whether that means simple or complex financings, restructuring or turnaround plans, mergers and acquisitions, finding senior management or board members who can make your plans succeed, or forming strategic alliances domestically or abroad. Advice is easy to come by. But bankable advice demands an understanding of the issues that affect your business; the ability to prepare in-depth analysis quickly; the creativity to come up with multi-faceted solutions; and the organizational strength and industry contacts to execute and close. And that means Vested Capital Partners.    Show Less

column6: Colbeck invests proprietary balance sheet into private opportunities originated in-house. The firm has a core competency in secured strategic corporate loans. Colbeck believes that opportunities exist when the credit markets often overweight the significance of idiosyncratic risks and underweight the significance of common risks such as high leverage, low asset coverage, high beta to the economy, and poor structuring. By maintaining a broad investable universe and targeting undercapitalized niches of the markets, Colbeck aims to generate consistent current income and opportunities for upside returns via secured loan instruments. Further, the firm believes that embracing a partnership approach with entrepreneurs, management and equity sponsors regularly creates follow-on investment opportunities with excess-risk adjusted return potential.    Show Less

column6: Pinecrest Capital Partners is a premier Merchant Bank based in Dallas, TX. Pinecrest operates across a variety of industries and is an expert in managing transaction processes. Pinecrest works to position clients with the goal of maximizing transaction outcomes and recognizing the full value of their companies.The Pinecrest team is committed to serving the lower and middle market, with enterprise values typically ranging from $25 million to $500 million and enjoys the creativity, values and legacies often associated with companies operating within this space. Pinecrest partners with family/founder owned, closely held and sponsor-backed businesses, individually tailoring its investment banking services for each client and circumstance as it relates to mergers and acquisitions, private capital sourcing, strategic planning, project financing, and restructuring services.In addition to investment banking advisory, Pinecrest also makes both control and non-control investments in select companies (sub $25 million in enterprise value) with strong business models, experienced management teams and unique value propositions. Beyond capital, Pinecrest brings a high level of financial expertise and operating strategy to the companies it partners with, making Pinecrest a true value-added investor. Since August 2014, Pinecrest has successfully closed over $175 million in transactions.    Show Less

column6: Moorgate Capital Partners is a boutique merchant bank founded in 2010 by a group of veteran bankers dedicated to spending more time with clients on their critical M&A and corporate finance situations and opportunities. Moorgate has two complimentary lines of business; Corporate Advisory (Moorgate Securities) and Merchant Banking (Moorgate Private Capital). Merchant Banking: Moorgate Private Capital is focused on investing in companies that range in size from $20 to $100 million in the media, technology, and communications sector. We work with CEOs and management teams to identify opportunities as both an advisor and partner in addition to sourcing capital, including investment from Moorgate Private Capital.Corporate Advisory: Moorgate Securities advises companies on mergers and acquisitions and capital solutions across the media, technology, and communications landscape in the U.S. Focusing on companies that are primarily up to $2 billion of enterprise value, we are deeply committed to the long term success of our clients and aim to deliver independent, thoughtful, and comprehensive solutions as a trusted advisor to management teams and boards of directors.     Show Less

column6: Founded in 1931, Loeb Partners Corporation ("LPC") is one of the last privately held independent investment banking enterprises on Wall Street. Loeb's businesses are composed of investment banking services including M&A, restructuring and capital markets; private equity investments; and alternative asset management under Loeb King Capital Management. We establish long-term relationships with our clients by providing independent, tailored advice to achieve unique solutions. As a private independent investment banking enterprise, we are not constrained by near-term goals and have the freedom to invest alongside our clients, at times providing necessary growth capital.    Show Less

column6: New City Capital‰Ûªs advisory services supplement our client‰Ûªs general management needs. We focus on companies that often lack the full c-suite of skills, allowing us to come alongside for specific projects needed to catapult a company to the next level. NCC Advisory provides management consulting services that focus on core responsibilities:Financial Reporting & AssuranceFinancial Policy & Capital StructureNew Market Entry Analysis & Business PlanningStrategy & CompetitionManagement Roles & CompensationNCC Advisory believes that similar, fundamental issues confront all enterprises, regardless of industry, position, or location. This rule applies to private companies, non-profit organizations, and governments alike. Our resumÌ© of work includes companies in the retail, manufacturing, financial, food and beverage, energy, and apparel industries. NCC Advisory has also played an active role with non-profit entities.    Show Less

column6: OVERVIEWCity Capital is a boutique investment and merchant banking firm that consists of a small team of high-integrity and deeply experienced banking, business and investment professionals. We are built to engage in a customized manner and, where appropriate, bring with us thoughtful, long-term focused investment capital.CITY CAPITAL ADVISROS  -   Investment BankWe advise private and publicly held middle market companies and their owners on sell-side and buy-side mergers and acquisitions; capital raises for growth, acquisitions and ownership transitions; and financial restructurings. We pride ourselves on our consistent record of achieving superior results for our clients throughout North America. Each Managing Director of City Capital Advisors has more than 20 years of transaction experience. Collectively, we have completed more than 500 transactions totaling more than $60 billion in value. We advise private and publicly held middle market companies, typically valued between $50 million & $500 million. City Capital is a registered FINRA broker-dealer and SIPC member firm.Website: city-cap.comCITY CAPITAL VENTURES  -   Principal InvestingWe are the principal investing team of City Capital. We invest in small companies with big potential at moments when capital, know how and people can unlock great results. We typically look for businesses with under $100 million in revenues and are industry agnostic.Website: citycapitalventures.com    Show Less

column6: Grosvenor Square Advisors ("GSA") is a merchant bank focused on serving clients located in North America, Asia, the Middle East, Africa and Europe. We provide debt capital raising, asset sale advisory, and certain restructuring services to a select group of companies, private equity firms, lenders, family offices and federal and provincial government entities globally.   Our team of senior professionals and Advisory Board Members average over 20 years of experience with some of the world's leading investment banks, private equity firms, public and private asset management firms and a hedge fund with over $15 billion of assets under management.  Our Advisory Board Members also have extensive experience running companies in North America and Europe. Their experience can be leveraged to create significant value for our clients.  Our senior professionals are highly engaged in every transaction.       Show Less

column6: Catalus Capital is an investment fund that makes structured equity and debt investments backed by cash flow and/or hard assets. We invest $10m-$40m to support acquisitions, growth, recapitalizations, and special situations located in the US, Canada, the Caribbean, and Europe. We are industry agnostic and have flexibility in the types of structures and deals that we consider. For additional details please see the attached and www.cataluscapital.com.

column6: The Courtney Group, Incorporated is a private investment firm specializing in the  consumer, chemical, financial services, healthcare, distribution,  manufacturing, and technology sectors. We are different in that we are flexible about the size of investment we can make: from $1 million to $100 million in equity, and that we can own a business for 20 to 30 years. We seek control and non-control equity investments in businesses with pre-tax earnings of $2 million to $50 million. We have invested in 18 companies since 1999. We often acquire businesses from sellers seeking to retire or entrepreneurs seeking a partner to help them reach the next level of success. Our goal is to be your trusted partners. The Courtney Group team is comprised of partners and professionals with substantial operational experience. We are flexible how involved we are, and can provide a lot or a little support depending on a company's needs.  We seek to invest in businesses with attractive growth prospects and high quality management teams. Company executives often invest with us and participate in an option plan, giving them meaningful ownership in the businesses they manage. The Courtney Group has a strong record of helping its investments reach new levels of success with financings, strategic advice, a strong network of contacts, helping recruit top talent, M&A deal flow and opportunity creation.     Show Less

column6: Founded in 1993, Gemini Investors is a Massachusetts-based private equity firm that provides capital and strategic resources to lower middle market companies. Since its inception, we have invested approximately $600 million in more than 100 companies throughout the U.S., typically investing $3 ‰ÛÒ $8 million per transaction in either control or minority positions. Gemini offers a flexible investment approach. We provide a wide range of financing structures, which include subordinated debt with warrants, preferred stock, and common equity. We have extensive experience leading transactions, as well as co-investing with other private equity firms and independent sponsors. Currently investing Gemini Investors V, L.P., we seek established businesses and experienced management teams that have a solid operating history and significant growth potential. Target portfolio company has revenues of $5 to $50 million and EBITDA of at least $1 million. We have a diversified approach to investing, and a proven track record in consumer products and services, healthcare services, manufacturing, distribution, for-profit education, restaurants, waste and recycling, retail, hardware and software technologies, and business services. In 2009, the U.S. Small Business Administration selected Gemini from among 300 current Small Business Investment Companies (SBIC) funds as the inaugural winner of the SBIC of the Year Award. We received this honor during National Small Business Week in Washington, D.C. Over the last fourteen years, Gemini has built an experienced and cohesive team of investment professionals. The firm's five general partners have all worked together for more than a decade, and collectively bring 120+ years of experience in management, strategy consulting, investment banking, venture capital, and private equity.    Show Less

column6: Tyree & D'Angelo Partners ("TDP") is a private equity investment firm that focuses on control investment opportunities in the lower middle market (companies with $1-$5M of EBITDA). We seek out investments in which we can establish true collaborative partnerships with business owners and management teams that will lead to a substantial creation of value over a long-term investment horizon. TDP relies on an extensive team comprised of Investment Partners, Executive Partners, and Advisory Partners to make investments, and focuses on opportunities in which our team of professionals can add significant value on an ongoing basis. Our team brings a unique combination of investing and operational skills to our partnerships with lower middle market companies that we believe differentiates us from other investment firms. We have invested in and managed companies ranging from $10 million to $20 billion of annual revenues and collectively bring over 100 years of experience and insights that we utilize to help management teams grow their businesses. We believe strongly in maintaining highly aligned incentives with the business owners and management teams we partner with as well as our underlying limited partners. Our team represents the largest source of investment capital in the fund and we derive substantially all of our compensation through investment performance as opposed to management or other fees. Our team is comprised of the following Investment Partners: James L. Tyree Managing Partner jtyree@tdpfund.com James has over 30 years of experience as a global operating and investment executive. He previously led Abbott Laboratories' (NYSE: ABT) $20 billion global pharmaceutical division, $4 billion global nutritionals division, and $200 million venture investment division. In addition, James previously ran Abbott's global corporate development division with 60 direct report merger & acquisition professionals and led all transformative Abbott investments during his last 10 years with Abbott including the acquisitions of Knoll, Solvay, Kos, and Piramal. James held additional prior positions with Abbott, Sugen, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Pfizer. His current affiliations include Chicago Council on Global Affairs, Council of Advisors for the Booth School of Business, special advisor to the chancellor of UC Davis Sacramento, and Director of ChemoCentryx, SonarMed, and Genelux. James holds an MBA and undergraduate degree in psychology and forensic studies from Indiana University. Enzo A. D'Angelo Managing Partner edangelo@tdpfund.com Enzo brings over 15 years of leading private equity investment and corporate finance experience. He previously worked at Norwest Equity Partners which managed $5 billion of investment capital from Minnesota, Wind Point Partners which managed $2 billion of investment capital from Illinois and Michigan, and at American Securities which managed $2 billion of investment capital from New York. Prior to entering the private equity industry, Enzo focused on corporate finance merger & acquisition advisory and lending for private equity investments while at Credit Suisse investment banking in New York. Enzo holds an MBA with honors from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University, is a Chartered Financial Analyst, and received an undergraduate business degree with honors from the Richard Ivey School of Business at the University of Western Ontario. Michael J. Tyree Managing Partner mtyree@tdpfund.com Michael has over 10 years of leading private equity investment and corporate finance experience. He previously worked at Flexpoint Ford which managed $1 billion of investment capital from Illinois and New York and was one of the initial investment professionals hired. Michael also worked at Stark Investments in Wisconsin, at the time a $15 billion hedge fund investing in equity securities. Prior to entering private equity, Michael worked in corporate finance and merger & acquisition advisory for different sized healthcare companies while at Lazard investment banking in New York. Michael holds an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University and an undergraduate double major in economics and biological sciences with Phi Beta Kappa and Student Marshal distinction from the University of Chicago.    Show Less

column6: Oroco Capital is a private equity investment firm. Our strategy is to buy great businesses in our target industries and build value through both internal growth and acquisitions, resulting in excellent returns for our investors. The team at Oroco has completed over 50 deals totaling over $5.0B. We developed a unique capital structure and have capital commitments from family offices, wealthy individuals and small institutions. In addition, Oroco has formed a strategic alliance with a private investment firm that allows Oroco to partner on investments that vary in size and type. Our strategy is to buy great businesses in our target industries and build value through both internal growth and acquisitions, resulting in excellent returns for our investors. We differentiate ourselves from other private equity firms by our industry specialization, track record, operational investment focus, proprietary deal flow, repeat management teams and the experience of our General Partners. We use debt capital to enhance but not drive our investment returns. We are focused on long-term equity value creation through growth of cash flow instead of financial engineering. This approach ensures that our companies have ample financial and operating flexibility to pursue growth opportunities and, thereby, sustainable equity value creation. It means relentless attention to detail and execution against plan. We also believe in making sure that we and our portfolio company management teams keep sight of our long-term objectives and value creation strategies and objections. That means leadership, vision and never losing sight of "the main goal."    Show Less

column6: Investment Criteria and Target Industries Pillsman Partners focuses on industries where we have direct prior experience whether it be from operating companies where we have worked or industries in which we have either advised or invested. We also invest in adjacent industries that share common characteristics and dynamics, leveraging the breadth of our knowledge, experience and relationships. We target businesses generating $1-15 million in EBITDA. We have a vertical focus on Chemicals & Materials and Industrial & Commercial-related businesses and a horizontal focus on relatively defensive end markets where numerous opportunities exist for innovative growth companies. We invest where we have knowledge, while remaining flexible and opportunistic. Chemicals & Materials Specialty Chemicals Coatings and Finishing Products Performance Materials and Composites Industrial & Commercial Engineered Components Integrated Systems Aftermarket and Accessories We seek opportunities with the following business, industry, financial, and management characteristics: Business Stable customer relationships with recurring revenue Operates in niche markets and provides a clear customer value proposition Strong potential for organic growth and/or industry consolidation Industry Sizable and growing market Fragmented competitive dynamics High customer switching costs Financial Revenues between $5 and 50 million Operating profit (EBIT) margins over 5% Low to modest annual capital expenditures Management Experienced and stable middle-management team Bias towards growth CEO willing to support transition period to ensure success Transactions Owners seeking liquidity, net-worth diversification, and/or participation in future growth Management buyouts, recapitalizations, growth and acquisition financing No turnarounds, distress, real-estate, or retail    Show Less

column6: Hayford Cardinal Holdings Inc., is a Toronto based LBO firm (see www.hayfordcardinalholdings.com), and is actively seeking new business opportunities. Our mission is to acquire established businesses, build upon their good reputation, and increase revenues and profits through a structured growth plan, such as add-on acquisitions. We are a private equity boutique buyout firm and have available with our equity partners and investment fund financial backers $1-$10 million in equity for each acquisition, however we prefer a strong LBO financing candidate, rather than considering strictly a multiple of earnings....we consider the assets we are acquiring, the history of the company and its ability to support the buyout price with debt service, while providing an adequate return on investment. We are interested in making the acquisition be a nucleus for add-on acquisitions. Business transactions today require the ability to structure all elements with speed and precision and we are very competent in these areas. Decisions are made quickly by our acquisition committee and replies are immediate from a financial standpoint....due diligence is quick and transparent. Nobody knows about any potential sale. Our principals and advisers are experienced in acquisitions and business development, and have been personally involved in direct operations of various types of businesses and have financial restructuring, balance sheet enhancement, merger evaluation, fairness, and strong corporate management expertise. Our Principals and advisers are interested in acquiring companies within the following businesses: Manufacturing, Trucking, Retail, Mechanical Contracting, Commercial Printing, Wholesale Distribution, wholesale distribution to C-stores of cigarettes, sundries and food products and Lumber and Building Materials yards/stores for both pro-builders and retail customers. We are investors, and want management to remain, other than the seller/s who may retain a small ongoing equity interest.. Our ideal company for acquisition has $15-$100 million in revenues. We are also interested in CANADIAN deals with revenues of $15-$75 million, since we are headquartered in Toronto. Please consider our firm for a quick reply, but please, profitable companies only at this time.    Show Less

column6: Boathouse Capital is a $225mm mezzanine debt and equity firm based in the suburbs of Philadelphia. We invest $5mm to $30mm of debt and/or equity in entrepreneur-owned companies in all industries across the U.S. Given the flexibility of our capital, we can consider a wide variety of transactions: Growth capital Management buyouts Strategic acquisitions Refinancings Dividend payments Control buyouts We tend to invest in companies that meet the following characteristics: Financial Parameters -Revenue of at least $10 million (unless a software or RMR business) -EBITDA of $1.5 million or greater (unless a software or RMR business) -Stable historical performance -Modest capital expenditure requirements Strategic Parameters -Exceptional management team -Healthy, growing end markets -Repeatable/"sticky" business model -Sustainable competitive advantages -Diversified customer base and longstanding relationships with customers -Manageable offshore competition -Ability to withstand business cycles    Show Less

column6: Wakabayashi Fund LLC is a private equity fund with offices in Tokyo, Japan and New York that provides corporate capitalization and institutional investor relations consulting services. Wakabayashi Fund may invest on a principal basis and acts in an agency capacity to procure capital for both profitable and emerging small-cap companies, identifying institutional funding sources for its clients and further develops the investor relations activities.Wakabayashi Fund is committed to providing our clients with an uncompromising level of service to assist them in realizing both their immediate and long-term objectives. We believe the success of any organization lies in the ability to effectively execute the business plan at each stage of development, and our role is to assist in completing the business plan goals.Corporate development, corporate governance, short term and long term financing, institutionally driven sponsorship, business development and management consulting services are our areas of expertise.    Show Less

column6: Columbia Pacific Advisors, LLC is an alternative investment firm managing investments across a range of real estate, opportunistic, direct lending and hedged strategies. Our principals and professionals are personally invested alongside our limited partners, and we strive to generate compelling risk-adjusted returns on a consistent basis for our investors. Our History Columbia Pacific Management was founded over twenty-five years ago by Daniel R. Baty and throughout its existence has delivered exceptional investment results by investing in the private market. In 2006, the Baty Family joined with Alex Washburn to launch Columbia Pacific Advisors ("CPA"), an alternative investment platform, to manage the alternative investments of the Baty family, Mr. Washburn and a limited number of outside investors. Today, CPA manages investments across multiple strategies including real estate equity and lending, growth capital, hedged, and opportunistic investing. Our Firm Columbia Pacific Advisors provides advisory services primarily to pooled investment vehicles whose limited partners may include family offices, institutions, and high net worth individuals. Our talented, experienced investment professionals are supported by a robust operational infrastructure carefully structured for our strategies. Our Approach We are highly opportunistic in our approach and embrace the entrepreneurial spirit of our founders. We generate and actively seek unique and compelling investment ideas, perform deep fundamental research, and creatively structure transactions and portfolios to balance risk and return.    Show Less

column6: Woodlawn Partners is a Chicago-based private equity firm that is focused on people, not transactions. Our primary responsibility is to provide stability for employees and customers. Rather than simply replacing a business owner with a new manager, we first become directly involved with a business to educate ourselves and to earn the trust of its people. We then work collaboratively to build a team that can drive self-sustaining growth. We help a business owner to tailor a succession strategy around their personal and financial needs. We take a hands-on approach to shepherding a business through the transition and beyond. We bring the financial and managerial resources to help a business reach its full potential. UPDATE 1/26/2014 Woodlawn Partners recently launched its freshly designed website, which outlines in detail our collaborative approach to acquiring businesses in the lower middle market.    Show Less

column6: Andlinger & Company, Inc. was established in 1976 and has completed approximately 150 transactions. There are three things that distinguish the Company from other private equity firms: Many of the partners are former operating managers and executives. We view opportunities as operators do, not as financial engineers We have offices in both the U.S. and Europe and conduct business in the English, German, and French-speaking countries on either side of the Atlantic. We are self-funded. We have never needed to use outside sources of equity capital. The A&Co. partners fund the equity portion of our transactions. This gives us great flexibility in our investment style. We look for opportunities to provide equity growth capital or to acquire independent or family-owned companies and corporate divisions or subsidiaries. We will consider unusual situations as well as strong-performing companies. We have the resources to initiate, close, and integrate acquisitions, and we have experience with both private and public financings. We operate quickly and discreetly. Geographic Area U.S. and Eastern Canada, Europe Target Enterprise Value Up to $40 million, or larger under special circumstances Target Equity Investment Size Up to $15 million, or larger under special circumstances Investment Position Usually take actual or effective control positions, but will consider minority positions for compelling opportunities. Strategic Fits with Our Portfolio Industrial manufacturing, engineered plastics, medical devices, value-added distribution and logistics, manufacturers serving the mobile communications area, manufacturers of goods sold for 3D printing, engineering services, cleantech, renewable energy and energy conserving products, pharmaceutical packaging and manufacturing or other industries suitable as new platforms Industries of Low Interest Retail, real estate, natural resources and commodities Transaction Types Growth capital Management buyouts Recapitalizations (public and private) Leveraged buyouts    Show Less

column6: High Road Capital Partners is a private equity firm focused on buying and building leading companies at the smaller end of the middle market. High Road seeks to acquire, in partnership with management, companies with revenues of $10 to $100 million and EBITDA of $3 to $10 million. The companies we seek possess attractive growth prospects and are well positioned within their respective market niches. Our mission is to work together with management to develop and implement strategies that will build value and take companies to the next level.High Road's investment professionals have completed transactions with an aggregate value of approximately $2 billion, and have over 70 years of combined experience. High Road has the skill, experience and judgment needed to build companies into market leaders and to create substantial value for our investors and management team partners. High Road is backed by large, blue chip financial investors and has over $150 million of committed capital under management.Our approach to business is to take the high road in all that we do, hence the name High Road Capital Partners. That means cutting a fair deal and sticking to it, and not using due diligence as a tool to renegotiate price. It means treating our management teams as partners and actively supporting them in their efforts to grow their companies. It means working hard to protect our investors and lenders, putting their interests ahead of ours, and being proactive if a company hits a bump in the road. It means making sure that our portfolio companies' employees are treated fairly and that our companies maintain the highest ethical standards. And it means worrying about the business fundamentals first, and trusting that if we consistently work hard and do the right thing, we will ultimately succeed.INVESTMENT PARAMETERSInvestment Type, Size, and StructureBuyouts and recapitalizationsRevenues of at least $10 million, EBITDA of at least $3 million for platform investmentsControl investmentsCapital base is structured to best fit the needs of each individual investmentInvestment PhilosophyPartner with managementDevelop and execute growth plan to take company to the next level; exploit both internal, organic growth opportunities and add-on acquisitions to enhance market position and scale earningsBuild company infrastructure and utilize outside resources as necessary to fundamentally improve companyMaintain investment discipline for acquisition and sale decisionsInvestment CriteriaMarket leadership (#1, 2 or 3) position, orPotential to build a market leader, orExceptional growth potential, with sustainable cash flows and defensible competitive advantageManufacturing, service, or value-added distribution businesses with EBITDA margins of at least 10%    Show Less

column6: Foundation Investment Partners is a private equity firm focused on acquiring niche manufacturers, high value added distributors, outsourced business service providers, and niche software developers. Our operating model focuses on partnering with the owners or operators of smaller businesses to provide the support, guidance and resources necessary to grow the business. Our Approach Smaller businesses face numerous challenges. Because of financial constraints, owners cannot always afford the luxury of having a specialist in every position. Each employee is asked to wear multiple hats and are often stretched thin juggling multiple responsibilities. It is not always possible to focus on where the business will be in five years because there are customer requests that must be completed today. Growth might be limited by a lack of capital or concern about taking on debt. Foundation brings the resources necessary to overcome these obstacles. We work with business owners to understand both their business and personal needs. Once we understand these needs, we build a conservative capital structure that provides owners with the cash that they desire while providing adequate capital to support management's growth objectives.    Show Less

column6: Crescendo Capital Partners is a private equity firm based in Los Angeles. Crescendo is primarily focused on middle-market change-of-control transactions, typically with enterprise values from $10 million to $100 million.While industry generalists, we have specific operating resources in the following fields, which help source, vet, manage and/or oversee portfolio companies:åÊ* healthcare * food/beverage/nutra * outsourcing/staffing (10-pro team) * tech/telecom * retail/distribution (25-pro team) * packaging/consumer products Crescendo provides more than just investment capital to US-based lower middle market companies. We are a very actively engaged private equity partner across strategy, operations and finance. Crescendo provides an exceptional level of support for our portfolio companies, particularly through the efforts of seasoned operating partners.    Show Less

column6: Bridge Investments is a Chicago based private equity and venture capital firm focused on the lower middle market. We have a 15-year track record of success in a wide array of businesses, including business and tech-enabled services, digital marketing and media, logistics security services, consumer, data center services and real estate, among others. In addition, we contribute our own capital to each investment, directly aligning our interests with the company and differentiating ourselves from other private equity firms. We seek out established companies with clear potential. We apply a disciplined approach to the transaction process and to our portfolio management and have deep experience and proven success in actively assisting small but established companies grow and evolve into mature, mid-sized businesses. We support and add value to our portfolio companies through our knowledge and experience, capital resources and business relationships forged over many years. Our flexibility allows us to exit at the ideal time, maximizing value for all involved. Criteria Size: ideal investment range is $1 million to $10 million, allowing for total transaction values of up to $35 million EBITDA: $0 to $5 million with a clear path to near-term, sustained profitability for growth equity candidates that are breakeven; we do not generally invest in start-ups Industries: business services, software as a service (SAAS), consumer, niche manufacturing, healthcare services, commercial real estate and hotels Types of Investments/Use of Proceeds: buyouts/acquisitions, family business transitions, growth equity, recapitalizations, shareholder liquidity, capital expenditures Structure: equity, preferred equity, convertible debt, subordinated debt, or other quasi-equity securities; we consider control or minority positions Horizon: 3 ‰ÛÒ 7 years but willingness to hold for a longer period if generating solid cash returns and/or a clear and more opportunistic exit point is in the future    Show Less

column6: Black Lake Capital is a Colorado-based private equity firm focusing on lower-middle opportunities in value-added industrials and business services. We target investments in change of control buyouts of cash-flow positive businesses. Black Lake Capital partners with successful management teams to accelerate growth and boost profitability by applying our strategic insight, resource network, and experience. Examples of value created by our collaboration with management include enhancing business development to pinpoint new prospects, implementing systems to measure against specific strategic goals, deploying targeted capital in high-return projects, and completing add-on acquisitions. Our broad investing experience in both private and public companies, across a number of industries and geographies, provides us flexibility in creating the best solutions for business owners and management teams.    Show Less

column6: Evolution Capital Partners is a small business private equity fund investing growth equity nationwide in Second Stage Companies generating annual free cash flow of at least $500,000. Evolution specializes in helping entrepreneurial businesses transform their organizations by providing a foundation for growth through its process, The Five Pillars of Business Freedom (SM). Investment Criteria - Company Size: $500,000 - $2,000,000 in EBITDA;  - Minimum of 10% cash flow margins (EBITDA less regular cap ex);  - Investment Size: $3,000,000 - $10,000,000;  - Growth Expectations: $5,000,000 + in EBITDA in 3-7 years;  - Geography: United States & Canada;  - Targeted Industries: Business Services, DIstribution, Financial Services, Healthcare Services, Information Services, Niche Manufacturing, Technology-enabled, scalable businesses    Show Less

column6: Prospect Capital Corporation is a mezzanine debt and private equity firm that manages a publicly-traded, closed-end, dividend-focused investment company (NasdaqNM: PSEC), which completed its initial public offering in 2004. Prospect primarily provides non-control debt financing to management teams or financial sponsors as well as selectively making control acquisitions by providing multiple levels of the capital structure. Using both partnership and publicly traded closed-end structures, Prospect has invested more than $2.5 billion since its inception in 1988 in multiple asset classes, including: ‰Û¢Mezzanine Debt ‰Û¢Acquisitions ‰Û¢Growth ‰Û¢Development ‰Û¢Financings ‰Û¢Recapitalizations As a yield-oriented company, Prospect seeks investments with historical cash flows, asset collateral, or contracted pro forma cash flows. Prospect's mutual fund has paid a continuous, regular dividend since inception. Holdings are diversified and include, for example, midstream processor Gas Solutions, construction firm Unitek, potato chip maker Shearer's, and more than 60 other companies spanning the range of American and Canadian industry. While the company's past expertise has been in the energy and industrial sectors, Prospect Capital has broadened its scope to include healthcare, manufacturing, and specialty minerals among others.    Show Less

column6: Third Century Investment Associates, LP ("TCIA") manages private equity capital for significant investments in small businesses. We are a disciplined, process-driven partnership, focused on long-term fundamentals. Our mission is to build sustainable business value, earn a superior return and develop a best-in-class reputation within the markets we serve.    Show Less

column6: Jesse F. Sammis IV is currently the President and CEO of Third Branch Capital, which he formed in the spring of 2006. Third Branch Capital assists companies by bridging funding gaps between traditional financing methods and equity infusion. Third Branch has extensive experience helping companies place new management and board members. Third Branch Capital has raised over $50 million in equity for companies in various industries including real estate, infrastructure, finance, technology, biotechnology, healthcare and consumer goods. Mr. Sammis has been a silent partner at New England Land Company a commercial real estate development and investment firm since 2003. Prior to starting Third Branch Capital Mr. Sammis worked in the financial services industry for Colburn International from 1993 to 2000 and Lenox Advisors from 2000 to 2003. Mr. Sammis currently resides in Hailey, Idaho with his wife and four daughters.    Show Less

column6: Focus Acquisition Partners is a private equity sponsor supported by a network of U.S. based investors seeking acquisitions in the health care, business services, manufacturing and distribution sectors. Working with private equity groups and family offices, Focus originates and structures transactions with the owners of mid-sized companies for buyout, recapitalization and growth capital investments. Our Value Proposition Focus provides business owners with discrete access to qualified financial partners, and provides those financial partners with proprietary access to fully screened deals. The Partner Network: The typical Focus investor is a private equity firm or family office with between $250 million and $1 billion in committed capital. Our deal portfolio includes majority recapitalizations, minority investments and growth capital transactions. We are actively seeking both platforms and add-ons. Our Team: Each of our partners is a senior level professional with significant deal and transaction experience. Our partners are all former business owners with experience founding and operating companies in manufacturing, distribution, business services, banking and marketing.    Show Less

column6: OUR MISSION Wafra Partners exists to create wealth for its business partners and investors. Specifically, Wafra Partners fulfills its purpose by actively seeking, evaluating, and executing equity investments in growing, profitable, middle-market companies. In striving to achieve its mission, Wafra Partners attempts to drive value creation within the companies in which it invests - building better businesses and generating greater success and wealth. OUR FOCUS Wafra Partners' focus on the middle-market gives business owners and investors alike a proven, experienced partner who understands the specific needs, economics, and success factors associated with this growth-driven market segment. The professionals at Wafra Partners have extensive experience building businesses in the middle-market. This focus creates a bond between Wafra Partners and its business partners. PRINCIPLES Wafra Partners is guided by these business principles: Success demands operating with the highest level of integrity. Open communication and shared understanding are critical to effective partnerships. The ability to "get things done" is a required core competency. Wafra Partners wants to provide the financial springboard and strategic and analytical resources to help owners and managers meet their corporate and personal goals. CRITERIA Wafra Partners focuses on investing in traditional middle-market companies where we can work in partnership with management. We target industries where we have relevant experience and have a particular interest in specialty services, niche manufacturing and consumer-driven businesses. Our portfolio will confirm our affinity for consumer products and outsourced business services. Investment Amount: Up to $30 million of equity per transaction Transaction Size: Enterprise value between $20-$150 million Revenue: $20 million or more EBITDA: $3 million or more Transaction Type: Control Acquisitions & Recapitalizations Expansion Financing Industry Consolidations Corporate Divestitures Co-Investments (Majority & Minority Control) with Financial & Strategic Investors When considering a specific investment opportunity, we believe the most important criteria are: A strong and committed management team with significant ownership opportunities post closing A leadership position in technology, product line, cost position or distribution channel Growth opportunities: internal or by acquisition Diversification of products/services, customers, markets and suppliers INVESTMENT PHILOSOPHY Wafra Partners has developed an investment approach that provides the communication and flexibility required to address the varying needs of sellers and management partners in each transaction. This approach provides the following benefits to sellers and management. Timely Response Fair Valuation Appropriate Capital Structure Proven Closing Capabilities Management Equity Participation Strategic & Analytical Support Board Level Participation Long-Term Growth Orientation Additional Capital for Future Needs    Show Less

column6: Supporting growth. Building the business. Creating value. Tregaron Capital brings its unique experience base and focus to each investment and portfolio company. Our goal is simple: build value through building the business. To achieve this goal, we invest in a limited number of strong companies and partner with strong executives to build them. Our team is lead by experienced professionals with extensive experience in finance, M&A, strategy and operations. We make a small number of investments each year, enabling us to pay careful attention to each one. We make both mezzanine debt and equity investments in companies located in the western US with EBITDA from $1 to $5 million. We are currently investing out of Tregaron Opportunity Fund I, a $60 million fund that closed in 2010.    Show Less

We operate coast to coast, with our main offices strategically located in New York, New York and Santa Monica, California.

column6: Edgewater Funds is a premier private equity firm based in Chicago, Illinois. Through Edgewater Growth Capital Partners we provide capital and experience to profitable growth businesses run by outstanding management teams. Edgewater is distinguished by the depth of experience of our Partners who themselves have been successful CEOs and business leaders. We bring our portfolio companies active guidance to growth and high value exits, having personally been down the CEO's path many times before. With nearly $2 billion in capital under management, Edgewater has distinguished itself through successful partnerships with quality middle market companies. We believe that the best financial partner is a team of investors who have successfully built, run and sold companies themselves. Edgewater Growth Capital Partners invests in profitable growth companies which are led by outstanding management teams. Our focus is primarily on companies with revenues of $20 million to $500 million and which meet our profitability and growth requirements. Our approach is to partner with management teams to build value through their company's organic growth and often through acquisitions. We make both growth equity (minority) and buyout (majority) investments to accommodate the needs of each investment situation. Edgewater invests in industries where our Partners have personal experience and use our experience and network to help our portfolio companies build value. Industries where we most frequently invest include: business services, financial and government services, consumer products and services, health care services, IT services and software and basic industries. Edgewater's invests primarily in companies which meet the following criteria: EBITDA between $5 and $30 million Strong management team with whom we can partner Growth opportunity, either organic or through acquisitions Base of operations in North America Control or non-control transactions    Show Less

column6: G&H Ventures, LLC is an investment firm founded in 2010 by Danny Guttman and Thomas Hardy. Our principal focus is making direct private equity and mezzanine investments in financial services, healthcare products and services, and manufacturing companies.G&H is headquartered in Dallas, Texas, USA, with an additional base in New York, NY, USA. We differ from a typical private equity firm in that we invest our own capital alongside with managed capital for selected limited partners and co-investors. Our competitive advantages include our non-bureaucratic infrastructure, flexible decision making process, long-term investment horizon, ability to accommodate special needs of sellers and management teams, operational and transaction expertise, and opportunistic investment strategy.G&H typically invests in small to mid-size private companies with capable management teams, fundamentally strong operations and track records that need capital and strategic help to "get to the next level". Our typical equity investment size is between $2 and $10 million; however, we are able to underwrite larger transactions under the right circumstances. We also make targeted investments in a limited number of publicly traded companies.    Show Less

column6: Fore River Ventures ("FRV") was formed by Rob McMenimon and Trevor Childs for the sole purpose of acquiring, operating and growing small to mid-sized businesses. Approach Rob and Trevor understand the concerns of privately held and family-owned businesses because they've been there themselves. They will work closely with an owner to design a flexible acquisition structure that provides immediate liquidity, maintains the reputation of the enterprise and offers continuity for employees and customers. They bring the required combination of capital and managerial expertise to ensure the continued success of the company. FRV is particularly interested in acquiring a company from an owner considering retirement or reducing his/her involvement in day-to-day operations of the company. Investment Focus FRV seeks to acquire and actively manage a privately held company in New England that satisfies the following criteria Company History of positive, stable cash flows Sustainable competitive position Strong potential for growth organically and/or through acquisition Industry Industry agnostic, but prefer: Service Businesses Light Manufacturing Energy Financials Revenue between $1 to $20 million Adjusted EBITDA above $250k    Show Less

column6: CPS Management Partners was founded by a pair of entrepreneurs seeking to find, buy and run a single high-quality small or medium sized business. CPS Management Partners is seeking to work with owners looking to transition out or take a reduced role in the day-to-day operations. We bring significant managerial capability and capital to provide business owners with an attractive option compared to traditional financial or strategic buyers. CPS will take an active role in the acquired business and is focused on business continuity and long-term value creation. CPS's management team and investor base bring significant managerial experience across a variety of industries. We will work with business owners to ensure the right deal for both themselves as well as their employees and customers. CPS Management Partners provides business owners with a unique structure that is an attractive option compared to traditional financial or strategic buyers. CPS is looking only to acquire a single company and can therefore offer a customized solution to achieve the seller's objectives. Active and experienced management CPS's management team is committed to managing the business full-time post acquisition. Our team brings strong and diverse experience from a variety of industries and functions. In addition, CPS is backed by a team of advisors and investors with decades of international management experience. Flexibility for the business owner CPS can provide owners with significant flexibility based on the owners' objectives. From an operational perspective, CPS can allow owners the option to transition more quickly out of the business or to maintain an on-going role depending on preferences. From a financial perspective, CPS can be flexible with deal structure to meet unique tax or estate planning needs and/or allow for the owner to maintain equity in the business. Maintain and grow the business CPS is comprised of entrepreneurs looking to grow the business. Founders will have the opportunity to develop a personal relationship with the managers of CPS and to create a shared vision for the future of the company. Unlike strategic acquirers, we are not looking to fundamentally reshape the business or personnel. We are seeking to grow the business organically. Long-term investment horizon We are not looking to "flip" the business and are committed to managing and growing the business on a full-time basis for the long term. We value continuity, stable employee relations and strong community standing. We appreciate the existing workforce and believe that investing in long-term employee development is a key aspect of business growth. Please contact us to learn more about CPS Management Partners or to discuss a specific investment opportunity. We also work closely with intermediaries, and pay standard finder and referral fees.    Show Less

column6: Maximus Capital Partners was formed with the purpose to invest-in ‰ÛÏone‰Ûù small to medium sized company in the US ($5 to $50 million in Sales) and to help grow it through excellence in management and the support of world-class Board of Directors. Structured as a Search Fund (investment vehicle to acquire and operate firm), Maximus is funded by some of the most distinguished and successful investors globally in private equity and venture capital as well as proven entrepreneurs, with extensive experience in acquiring, managing, and growing businesses. While open to other industries, we prefer Services (business services and consumer services) Companies in the lower middle market segment in the United States. Particularly keen on Technology Enabled Business Services (TES), as well as Healthcare Services, Healthcare IT and Security Products and Services (e.g., access control, network video and analytics, systems integration, perimeter sensors) We are open to any location in the US - but have a preference for the South-East. Maximus Capital Partners will provide a favorable and attractive exit option for business owners looking to transition from day to day operations and can exercise tremendous flexibility in the investment structure. We have access to substantial capital resources to consummate a transaction in a timely manner. column6: Mont Vista Partners is a privately-held, entrepreneurial investment firm seeking to acquire and actively manage a small to medium-sized business. Based in Toronto, Mont Vista Partners will acquire a business anywhere in Canada or the U.S. and will assume the day-to-day operational responsibilities of the business. We make controlling investments in profitable companies with annual revenues of $5 to $30 million.Investment FocusMont Vista Partners is interested in acquiring a single, high-quality services-based company. We are long-term investors and plan to actively manage the acquired business for the long-term. This means that we will relocate to the location of the company. We love businesses that have a very loyal, sticky customer base, a clearly differentiated value proposition, and the ability to consistently grow year-over-year. Our investment criteria are as follows:Recurring revenueSecular growth (minimum: 8%/yr)High ROICOwner looking to retire or lessen role in businessControlling investments onlyWhat Makes Us Different?We will assume active, day-to-day management responsibility of the business we acquireWe will provide liquidity on fair and flexible terms that meet the individual needs of the business ownerWe want to preserve the positive relationships that owners have established with customers, employees, and the community while positioning the company for the next phase of growthWe are long-term investors and have no intention to "flip" or sell the business in the near or medium-termOur InvestorsMont Vista Partners is backed by a group of more than 20 investors comprised of professional institutional private equity, C-level executives, high net-worth individuals, and entrepreneurs. This group will serve as advisors and directors in any acquisition.For more information, please visit us at www.montvistapartners.com.    Show Less

column6: OverviewGolden Spike Capital (GSC) is a private investment firm that specializes in the acquisition and management of a private middle market business located in the United States. We focus on profitable businesses with growth potential, typically with revenues between $3 and $20 million.GSC is different than traditional strategic or private equity buyers. Golden Spike Capital takes an active role in the day-to-day operations of the acquired company. After an acquisition GSC's Managing Partner will relocate to the business and assume a full-time management position working with the current management team, allowing the owner to gain liquidity and transition from a daily operating role. We aim to partner with current management teams that have enthusiasm and determination to grow the business.MissionGolden Spike Capital's mission is to provide liquidity to owners, and capital for growth while ensuring continuity to customers and employees. We focus on long-term growth to create value for customers, employees, the community and shareholders.TeamAustin Peterson is the founder and Managing Partner of Golden Spike Capital. Austin earned an MBA and Bachelor of Business, both with Highest Honors from the University of Kansas and he holds a Law degree from The University of Chicago Law School. Prior to founding Golden Spike Capital, Austin spent time as a consultant and corporate attorney.Austin worked for the law firm Mayer Brown LLP in Chicago, focusing on private equity transactions. He has represented private equity firms and investment funds in connection with purchases and fund formation, with aggregate transaction values in excess of a billion dollars. He has also spent time as a consultant in varied engagements. Austin has experience managing and growing existing businesses, and has managed formation and fundraising for new ventures.Golden Spike Capital is backed by an active team of highly successful investors and entrepreneurs with significant experience building private companies.    Show Less

column6: Alaska Search Partners is a private equity Search Fund focused on finding, buying, and growing companies headquartered in Alaska.  The fund targets companies with consistent cash flow and upside market opportunity.  The firm prefers to invest in companies with revenues between $5 million and $40 million.The leaders of Alaska Search Partners have over 30 years of combined experience in starting services lines, growing companies as well as mergers and acquisitions.In the short term: The first search fund in Alaska is accepting a limited number of investors.  We are also looking for a few more search fund and acquisition investors (both individual and institutional) to participate in the equity and financing package.In the medium term: We are concurrently identifying criteria appropriate companies, performing due diligence, and making selections for acquisition.  We will lead the acquired company(s) to desired growth and IRR.  We expect to start the second search fund in early 2014.In the long term: We expect to create serial search funds, serial acquisitions, and serial successful growth companies.  We plan to create a network of investors (individual, institutional, and Alaska Native Corporation) committed to the search fund model as an investment alternative in Alaska.By design, target companies are stable, have consistent cash flow, and unmet market expansion opportunity.  This is the typical growth pattern and plateauing of small companies.  Placing  well-educated, high caliber, strongly motivated managers who have a leadership skill set for larger organizations into such an environment captures unmet opportunity.  The results are (a) an attractive risk-adjusted IRR, (b) development of a management infrastructure which creates a self-sustaining organization, and (c) Alaska will develop a stronger, more robust, medium sized business community capable of competing more effectively throughout Alaska, the lower 48, and internationally.    Show Less

column6: Valent Capital Partners is a private investment firm headquartered in Chicago, Illinois. Our mission is to actively manage and operate a growing business, supporting its growth and development, while creating exceptional value for business owners, customers, employees, and shareholders. Valent Capital Partners allows business owners to achieve peace of mind that the key stakeholders in their business will see a smooth transition, while they reap the benefits of liquidity. We are not a typical buyout fund. We are a team of experienced executives, operators, and investors who have decades of experience managing and growing companies. We are seeking to invest our collective resources and efforts into the acquisition and management of a single business.We are seeking a profitable B2B business with a recurring revenue element, sound fundamentals, and strong growth prospects.We have the ability to, and aim to flexibly structure an acquisition that meets the objectives and needs of the seller.     Show Less

column6: MAGNUM Capital Partners is a private investment firm based in Montreal, Canada headed by two dynamic entrepreneurs and backed with world-class operators and seasoned investors.We are a hands-on firm with a human approach whose purpose is to help small business owners in Canada without a succession plan to sell their business while ensuring the company they founded continues to grow and prosper for generations to come.We offer an attractive succession option and management transition solution that minimises disruptions to your daily operations and ensures that your legacy is preserved.    Show Less

column6: Our approach lies in the belief that every business is unique. Understanding your business and applying the right financing decisions is key to your success and ours. Our process is to first understand your strategic direction and organizational goals. We then quickly and efficiently conduct a comprehensive review of your opportunity and advise how we can help. The result: decisive actions combined with flexible, creative solutions that can respond to even the most complicated scenarios. Our clients represent all industries across the U.S. with many of them representing the manufacturing, distribution, technology, energy and healthcare industries with an emphasis on financing mission critical, revenue producing fixed assets. SIZE OF INVESTMENT: $2 to $20 Million COMPANY REVENUE SIZE: $10 Million and Larger ASSET TYPE: Most Revenue Producing Fixed Assets to All Company Assets, Situation Specific TERM: Up To 5 Years PRODUCTS: Leases, LoansCOMPANY STAGE: Late Stage Venture to Mature Cash Flowing Companies LOCATION: Continental United States - See more at: http://www.capxpartners.com/    Show Less

column6: White Oak's Direct Lending business originates and underwrites private debt financings to middle market companies supporting their near- to mid-term growth initiatives. We focus on opportunistic credit, special situations and emerging growth investing across a variety of sectors including industrials, energy, materials, healthcare, technology and consumer staples. Our product suite includes asset-based secured term loans, amortizing loans, unitranche loans, debtor-in-possession (DIP) financings, in- and out-of-court restructurings and acquisition and capital expenditure facilities. We work with our borrowers on creative and flexible financing structures with an expedited closing schedule.    Show Less

column6: Lighter Capital is an online revenue-based lender providing technology companies from $50k to $2 million in growth funding. We use our proprietary technology to streamline the loan process for entrepreneurs so they can stay focused on running their business and get the funding they need in 2 to 4 weeks. Our revenue-based financing structure is faster and more flexible than traditional loans or VC funding. Unlike a bank, we do not require personal guarantees. And unlike a VC, we do not take an equity stake, require a board seat or otherwise try to control your company. Since 2010, we've provided funding to over 100 companies via 150 revenue-based loans. We'd welcome the chance to help your company grow. Apply today:http://www.lightercapital.com/applyLearn more:http://www.lightercapital.com/     Show Less

column6: Veritas Financial Partners is a leading national financial services firm that provides senior secured credit facilities to small and medium sized businesses. Veritas provides financing across a variety of industries and forms of collateral, including accounts receivable, inventory, machinery, equipment and owner occupied commercial real estate. Commitments range from $1 to $10 million, and often involve facilities that blend various forms of collateral, providing the client with a single financing solution. Facilities larger than $10 million are available through our network of participating lenders. - See more at: http://www.vfpfinancial.com/news/press-releases/#sthash.ys9YdDGR.dpuf    Show Less

column6: Atalaya Capital Management is an alternative investment firm primarily focused on investing in small and middle market credit opportunities. Since inception in early 2006, the Firm has successfully invested over $1 billion through the opportunistic purchase of private, senior secured credit from financial institutions and sellers in need of liquidity, and proprietary 'new issue' credit investments including DIP loans and other senior secured financings.

column6: Tennenbaum Capital Partners, LLC (TCP) is a leading multi-strategy alternative investment management firm focused primarily on credit opportunities. Since the firm's founding in 1999, TCP has invested $10 billion in approximately 200 portfolio companies through its credit opportunities strategy, in addition to investments by specialty funds focused on debtor-in-possession financing, and convertible and event-driven strategies. Today, the firm has capital under management of approximately $5 billion. TCP targets primarily U.S. middle-market credits where the firm can play a meaningful role in each situation, in investment positions of up to $250 million. Our principals have significant experience crafting unique solutions throughout the capital structure of both publicly-traded and privately-held companies. The firm's investment professionals combine deep industry sector knowledge with extensive expertise in financial, operational, trading and legal disciplines to successfully execute TCP's investment strategies. Integrity in dealing with our business associates, investors and the wider community is ingrained at TCP. The firm prides itself on its investor-friendly approach, and has been recognized for its endorsement of the ILPA (International Limited Partner Association) Private Equity Principles. We are a valued deal partner and we seek to build long-term relationships. TCP is committed to a long-lasting business based on quality and fair dealing.    Show Less

column6: UltegraåÊwas founded in 2012 and is rapidly growing to become a leading provider of Commercial Lending, Small Business Lending, Business Consulting and Cost Reduction Services. Ultegra is headquartered in Denver, Colorado and service clients throughout the United States via a sophisticated web-based client-centered platform. Ultegra specializes in providing merchant banking and lending solutions for small to middle-market companies. Our leadership team and carefully selected business partners bring to the market, unrivaled experience from the financial and business services industries. We serve as a direct lender, co-lender, and lead financial arranger. Ultegra prides itself in an ability to foster and maintain valuable business relationships with other reputable funders. This broadens our scope to secure the best financing for our clients. Ultegra also offers advisory, financial restructuring and other business services to help ensure the success of our clientele. More importantly, as the name suggests, Ultegra is a company that moves through the financial world withultimate integrity.    Show Less

column6: WBL provides small businesses with the working capital they need, when they need it. As a private and direct lender, we have our own underwriting guidelines (different from the banks) by which we make funding decisions in a matter of days. Where a bank may deny a strong business based on the owner‰Ûªs personal credit score, WBL looks at the overall health of the business to provide financing to business owners. column6: Lateral Investment Management provides non-dilutive credit financing to owner-operated and family-owned businesses which are navigating through discontinuous growth events. We provide non-sponsored, independent companies which generate $5 million to $100 million in revenues with an alternative to the dilution of private equity or the formulaic restrictions of bank debt. We work in partnership with management to help companies scale their existing and proven models and offer the appropriate financing for a specific company's needs, rather than applying a global template for ownership or minimum investment size. Lateral's partners combine decades of private equity, private debt and company operating experience in firms such as KKR, Highland, White Oak and Franklin Templeton. We see a huge opportunity to work with high-potential, owner-operated companies that are operating at sub-scale levels and are often overlooked by commercial banks and private equity firms. Our "special situations" credit financing approach which combines custom underwriting and value-added assistance can help these companies to scale and to achieve their maximum potential.    Show Less

column6: SWK Holdings Corporation is a publically-traded, specialized finance company with a focus on the global healthcare sector.  SWK partners with ethical product marketers and royalty holders to provide flexible financing solutions at an attractive cost of capital to create long-term value for both SWK‰Ûªs business partners and its investors.  SWK believes its financing structures achieve an optimal partnership for companies, institutions and inventors seeking capital for expansion or capital and estate planning by allowing its partners to monetize future cash flow with minimal dilution to their equity stakes.  Additional information on the life science finance market is available on the Company‰Ûªs website at www.swkhold.com as well as the company's SEC filings.    Show Less

column6: Fortress Investment Group LLC (NYSE: FIG) is a leading, highly diversified global investment management firm. Fortress applies its deep experience and specialized expertise across a range of investment strategies - private equity, credit, liquid markets and traditional asset management - on behalf of over 1,500 institutional investors and private clients worldwide. Fortress‰Ûªs Credit business was launched in 2002 by Pete Briger. Today, the Fortress Credit team consists of over 400 professionals and is focused on investing globally, primarily in undervalued assets and distressed and illiquid credit investments. The investment team, led by Co-CIOs Pete Briger and Dean Dakolias, has a long and established track record investing throughout a number of credit and distressed cycles around the world, including the RTC Workout and the Asian Financial Crisis. With over 100 professionals dedicated to asset management in over 15 geographic locations, the Fortress Credit team also has the experience and expertise to manage and service assets with operational complexity.    Show Less

column6: Yellowstone Capital is an innovative company, comprised of an expert team with years of industry experience in providing business owners with an alternative source of financing. Our relationships with our MCA industry partners allow us to get the impossible deals done, and our commitment to our clients ensures that every possible avenue is fully-explored.    Show Less
