column6: Brief Description: (more details below) Presidential Financial is an entrepreneurially-focused Senior Lender providing asset-based revolving lines of credit, working capital, and term financing to growing businesses. We offer lines of credit from $1 million to $20 million, and higher. Our footprint is nationwide. Target clients sell a product or service to other businesses (B2B) or to the government (B2G). Many of our clients are owned by private equity firms. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of MidFirst Bank, Presidential is one of the strongest and most versatile lenders in the markets that we serve. Detailed Description: Established in 1981, Presidential Financial provides customized and flexible financing solutions to growing businesses throughout the United States. Not only do we have more than three decades of experience in helping growing businesses; we also have more than thirty years worth of success stories. In early 2013, Presidential Financial was acquired by MidFirst Bank, one of the nation's largest privately held banks. MidFirst Bank is headquartered in Oklahoma City and serves more than 600,000 customers nationwide. What makes Presidential unique is that we combine the best of asset-based lending with the best of traditional banking. Presidential has a significant capital base, diverse product offerings, combined with a strong commitment to the growth capital needs of the entrepreneur. The benefits for our clients and for future prospects are tremendous. Presidential is one of the strongest and most versatile lenders in the markets that we serve. Presidential offers additional financing products to our clients, as well as the ability to fully service their financing and banking needs over all the seasons of their life cycle. We have experience in most B2B industries and actively seek opportunities in most industries except for general residential and commercial construction, although there are some types of industrial construction that we can consider. Our clients are manufacturers, service businesses, distributors, wholesalers, importers, staffing companies, healthcare providers, and more. Our core product is a line of credit utilizing accounts receivable and inventory as the primary collateral. In addition to the line of credit, we can also consider term debt and SBA financing opportunities. We are big believers in the entrepreneur, and our goal is to partner with entrepreneurs to help them achieve success. We also frequently partner with private equity firms in providing growth capital for their portfolio companies.    Show Less

column6: Oak Street was formed in 2003 to provide commission-based loans to help insurance agents and brokers maximize their book of business value and grow their agency business. After building successful finance companies through traditional lending channels, the founders of Oak Street Funding realized insurance agents and brokers had unmet needs for capital. Over the years, we've expanded to become a family of diversified companies that provides a suite of services, including Oak Street Funding services, Oak Street Lending services and Oak Street Servicing services. The Oak Street family of companies is wholly owned by Angelo, Gordon & Co., a private equity investment advisor that manages billions of dollars of assets. Oak Street Servicing specializes in third-party loan servicing for banks and financial institutions. We leverage proprietary technology and web-based reporting tools to maximize client visibility, control, and security over their asset portfolio. Our servicing system can be customized to support any loan structure and repayment terms.    Show Less

column6: Since the global financial crisis of 2008 the alternative capital market has become a formidable source of corporate and project finance. We are building the most trusted brand in this new, dynamic and sometimes hazardous market.We have established an enviable reputation amongst alternative investors such as asset managers, wealth managers and hedge funds for delivering top quality investment and lending opportunities, often asset backed and always driven by seasoned, world-class management teams.  For capital-raisers, we are gatekeepers to a wide range of alternative capital programs and structures. We are highly selective in the deals we accept in order not to degrade our service to capital raisers and the quality of deal origination for our funders. Our clients are treated with respect, there are no 'muppet clients' here!We are project financiers handling infrastructure, energy, marine, resort and similar major projects with deal values usually of $100m+. More details on our funding programs in the 'Project Finance' zone.    Show Less

column6: Monroe Capital LLC, established in 2004, is a leading provider of senior and junior debt and equity co-investments to middle market companies in the U.S. and Canada. Our affiliate, Monroe Credit Advisors, is a middle market debt advisory group that focuses specifically on providing solutions to our clients navigating today‰Ûªs challenging debt markets. Monroe Capital‰Ûªs investment types include unitranche financings, cash flow and enterprise value based loans, acquisition facilities, mezzanine debt, second lien or last-out loans and equity co-investments. Monroe Capital prides itself on its flexible investment approach and its ability to close and fund transactions quickly. Monroe Credit Advisors has helped middle market companies raise and structure over $1 billion of debt capital. We also provide advisory services for companies seeking guidance with their existing lending relationships or navigating through challenging credit issues. We serve privately owned, sponsor-backed and publicly traded middle market firms with strategies designed for today‰Ûªs dynamic credit markets.    Show Less

column6: Crestmark, an FDIC bank, was founded in 1996 to offer funding solutions to businesses that did not qualify for credit from traditional banks. It offers: accounts receivable financing, asset-based lending, business lines of credit, factoring (both discounted and traditional), equipment leasing and financing, SBA financing, and term loans. The company‰Ûªs customized financing solutions are utilized by business clients across the United States. Crestmark has a five-star rating from Bauer Financial, and has been recognized by Inc. magazine for its growth among privately held companies.Crestmark provides funding for: ‰Û¢	Expansion / Acquisition / Growth‰Û¢	Restructuring / Refinancing‰Û¢	Turnarounds‰Û¢	Recapitalization‰Û¢	Supplier discounts‰Û¢	Customized, Flexible, Financial Services Business-to-Business financing for the following industries:‰Û¢	Manufacturing‰Û¢	Staffing‰Û¢	Transportation‰Û¢	Apparel/Furniture‰Û¢	Government Receivables‰Û¢	Oil and Gas Well Service‰Û¢	and many, many more!    Show Less

column6: Do you need a Hard Money Loan for your next real estate purchase or refinance fast? If your story makes sense we will fund you. Our loans run from $50k to $3 Million. We fund: any type of investment property, land, apartments, non-homestead flips, lake shore, commercial, Industrial & development. We also provide short refinance pay-offs and transitional hard money loans. We fund our loans when title work is complete 7-10 days. Most of our hard money loans are from 6 to 12 months. We also purchase contract for deeds, hard money loans and real estate notes.

column6: GemCap‰Ûªs founders previously owned and operated manufacturing/wholesale and retail operations. Our experience ranges across industrial manufacturing, consumer manufacturing, to logistics. We‰Ûªve been hands-on in shop floors, walked the oil patch, stood in freeze tunnels. We‰Ûªve worried about quality, on-time deliveries, and payroll. We think our perspective might be different than your typical lender.We focus solely on small to mid-size businesses‰Û_ those responsible for over 90% of employment. No two businesses are the same, which is why we don‰Ûªt try to put you in a box. We strive to be flexible and make our loans fit your business.Isn‰Ûªt lending a business, too? We appreciate our customers and the opportunity to serve. Do you have the mobile number for the president of your current lender? GemCap operates like a business: quick decisions, accessibility, and a focus on customer service.    Show Less

column6: Thermo Credit is a privately held funding company that provides asset based loans and factoring services primarily to the communications industry. With over 100 years of combined experience in communications and financial services, Thermo Credit targets established companies in every segment of the communications market including Long Distance, VoIP, Triple Play, Wholesale, Wireless, ISPs, CLECs and Content Providers. Thermo Credit has never been your typical funding company. From the start, we have focused solely on providing funding to well-run communications companies seeking operating capital. That‰Ûªs why, even now, we are here, ready, and still providing communications companies with the funding they need to prosper. Thermo Credit understands that today‰Ûªs cash flow problems are affecting even the best of companies. If you know of a good communications company seeking funding, give us a call.    Show Less

column6: Our focus on underwriting the underlying intrinsic value of a business enables us to creatively invest in a broad spectrum of credit risk. We are able to fully underwrite single lien structures ranging in size from $20 million to $150 million. These fully underwritten, one-stop financing solutions incorporate first lien, second lien and mezzanine risk in a simple capital structure that eliminates inter-creditor issues and syndication risk, enabling fast and reliable closings. We also have the flexibility to invest in individual tranches of debt.Our people determine our success. Our highly skilled team of investing professionals allows us to develop unique perspectives and craft creative solutions that demonstrate substantive differences for our borrowers.We invest capital with a long-term focus. This investing culture allows us to focus our time and effort on understanding our borrowers‰Ûª long-term fundamentals.We are committed to the middle market. Our focus is on middle market companies, delivering flexible, reliable capital while leveraging the firm-wide resources of Goldman Sachs.We value relationships and building trust. We create strong, lasting relationships with owners and managers and build the trust of our borrowers by honoring commitments, responding to needs and communicating directly.    Show Less

column6: VION Investments, headquartered in Atlanta is global advisory provider of receivable investment services to businesses managing consumer and commercial receivables.  VION provides a single, comprehensive source of expertise in receivable purchasing, consulting, and valuation.VION‰Ûªs industry leading management team can help any business owner, turnaround manager, or lending institution facing issues of liquidity, covenant restrictions, and compliance. We also have solutions available to deal with the unique requirements affecting specialized industries, such as specialty finance, medical, automotive, and education.VION is able to purchase, administer, and collect all accounts, including those that are performing, nonperforming, reperforming, delinquent, and charged-off.  All categories of consumer and commercial receivables are evaluated for purchase, including:‰Û¢ A/R Securitization‰Û¢ Payment Plan Agreements (PPAs)‰Û¢ Judgments‰Û¢ Charge OffsSince VION‰Ûªs inception in 2008, VION has purchased almost $12 billion in performing and non-performing receivables.    Show Less

column6: Guggenheim Investments works in partnership with both companies and their sponsors to provide privately negotiated debt capital across all tranches of the capital structure. Over the past 10 years, Guggenheim has invested approximately $6.3 billion in over 127 directly-originated private debt transactions across the US, Canada and Europe. The Private Debt team seeks opportunities to provide first lien, second lien, unitranche, mezzanine and equity co-investments to companies across all industries in support of leveraged buy-outs, acquisitions, recapitalizations and liquidity. Each financing solution is tailored to provide the ability to grow in line with the business over time with the goal of creating long term partnerships. The information presented herein has been prepared for informational purposes only and is not an offer for an extension of credit, a commitment to make a loan or purchase securities and any prospective financing is still subject to internal credit approval. All content has been provided for informational purposes only. It is not intended to be, and should not be construed as, (i) a recommendation; (ii) legal or tax advice; and/or (iii) a legal opinion.    Show Less

column6: BBVA Compass ranks among the top 25 largest U.S. commercial banks and provides a full array of Commercial Banking, Wealth Management and Consumer banking solutions, products and services.  BBVA Compass has 667 retail branches in 7 sunbelt states and has national commercial banking coverage through 51 offices across the U.S. BBVA Compass Commercial Banking serves its clients through local teams of bankers who specialize in serving companies based on revenue size.  Our local bankers are supported by a team of specialists in various industries, credit products and services.  In this way, BBVA Compass provides local execution supported by the expertise and know-how of a major national bank. BBVA Compass is backed by the strength and global acumen of BBVA Group, a $[750]B global bank recognized for its stability, innovation, and socially responsible approach to business. With operations in over 30 countries, BBVA has a leading market share position in Spain, Mexico, South America, and Turkey, as well as operations throughout Europe and Asia. Through a consultative and strategic relationship, BBVA Compass enables you to realize your ambitions, aspirations and opportunities.  We‰Ûªll share information and insights from our experience banking companies in your industry across the country so that you benefit from large-bank capabilities as well as our knowledge of local markets.  Whatever your business goals may be, our solutions can help pave the way for a brighter future    Show Less

column6: Based in Chicago, Gibraltar Business Capital is a subsidiary of Gibraltar Capital Holdings, a long-standing, well-capitalized national small-business lender serving companies in the lower middle market. We handle loan structures ranging from traditional, non-bank asset based lending supported by accounts receivable and inventory, to factoring lines of credit using accounts receivable, to Chapter 11 financing or post-bankruptcy funding.  Our market-leading small-business loan solutions, backed by long-term investments from Southern California‰Ûªs CCCC Growth Fund and Dallas-based Satori Capital, coupled with an ample line of credit from Wells Fargo, are secured through receivables, inventory and equipment. Ultimately, the strength of our capital support and balance sheet help us to do what we do best: provide small businesses that need working capital with the critical funds they require to grow.    Show Less

column6: Silver Point Finance LLC is the principal finance group within Silver Point Capital, L.P. (together with its affiliates, ‰ÛÏSilver Point‰Ûù), an SEC registered investment adviser focused on credit and special situation investing.  Founded in 2002 by former Goldman Sachs partners, Silver Point Capital, L.P. today manages approximately $8 billion and has over 155 employees, 50 of which are investment professionals.Silver Point has established itself as a leader in complex financing solutions, priding itself on its experience and expertise in structuring highly customized credit facilities.  Silver Point lends across a broad spectrum of industries, geographies and capital structures, seeking out and catering to borrowers in ‰ÛÏspecial situations‰Ûù - which include, but are not limited to:  i) borrowers in immediate need of capital; ii) borrowers with collateral consisting of non-traditional and/or difficult to value assets; iii) borrowers undergoing a material corporate change or legal challenge; iv) borrowers in a misunderstood or out of favor industry, and v) borrowers with a complicated and/or inefficient capital structure.  Since Silver Point‰Ûªs founding in 2002, Silver Point has funded over $9bn in special situation loans to 130 companies in numerous industries, including health care, energy/power, gaming, real estate, media/telecom/technology, and general industrials, among others.     Show Less

column6: Plus Funding Group offers a wide range of senior capital solutions to smaller to lower mid-sized growing companies in a variety of industries. We seek to provide individualized solutions to help maximize a client‰Ûªs full potential. We focus on receivables finance, but if a client has a strong receivables profile we will also provide financing for purchase orders, work in process, inventory and property, plant and equipment.  Among our areas of focus and expertise have been aerospace component  and  precision machine tool manufacturers, information technology consulting and staffing firms, commercial energy  efficiency firms, other businesses services firms, and a wide range of apparel manufacturers and importers. We are affiliated with a family office, with our own capital base, and are not a broker. Our team combines years of financial operational and legal experience, all brought together  to help customize solutions for our clients‰Ûª specific situation.      Show Less

column6: Marblegate Asset Management, LLC is a credit investment firm founded in 2009. The firm primarily invests in bank loans to middle market companies across a wide variety of industries throughout North America.  We work in partnership with company management, lenders and other key stakeholders, and utilize our creativity to pursue innovative corporate finance and restructuring solutions that aim to achieve an expeditious and effective resolution for all parties.  Marblegate is based in Greenwich, Connecticut and has been a registered investment adviser with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission since 2012.    Show Less

column6: Sterling Commercial Credit is a family owned and operated commercial financial service company. Sterling provides cash flow solutions to small business owners providing: Lines of credit, invoice factoring, and purchase order financing to small businesses nationwide. Collateral for these transactions are secured by: Accounts receivable, inventory, machinery & equipment, and purchase orders, Alternative financing is appealing to businesses that are fast growth, start-ups with strong experience leaders, merger and acquisition, bank exits, bank turn downs, and debtor in possession opportunities. SCC‰Ûªs target customers have annual sales from $500,000 to $25,000,000. Common industries include manufacturers, distributors, service B2B, transportation, staffing, tool and die, oil and gas services, government service providers and broker transportation.    Show Less

column6: Entrepreneur Growth Capital has been providing working capital to small and mid-sized businesses since 1937.In fact, it is still owned and managed by the third generation of its founding family. We know how to use our capital to help your business succeed. We don‰Ûªt get bogged down by bureaucracy and red tape; we create solutions efficiently and fairly.Our working capital solutions include; factoring,  ABL, asset based lines of credit, revolving lines of credit, accounts receivable financing, short term credit facilities, merchant cash advances, bridge and mezzanine financing. If you are an ENTREPRENEUR seeking GROWTH and in need of CAPITAL, come see how our experience can help you succeed.    Show Less

column6: Thank you for viewing our profile. If you are interested in connecting or learning more, please reach out to Mike Akers. BPV seeks to generate strong absolute returns on a consistent basis by primarily investing in private and public debt securities. BPV seeks to invest a majority of its assets in private debt opportunities in smaller companies, a segment that is being underserved by the commercial banking and mezzanine debt markets. In addition, BPV also invests in public opportunities to meet stated liquidity objectives. BPV attempts to provide for investor flexibility with its evergreen fund structure, investment minimums, and liquidity features. Fund management has over 50 years of collective financial and operational experience dealing with private firms. BPV has demonstrated that attractive risk-adjusted returns can be achieved through a disciplined investment and management approach in this asset class.    Show Less

column6: Summit Financial Resources provides working capital financing to small and medium-sized businesses in a broad range of industries. We provide cash flow solutions to companies requiring a financing structure that cannot be provided by banks or other commercial finance sources. We understand the challenges of operating a business in today‰Ûªs competitive environment, and our ability to be a responsive, flexible financial partner separates us from our competition. Our success is proven by the long-term relationships we build with our clients, which in turn allow them to be successful. We welcome the opportunity to work with you. We believe our unique, experienced approach to our business, combined with our financial strength, makes Summit Financial Resources a superior source of financing.    Show Less

column6: CapFlow Funding Group ("CFG") is a privately owned and operated specialty finance, and alternative funding platform. We focus on providing working capital access to small and mid-sized businesses in the U.S. that have historically been underserved by traditional financial institutions and may have experienced challenges obtaining timely financing. Our team brings to the table more than 60 years of institutional investment banking experience in the commercial finance and capital markets. We offer traditional commercial finance products such as accounts receivable factoring and purchase order finance via CFG, and merchant cash advance solutions via our subsidiary company, CFGMS.CFG‰Ûªs financing programs are designed for small and mid-sized businesses experiencing:  Rapid Growth  Seasonal Sales  Unable to Secure Traditional Bank Financing  Acquisition Stage/New Ownership  Tax Liens  Challenging Financial Position ‰ÛÒ Net Operating Losses, Negative Cash Flow and High LeverageCFG‰Ûªs Benefits Include:  Flexible Funding Structure  No Need for Personal Cash or to Raise Additional Dilutive Equity  Competitive Pricing and Terms  Fast and Simple Funding Process  Improves and Increases Cash Flow  Allows for the Advantage of Vendor Discounts along with Opportunistic Purchases and New SalesCFG‰Ûªs Programs Offer:  Revolving Facilities from $20K - $7.5 Million  Advance Rates up to 90% of the Invoice Amount  Instant Liquidity on Invoices  Fast, Simple and Easy Funding Process    Show Less

column6: Aegis Business Credit provides working capital financing to middle market companies to support revenue and asset growth as well restructuring and recapitalization. Aegis clients are  manufacturers, distributors, and  service providers for a wide variety of industry sectors.  In addition, Aegis is an Asset Based Lender with specific experience and expertise in lending to companies operating in the B2G (business to government) space.

column6: Sallyport Commercial Finance is an independently owned and operated, specialty finance company focused on providing entrepreneurs with working capital solutions for their small and medium sized businesses, to help them drive growth and achieve their business hopes and dreams.Sallyport Commercial Finance was formed with a focus on serving its clients across the US, from its headquarters in Houston.Our professionals have worked in all major energy centric locations, such as East and West Texas, North Dakota, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Northeast US and Western US.Furthermore, our professionals are drawn from major trading and commerce hubs in the US, as well as having worked around the world.    Show Less

column6: Mackinac Commercial Credit  is the ABL division of mBank, a subsidiary of Mackinac Financial Corporation, (NASDAQ symbol MFNC) that provides asset based lines of credit from $500,000 to $5,000,000 to companies outside of traditional bank financing. Our collateral-backed lending solutions which entail lending on accounts receivable, inventory and equipment are ideal for small to mid-sized companies and second-stage companies that need alternative cash flow strategies to meet the financial obligations of the business.Mackinac Commercial Credit brings years of alternative financing experience from a host of industries, including: manufacturing, service, private equity, venture capital, and commercial lending. Our diverse background enables us to understand and assist in the execution of your business plan. We work directly with business owners, supporting them through various demanding situations such as bankruptcies, buyouts, mergers, periods of rapid growth, restructurings and turnarounds.    Show Less

column6: Able provides the lowest-cost online lending solutions to small businesses & lower middle market companies in the nation. Our passion is to fund businesses at any stage with a new kind of loan that lets borrowers get more capital at lower rates when they recruit some support from friends, family and fans. column6: Happily DifferentAt 12five Capital we provide simple, easy to understand, commercial finance to small and medium sized businesses. We see ourselves as lenders of first resort, not last resort like many in our industry. Our goal is to get our clients to the point where they no longer need us to run their business. Different, we know. Clients that we 'graduate' to bank financing are the ones we love having and also bring us the most joy and satisfaction. We are truly a happily different finance company.  Simple Is BeautifulThe simpler we can make something, the better it works for everyone. We focus on helping clients who are in the 'Growth' stage of their business. We believe this stage is after a business has established it's identity and goals, but before they are able to obtain bank financing. We can help you get there in a simple, easy to understand format. Compassionate RealismOur mission is cultivating the passion of our people, be it employees or clients, and it shows in how we work. We also lean heavily on our core values to keep us on track and focused on what's important.Optimism Above All ElseWith a wide array of clients who focus on many different business sectors, we at 12five Capital are able to leverage our knowledge and experience to help your company get to where you want to go compassionately and efficiently, while avoiding some of the common pitfalls we've encountered in the past. We can't wait to show you what a true financial partnership can be.Check us out at 12five.com    Show Less

column6: Utica Leaseco is the Nation's premier equipment and machinery lender. Founded in 2005, Utica focuses on providing Sale-Leasebacks, Capital Leases, Bridge Loans, and Revolving Lines of Credit to non-bankable industrial and commercial enterprises supported by existing pools of machinery and equipment. We operate across a wide range of sectors. Utica provides transactions ranging between $300,000.00 and $50,000,000.00 for 48 to 60 month terms. We are the funding source and hold our own paper.Our team of legal and equipment experts can ensure a quick closing and competitive pricing, fund incremental sales, restructure your current debt and fund future growth capital without the hassle of bank loans, financial covenants or long term commitments.     Show Less

column6: AMCI Finance is an asset based senior lender financing opportunities throughout the Western United States.  Since 1985, AMCI has worked with companies across many industries to provide flexible solutions to their capital needs including lines of credit for accounts receivables, inventory and equipment, flooring of inventory, equipment leasing for new and used equipment and sale/lease-back for existing equipment. We've figured out over the last 30+ years how to provide funding that others can't or won't. Usually, AMCI is the most cost effective solution to meet the customers immediate and short-term financial challenges. Similar to a bank, our rate/fees are ‰ÛÏPrime Plus‰Ûù but slightly higher because we do what a bank can‰Ûªt. In addition, we‰Ûªre not bankers, but business people who‰Ûªve owned, operated and financed businesses. http://amcifinance.com/.    Show Less

column6: Alliance Business Lending (ABL) was founded by Jerry Kohlhepp, Steve Kieffner and John Cain. Messers Kohlhepp and Kieffner have over 65 years of asset-based lending experience. The recession and credit crisis in 2007-2009 dramatically changed the landscape for banks and business, especially small business. The debt market for small business has become very limited and without adequate credit business growth is restrained. The founder‰Ûªs envisioned this as an opportunity to both assist the banking community and small business, so they embarked upon the process of creating an independent commercial finance company to provide asset-based lending.The end result was the formation of Alliance Business Lending, LLC that is capitalized with a private equity placement and a substantial line of credit. ABL has an independent board comprised of seven managing members including the founders.ABL offers working capital lines of credit secured by accounts receivable and inventory. It provides state of the art collateral monitoring and loan administration services, and is only focused on the small business market within Ohio, Kentucky, Indiana, West Virginia, Tennessee, Pennsylvania, Illinois, Michigan and Wisconsin. ABL is poised and driven to be the lender of preference in this market.    Show Less

column6: Headquartered in New York City, Capstone is a private finance company focused on accelerating client cash flow.We provide client-specific solutions through Factoring Services (Accounts Receivable Financing), Purchase Order (PO) Financing and Domestic and International Trade Financing. Our services offer results to construction trades, service companies, and wholesalers.Combining client assets and resources with our advanced logistics platform, Capstone provides customer outcomes through the following entities:Capstone Business Funding, LLC specializes in Single Invoice Factoring ( ‰ÛÏSpot Factoring‰Ûù ) for firms in need of immediate cash. Spot Factoring provides flexible, no contract invoice selling in exchange for working capital from Capstone Business Funding. Capstone Credit, LLC focuses on discount and collection Factoring and Purchasing Accounts Receivable from clients. Capstone Capital Group, LLC provides Trade Financing, PO Financing, and short-term, asset supported loans for clients. Capstone Capital Group delivers guaranteed bank payment instruments to global manufacturers and suppliers. In exchange, we promise distribution of presold merchandise to its clients.    Show Less

column6: Since 1995, Brook Venture Partners has invested in or acquired controlling interest in over 40 expansion stage companies in the Northeastern and Mid-Atlantic US. We are focused on profitable companies in the software, healthcare IT and tech-enabled business service industries, with initial investments typically under $12 million. We are currently investing from Brook Partner Fund III which is focused on acquisitions and majority investments of comanies generating $2-30 million in revenue with earnings between $1-4 million with recurring revenue streams. We provide financing to profitable, expansion stage companies. Investment dollars are targeted to support the accelerated business development and sales growth of portfolio companies &ndash effectively scaling an already proven model to help these companies capitalize on their respective market opportunities. We act as lead investor and play an active role in building strong, outside-dominated boards where investors and industry experts add significant value. Our team is highly focused on sales & marketing acceleration and works with the portfolio companies to maximize lead generation, sales conversion rates and overall sales and marketing activity. Beginning at the time of investment Brook works with management teams to build portfolio companies toward exit.    Show Less

column6: Johnson & Johnson Development Corporation (JJDC) is the venture capital subsidiary of Johnson & Johnson. JJDC is comprised of experts and leaders in the health care and technology venture communities who identify early market indicators, health care trends, and strategic investment opportunities. Unlike traditional venture capital firms, JJDC determines the success of an investment's performance not only in financial returns, but also in the viability of providing strategic growth options for Johnson & Johnson.JJDC plays an integral role within Johnson & Johnson Corporate Development in the identification of new business opportunities outside of Johnson & Johnson's traditional portfolio and market presence. JJDC identifies white space opportunities and develops new businesses in emergent health care sectors while also creating support venture investments in alignment with the strategic objectives of Johnson & Johnson operating companies.    Show Less

column6: Redpoint Ventures has helped entrepreneurs build innovative businesses that defy convention, shape the future, and change the world. From early investments in industry pioneers like Netflix, TiVo, and Juniper to companies such as RightMedia, Zimbra, Heroku, LifeSize, Danger, Fortinet, and HomeAway, we stand behind our entrepreneurs helping them go all the way to the top. With our deep experience and focus on quality, we offer entrepreneurs a culture and approach that values mutual respect, meaningful relationships, and an intense commitment to succeed. Redpoint (http://www.redpoint.com) was founded in 1999 and currently has over $2.5 billion under management. Its partners have been involved in 41 IPOs and 66 upside acquisitions. The firm is headquartered in Menlo Park, CA with offices in Los Angeles, SÌ£o Paulo, Brazil and Shanghai, China. Redpoint's portfolio includes leaders in Consumer Internet Services & Applications; Broadband Infrastructure; Enterprise Software & Cloud Computing; Interactive Media, Content & Advertising; Mobile Platforms and Applications; Semiconductor Materials and Devices; Energy and Environment; and Other Areas of Interest. The consistent thread running through each of these companies: Great entrepreneurs developing innovative technologies that address large market opportunities. A list of current investments can be found at: http://redpoint.com/portfolio/current-investments/.    Show Less

column6: Innovative Food Holdings is actively seeking to acquire specialty food related businesses as add on acquisitions to it's growing specialty food platform. In addition, Innovative Food Holdings makes synergistic investments in early stage food and foodtech businesses. Innovative Food Holdings also manages Food Hatch, a food and foodtech focused investment accelerator. Innovative Food Holdings, through its subsidiaries, is a leading nationwide provider of direct from source specialty foods, healthcare foods, gluten free foods, and unique artisanal foods, to the professional foodservice market. Innovative Food Holdings also manages the leading 4PL white label specialty food program in the United Sates. Core focus is on Foodservice with a growing presence in the direct to consumer space. Many of Innovative Food Holdings' 7,000+ products are used on a daily basis by approximately 30,000 of some of the leading professional chefs and home chefs across the United States.    Show Less

column6: The problemIn Indiana, Ohio, and the surrounding region, there is a significant gap between the number of early-stage companies seeking venture capital and the amount of venture capital targeting such investments. Angel investor (high net worth individuals) activity and state-based support for start-up companies have been accelerating ‰ÛÓ driving the creation of more businesses seeking venture capital. At the same time, several of the early-stage venture firms that historically served this region, particularly those investing outside of the life sciences, are no longer making new investments. Others have shifted to later-stage (i.e. already profitable) companies. And, firms based on the coasts are hesitant to invest in "flyover" land, or at the very least like to have a local lead. All of these trends have made it hard for entrepreneurs to continue the momentum started with the help of their friends, family members, and angel investors.Enter AllosWe formed Allos in early 2010 to help fill this gap. We only invest in early-stage companies, augmenting the capital provided by angel investors who have helped the companies reach a stage at which they are ready for their first institutional financing round. While Allos may be relatively new, we are leveraging the investment experience and business-building skills and resources developed over the past decade by our principals ‰ÛÓ Don Aquilano, John McIlwraith, and Dov Rosenberg ‰ÛÓ atGazelle TechVentures and Blue Chip Venture Company, through those firms' investments in over 100 companies. Additionally, many of our investors are successful technology company entrepreneurs, allowing us to tap into an even broader experience base of business-building expertise.Don and John have worked together in the venture capital business for a decade, and with Dov for over five years, and we all share a common view of the benefits of a "hands-on" approach to venture capital investing ‰ÛÓ benefits both to our partner companies and our investors. This vision drives everything we do ‰ÛÓ from the number of investments we'll make (a select group of about 12 companies in the current fund), to the geography we cover (places we can drive to in 4-5 hours), to theindustries we'll invest in (only things we know well).Things we strive to doLead your syndicate ‰ÛÓ too many venture firms like to wait for the round to come together, rather than commit to help you make it come together; we'll develop a mutually-agreeable term sheet with you and work to build the best investor syndicate for your companyStick to our knitting ‰ÛÓ just like we stress to our entrepreneur partners, we focus on what we know best: early-stage companies in industries where our investment professionals have operating and/or investing experienceBe responsive ‰ÛÓ including getting back to you within two days of an initial meeting with our decision and next stepsAdd value as a hands-on partner in growing your business ‰ÛÓ we're experienced early-stage investors who can contribute meaningfully to the success of your business in areas such as board and management recruiting, fundraising, and strategic and exit planningStay out of your way while you run your company ‰ÛÓ while we have operating backgrounds and will seek to add value where we can, we only back entrepreneurial teams we believe can build their businesses, and don't invest with the intention of replacing the teamCheck out our case studies for some specific examples of how we've worked with our partner companies in the past, and our recent news to see the great progress our current partner companies are making.Things we won't doPhone in to your board meetings (and listen only part of the time), or show up late, leave early, and play with our iPhones in between ‰ÛÓ we actually enjoy spending time helping our partner companies, and we'll do it in person (even between board meetings, if you invite us)Sit on dozens of company boards, and ask you to remind us at every board meeting what your company does ‰ÛÓ we are going to invest in a select group of companies, so we will have time to properly engage and learn about your businessMake you run a gauntlet through an inexperienced associate ‰ÛÓ a partner will will be engaged with you from the first phone call (plus, we don't have any associates)Treat a term sheet as a starting point for further negotiation ‰ÛÓ we don't deliver term sheets until the majority of our due diligence is complete, so while a subsequent find could stop us from ultimately investing, we don't use the due diligence process as leverage for better terms after locking you in early in the process    Show Less

column6: Citi Ventures is Citi's global corporate venturing arm, chartered to collaborate with internal and external partners to conceive, partner, launch, and scale new ventures that have the potential to disrupt and transform the financial services industry, drive client success, and generate new value for Citi.The Citi Ventures Team Drives Growth Through A Combination Of Three Complementary Activities: INVESTING in disruptive ventures relevant to Citi businesses and the financial services industryPARTNERING EXTERNALLY with leading companies, either directly or through joint ventures, to develop and deliver new forms of valuePARTNERING INTERNALLY with Citi businesses to identify and nurture innovation initiatives from concept to launch and ultimately scale across the enterpriseWe are particularly interested in ventures pursuing transformational technologies, including those that:‰Û¢åÊleverage the power of social media and information analytics in the digital age‰Û¢åÊfacilitate continuous mobility‰Û¢ increase security and prevent fraud‰Û¢ introduce new forms of digital goods and servicesWe are also interested in companies developing new concepts and services that better address the financial needs of individuals and organizations.    Show Less

column6: Capital Midwest Fund is a venture capital firm that invests primarily in areas where the Midwest spends most of its research dollars: life science and information technology.The fund concentrates on investments where companies have excellent management and technology, are performing an important function, and will address significant markets. We look for management with successful previous experience; markets that are established and growing; defensible IP positions; and sustainable competitive advantages.The principals of the fund are professionals who have operated in the investment banking, investing, life science and technology industries for many years. They have significant experience in raising money for early-stage companies and sourcing deals. In addition, they have significant experience in assisting management teams prepare viable business plans, evaluate strategic partnerships, and craft lucrative exits.    Show Less

column6: There's a simple premise behind the founding of General Catalyst (GC) in 2000: entrepreneurs are best served by those who've been in their shoes. In fact, all of GC's managing directors are accomplished entrepreneurs in their own right. We're familiar with the challenges you face. And we thrive on our ability to use our entrepreneurial experience to assist, guide, and nurture entrepreneurs on their journey. As a venture capital firm focusing on Early Stage and XIR/Growth investments, we're thrilled to encounter and delight in helping exceptional entrepreneurs and innovative companies bring a new product to market or transform an industry. But it's more than just writing a big check. We're tireless in our business-building and partnership development assistance. Are we right for each other? When it comes to our companies, we're attuned to bold, restless, clear-thinking entrepreneurs, who have the ability to hold optimism and reality in balance with one another. We favor large market opportunities and a capital-efficient approach to company-building. And we see no reason why we shouldn't have fun together. We at GC specialize in two broad stages of investment: Early Stage and XIR/Growth. We have ten managing partners and tend to be active participants with our portfolio companies, helping with team building, business development and strategy. We currently have approximately $3.0 billion of committed capital under management across seven funds. Our Early Stage practice focuses on investments of a particular kind: Hatch ‰ÛÒ incubating and funding ideas created through our partners and ecosystem of entrepreneurs Seed ‰ÛÒ funding an idea that is brought to us in its earliest, most fragile stage Series A ‰ÛÒ traditional early stage funding for companies that have proven an initial set of assumptions and attracted a core management team Our XIR/growth practice seeks out companies that would benefit from our management, business building and financial expertise. We focus on companies with greater than $10M in revenue, generally profitable in the $3M-30M EBITDA range, and exhibiting high growth. We're open to minority and majority recapitalizations for shareholder liquidity and management buy-outs, though we favor businesses with strong entrepreneurial leaders that expect to stay in place after we complete an investment.    Show Less

column6: Whitecliff Capital Partners is dedicated to working with management teams of small and mid-sized businesses to build shareholder value.  We provide equity capital as well as financial, strategic and other business expertise in order to assist owners and management teams.  Since 1991, Whitecliff has invested in over 25 businesses, facilitating transfers of ownership and providing companies with capital for growth. Our industry focus is quite expansive, including  technology, manufacturing, services and distribution companies. We look for companies that have strong management teams, well-defined business niches and strong growth potential. Through disciplined investment selection, active involvement with our portfolio companies and reliance on the operating skills of management teams, we expect to achieve solid rates of return for all shareholders.    Show Less

column6: Boston Millennia Partners has a long and successful history of venture capital investing on a national scope. Our Core Company Investment Strategy, combined with our international network of relationships and our deep industry expertise, sets us apart and enables us to add value to our portfolio companies.We look for investment opportunities within the healthcare IT & services, pharmaceutical services, and technology-enabled business services.We seek to partner with entrepreneurs who share our goal of building enduring, large-scale businesses that result in personal fulfillment and superior financial returns. Over the past twenty years, we have developed an investment approach that centers on active participation with our portfolio companies. Our goal is to be valuable and effective investors, while at the same time establishing productive relationships with our business partners that create long-term value. For more information, see our "What We Look For" section.Our investing philosophy is guided by our Core Company Investment Strategy, which accelerates the growth of a company through strategic consolidation within an industry. By following a targeted merger and acquisitions plan, a core portfolio company can quickly increase its scale and broaden the scope of its product and service offerings. The result is a company that replicates a proven business model around an existing core platform to build a large, high-growth enterprise. Within the past twenty years, core companies in our portfolio have completed over 160 strategic acquisitions.The growth and success of our portfolio companies have, in turn, allowed us to grow and expand our capital base to over $700 million. As our firm has grown, we have built a worldwide network. Investors from over a dozen countries have entrusted us to manage capital on their behalf.     Show Less

column6: Shift Ventures works to make ideas become successful business realities. This is achieved by our careful preparation and enterprising approach.We maintain strict confidentiality and a highly discreet approach at all time.Initially we gain a thorough understanding of your aspirations and business. Beyond taking a strictly business approach to analysis, we look at each situation from a number of perspecitives:entrepreneurialfinancialtechnicalsocialcontextualWe need to understand not only how your business operates now, but also how it will likely stand up in the changing competitive landscape of the future. From that point we develop complex financial, technical and operational models for moving forward.Armed with this knowledge, we can help structure deals, recruit senior executives, establish partnerships, set up premises and working operations.We can arrange for financing directly through our own pool, or broker financing through a network of contacts inthe international financial marketplace.Opportunity and Wealth CreationIt is in our best interests to identify projects that hold potential for both opportunity and wealth creation. We can help business to think laterally - identifying opportunities for growth that may not have been plainly visible. In working with numerous companies, synergies become visible to us that would not be a visible in the marketplace.Our team reviews and recommends at every level of an enterprise. we are not strictly interested in brokering finance deals and walking away. In fact, most business failures are not the result of lack of finance, they are the result of the lack of business skills. Many times it is not money a company needs to grow and succeed. Some times they need:operational expertisemanagement resourcesmarketing skillsproject management skillsentrepreneurial visionsales supportlong term planning and strategyShift Ventures has the resources and contacts to build a plan from the ground up that includes access to both capital and human resources. We supply the necessary tools to create opportunities and generate wealth for our clients.Anglo CanadianOur Trans-Atlantic operation allows clients to take advantage of the similarities in approach and markets between the Britain and North America. Expansion across these territories can be a relatively simple way of gaining disproportionate benefits.Established businesses can offset existing overheads and tap a whole new market place by setting up Trans-Atlantic arrangements. We can smooth the process so that what might seem a relatively complex exercise is, in fact, a simple and highly successful development and typically less cost than expected. Well established processes can be readily transferred, costs can be spread and an existing offer can be made available to a whole, new population.Because of the commonality between the UK and Canada, commercial links between these two countries can, of course, be an important stepping stone for much larger markets. The UK provides excellent access to Europe and Canada can serve as a secure gateway to the US.    Show Less

column6: Formed in July 2012, Boston-based Fort Point Angels, an angel investment fund, makes seed and early-stage investments in growth-industry New England-based companies.Industries in which Fort Point invests include healthcare; medical device; transportation; consumer goods, products, and services; and, with other angel groups as co-investors, technology. We invest as an individual fund, or we co-invest and syndicate with other angel groups or VC companies. Fort Point has a diversification investment approach - our strategy is to grow our portfolio and invest in a large number of organizations. Our members have already committed capital, and managing partners make all investment decisions about where and how much to invest.After making an investment, Fort Point can participate in management and board activities; assist in future rounds of financing; and help you develop strategic partnerships, grow, and prosper. Named for Boston's up-and-coming Innovation District in the Seaport area of South Boston, Fort Point is comprised of successful entrepreneurs who have a proven track record of success.Entrepreneurs are welcome to submit business plans.    Show Less

column6: Tandem Capitale was created in 1991 for the purpose of seeking out capital requirements for startup companies enabling them to bring their product to the marketplace. Since then, lead by Randy McCormick, Tandem now operates with a network of buyers and sellers to find equity partners and lenders for well established Canadian and U.S. companies. Tandem also plays a role as consultant in the preparation mergers & acquisitions.

column6: VentureLab works with entrepreneurs and early-stage companies to identify their core needs. We call it The VentureLab Process.A rare form of success is achieved when fueling the passion of an entrepreneurial founder with the resources of an expert team.
